review_content:
Bottiglia da 66 cl.
Schiuma colore bianco non molto persistente. Colore dorato. Aroma di malto. Corpo leggero. Sapore inizialmente maltato sul finire molto luppolato. Carbonatazione media. Medio tasso alcolico.

2019년 기준 독일 맥주 순위
1위 - 벡스(Beck's) 11%
2위 - 크롬바커(Krombacher) 9.6%
3위 - 바르슈타이너(Warsteiner) 8.3%
4위 - 비트부르거(Bitburger) 7.2%
5위 - 펠틴스(Veltins) 6.6% 

전형적인 필스너 맥주의 옅은 황금색의 컬러에 투명하며 깨끗하며 천천히 따라내면 거친 거품이 풍성하게 차오르긴하지만 한눈파는사이 재빨리 사라진다. 

입에 닿기전 느껴지는 향은 말들이 먹는 건초의 향이다. 그리고 못다핀 꽃 한송이의 은은한 아로마도 느낄 수 있습니다.

입으로 들어올땐 혀끝을 탁 치는 알싸하고 짜릿한 매운맛이 느껴지며, 분명 필스너의 맛이긴한데 최근 IPA를 많이 마시다보니 입안 가득 담았을땐 오히려 이조차도 달게 느껴진다. 조금 과장을 하자면 엿당같은 단맛이 홉향보다 먼저 잡혀서 달달한 보리차스럽기도 하다.

다만 온도에 따라 차가울수록 단맛보다 힐러타우홉의 스파이시함이 두드러진다. 대단히 맛있다거나 맛없다하는 우위가 없으며 특별한 개성도 없지만 그게 독일 필스너 혹은 일반 라거의 개성이지.. 기분 좋은 청량감과 깔끔한 담백함으로 벌컥벌컥 마시기에 괜찮습니다.

개인적으로 한국의 교촌치킨 먹을땐 벡스!
50cl can in Budapest. Mass production lager, nothing special in any way about this. Clean and punctual like a real German. Dry finish.
decent pils, nothing too write home about though. Pale gold, drinks relatively easy
Trochę słodowo-ziołowego lagera niemieckiego, a trochę eurolagera. Ogółem średniawe.
Uma pilsen muito boa, muito, mas muito parecida com a Heineken, inclusive a garrafinha verde.

Ester aroma. Decent white head at first look but vanishes totally after a moment
Pale golden body.
Drinkable, watery. Nothing special.

Becks (UK) For some insane reason ,has lowered the alcohol to 4% in the UK, the result being a drink ( I really cannot call it beer) that is beyond disgusting.  Becks had been  my favourite beer for over 20 years. NEVER AGAIN,!  BE WARNED UK Becks lovers, it is nothing like the German brewed Becks.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine - Melbourne. Pours a crystal clear light gold color with a white head and good retention. Spotty lacing. Strong skunky aroma. Skunky Euro lager flavor too, but thankfully not as skunky as the nose. Fairly generic pale malt flavor. Soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Light body. Just another Euro lager. Why are all Euro lagers skunky?

Have drunk a lot of this lager but have never rated it highly or particularly liked it. Always preferred Belgian, French and American lagers with Stella Artois, Kronenberg and Coors being my favourites.
For me it is all down to the taste.

330ml. bottle. Tasted several times.
[#3.869 Global - #347 Germany - #1 Brauerei Beck & Co. (My German Brewery #151)]
Pale golden colour with a minimal off-white head. Aroma: Sweet malts and grains. Taste: Watery malts and light chemichals. Crisp finish. Industrial lager as its best/worst.
Next one please!

Nalewa się bardzo jasne złocisto-słomkowe, piana biała szybko opada, idealnie klarowne. W aromacie słodowe trochę chlebowe z estrowymi nutami. W smaku wytrawne, puste lekko metaliczne z goryczką niską do średniej.

It’s yellow in colour. Very ordinary, a kind of light beer. Ok when you har hot and thursty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pessima birra. A mio giudizio una delle peggiore lager industriali, non riesco proprio a mandarla giù
Old rating from 2008 - 330ml bottle, pours clear golden with a small white head. Aromas & tastes of grass, grain & malt. Moderate body. Sharp moderate bitter finish
Bottiglia da 66 cl. Schiuma colore bianco non molto persistente. Colore dorato. Aroma di malto. Corpo leggero. Sapore inizialmente maltato sul finire molto luppolato. Carbonatazione media…

50cl can in Budapest. Mass production lager, nothing special in any way about this. Clean and punctual like a real German. Dry finish.
decent pils, nothing too write home about though. Pale gold, drinks relatively easy
Trochę słodowo-ziołowego lagera niemieckiego, a trochę eurolagera. Ogółem średniawe.
Uma pilsen muito boa, muito, mas muito parecida com a Heineken, inclusive a garrafinha verde.
Ester aroma. Decent white head at first look but vanishes totally after a moment Pale golden body.…

Becks (UK) For some insane reason ,has lowered the alcohol to 4% in the UK, the result being a drink ( I really cannot call it beer) that is beyond disgusting. Becks had been my favourite beer for over 20 years. NEVER AGAIN,! BE WARNED UK Becks lovers, it is…

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine - Melbourne. Pours a crystal clear light gold color with a white head and good retention. Spotty lacing. Strong skunky aroma. Skunky Euro lager flavor too, but thankfully not as skunky as the nose. Fairly generic pale malt flavor.…

Have drunk a lot of this lager but have never rated it highly or particularly liked it. Always preferred Belgian, French and American lagers with Stella Artois, Kronenberg and Coors being my favourites.…
330ml. bottle. Tasted several times. [#3.869 Global - #347 Germany - #1 Brauerei Beck & Co. (My German Brewery #151)] Pale golden colour with a minimal off-white head. Aroma: Sweet malts and grains.…

Nalewa się bardzo jasne złocisto-słomkowe, piana biała szybko opada, idealnie klarowne. W aromacie słodowe trochę chlebowe z estrowymi nutami. W smaku wytrawne, puste lekko metaliczne z goryczką niską do średniej.
It’s yellow in colour. Very ordinary, a kind of light beer. Ok when you har hot and thursty.…
Pessima birra. A mio giudizio una delle peggiore lager industriali, non riesco proprio a mandarla giù
Old rating from 2008 - 330ml bottle, pours clear golden with a small white head. Aromas & tastes of grass, grain & malt. Moderate body. Sharp moderate bitter finish
Klasyk / a classic one / wolałbym ciut więcej aromatu i goryczki w tym piwie cóż z klasyka się nie dyskutuje / would prefer a bit more aroma and bitterness in this brew yet who am I to tell
Rating copied from Untappd. Had at the hill next to Råstasjön on 27 jul 2014
# 2417; 2/2021. Vague, grainy aroma. Clear, yellow body; white head. Grainy, herbal. Strong detergent and tobacco finish. Bad lager. 0,5 l, can, gift.
Clear yellow colour with small white head. Smell of sweet hops. Taste of hops and light bitterness. Decent pilsner.

Beck's profile almost fits to a T. It's a lighter beer, which doesn't compromise on body and taste in the same way most American light beers do. It's has a light bouquet of hops, and really is the poster boy for a 'crisp' tasting beer. It very well balanced throughout the entire palate, and doesn't have any after hang that some pilsners do. That being said, it's a knife that cuts both ways as it's also not going to be extraordinarily memorable. This is a good, solid beer's beer...and there's nothing wrong with that!

0.5 can from local store, brewed in Serbia by Apatinska pivara. (5.0%) 

Pours yellowish color with small short head. Dry taste. Low on carbonation, bit watery, sweet taste. Aroma of bread. Drinkable but low quality beer.

Slabo kvalitetno pivo, slatkasto, slabo gazirano, slabog ukusa, ali zato pitko.

Pite jakiś czas temu. Ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. 
https://www.instagram.com/czgr_

Famosa lager tedesca dal colore dorato limpido e dal profumo molto maltato, invece la schiuma è poco abbondante e fine. Il gusto è caratterizzato dai malti con sfumature luppolate e leggermente fruttate, con un finale secco ed infine il corpo è molto leggero e fresco.

At first Beck's was my go to beer among the industrial pale lagers and I found it good. As time goes by it gets harder and harder to drink.
  It is fresh, very hoppy and bitter, but flat. Moreover, most of the bottles I've drunk had bubbles on the tap and were clearly not fresh.
Color dorado claro, aroma a trigo evidente desde un inicio con algo afrutado, espuma de poca retención. No es muy amarga y la sensación en boca es ligera.

Bottle @ 4% in UK. Pours gold with decent head for a lager but retention doesn't last. A standard grain and corn aroma but with a mild notable fruit and herb hop added in. Taste is a standard macro lager and quite watery, corn is evident. There is a tiny bit of the hops in the mild finish. Body is watery to light and carbonation is moderate.

Not bad for a macro massed produced lager although the extra 1% ABV would have helped here. Still a bit pants.
I've been drinking this beer for a long time, so I'm just taking this here to keep it written

5,0% alk.
Złote, przejrzyste, solidna piana, skromny lacing. Aromat słodowy, lekko metaliczny, mało się dzieje. W smaku lekka słodycz która w połączeniu z musującym wysyceniem i delikatnie owocowymi nutami dała skojarzenie z zozolami. Do tego skromna goryczka, mało szlachetna.
50 cl. flaske. 4,9 % en dejlig øl af pilsner type. Købt i Heide i Kaufland 🍺

Served at home from PerfectDraft.
Foamy white head left a frothy cover on a slowly carbonating straw coloured body.
Cereal & malt aroma.
Medium bodied, feels soft with a clean back.
Malt, cereal, bitter & grain tastes with lightly hopped finish.
Bottle. Clear gold in color with a three finger head. Aroma is grains and skunk. Taste is grains and is well balanced.
The nose of smelly metallic hose, medium light mouthfeel and medium light palate with some bad smell..
Bottle. Clear pale golden, bubbly head. Corny, grainy, vegetal aromas. Sweetish, flavors of corn, honey, dough, light bitterness. Light-bodied,  fizzy.

It has an interesting smell, slight lacing but not very much, bubble for the most part our uniform which is an indicator of this being a microbrewery, good color, very clear, decent taste. I could probably buy more of these in the future for working in the yard or outside on a hot summer day.

5-4-4-3-9
Can (4,6% ABV), L269.9, two months before bbd. Pours clear yellow, with a big creamy head. Aroma is sweet notes of malts with cereals and honey, as well as some hops with herbal notes. Medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour is biscuity malts and sweet hops. Run of the mill macro lager.
Fresca, afrutada, con una burbuja fina y picante. Una buena cerveza para un día de calor o para una noche de verano.
Aroma of malt, fruits and hints of grass and honey. Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with average carbonation. Overall an OK Lager.

Giallo chiaro, molto limpida e poca schiuma. Aroma sull’amaro, poco gradevole. In bocca è inizialmente dolcina, ma poi emergono forti note di amaro. Davvero spiacevole e se non servita fredda poco bevibile.

[Tasting - Beder]

Aroma: Hay, wheat, banana and honey

Appearance: Light yellow with a medium fast dissapearing white head

Taste: Mildly sweet and bitter, wheat, banana and slight honey

Mouthfeel: Mouthfeel is soft with mild-medium carbonation

Overall: Nice beer ;)

Aroma of sweet malts and mild honey
Mild piss colour with little head
Taste of sweet hops, hay and mild honey
Very mild carbonation with watery mouthfeek
Decent
Klar gylden med hvitt skum. Aroma malt humle korn. Smak malt søte epler humle noe karamell. Lett søtlig, moderat bitter og lett fylde. Boks kjøpt på Joker Engenes
Jeden z lepszych eurolagerów. Bardzo pijalny i ogólnie dosyć przyjemny. Poleca,
Ein Besseres Industrie Pils. Erfrischend, grasig spritzig, leicht herb. Geht gut weg
Fles thuis geprobeerd na vakantie. Het heeft een heldere lichtgele kleur met volle witte schuimkraag. Het aroma van hop en gras. De smaak is moutig, zacht en wat bitter.
One of the better mass produced lagers out there, nice grassy notes. But of course it's main appeal is refreshment, which it does well

Appearance: clear gold color with small white head.
Aroma: grainy, pale malts, a hint of hops.
Taste: pale malts, grains, sweet. Then it shows a little bitterness and finishes dry and slightly metallic and bitter.
Mouthfeel: Light body, medium carbonation.
Overall: a decent and refreshing all malt pale lager.

Heimatliche Bierreise nach Norddeutschland. Vom noch geöffneten Supermarkt kommt eine Dose dieses Biers ins Glas. Ich habe es das erste Mal während meines AUslandssemesters 2008 getrunken, wo bei diversen Studentenparties immer wieder dieses Bier kam, wenn es grade irgendwo in Aktion war
Wie so viele andere aus der Gegend bewirbt man sich als nordisch herb, wovon man nicht wirklich viel merkt.
Es ist einfach ein klassisches Industriebier, das sich leicht trinken lässt, aber weder besonderen Charakter noch Tiefgang hat.
Das Bier ist durchaus erfrischend, aber auch da gibt es bessere.

50 cl can, 4,6% ABV, BB October 2020. Crystal clear, pale amber, thick white head, nice lacing, low carbonation. Not much aroma, hints of malt. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness, medium carbonation. Flavours of pale malts and fruity/herbal/flowery hops, slightly metallic atertaste.
Ahh, the veneer of refinement. This is the equivalent of a McMansion, built on an old landfill, under a flight path.
0.5l can. Comes in an exclusive cartoon package with 6 cans, but taste like cheap lager. Very boring and bland! Will buy Tuborg than this!

Butelka 12-2020
Aromat: typowy zapach zielonej butelki, lekko słodowy
Wygląd: słomkowy, przejrzysty
Chmiel wyraźnie czuć, coś tam jest, nawet dość pełne, czuć delikatnie żelazem, ale to od chmielu, średnio nagazowane. Taki sobie średni eurolager.

My old man's go to. Very important to get the imported variant rather than the domestically brewed stuff. Although, it's not really that great and I'd have a few choices over it at the price point. A bit bolder than the regular macro lager, but otherwise quite standard.
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.
Cerveja clara, aroma maltado. Sabor maltado com presença de lúpulo. Boa e refrescante
Hadn't had this in years, recalled it being a better mass production lager. Wrong. No aroma, no flavour other than a lingering  metallic taste.. nasty.
0.5 l can from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki. Golden, clear, bubbles and big head. Low on character. Ending might be called bitterish - if you have enough imagination.
Can at home. Not too bad for a macro lager. Quite a bit of cardboard however. Tasted 21/4/19.

330ml bottle imported from Germany. Tarty and a little spicy with some lemon, although ultimately a short lived visit to the palate. Reasonable mouthfeel with virtually no head. Mass-produced harshness of a big-brewery beer.

Purchase a 12 pack from my local Rite Aid. Thick white head on top of a pale yellow body. It's really bubbly. It smells sweet, kind of like sweet corn. It's a touch on the dry side but otherwise it's a perfect lager. it's slightly sweet with no hoppy bitterness there's a slight aftertaste I find unappealing but other than that a fine beer

This beer it seems little more light than usual for the style to me.. It smells and taste like some ordinary "Pale Lager" but something missing here for me.
First of all i dont get the malty aftertaste so much and instead i get little more bitterness on the taste. Also it is a very dry beer and very punchy.. 
Overall nothing too special to me. I can find better "Lagers" to drink and that is the fact. Otherwise is an "Ok" beer to drink and nothing more..
Pilsnerfärgad klar med vit skum vit skum. Doftar och smakar helt ok men lite "solskaddad"

12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. This particular beer is brewed in St. Louis, MO and is not an import. That said, was expecting a kat piss beer either way. Pleasantly surprised. Not the worst tasting beer, but not the best either.

Light golden color, weak white head. 
Typical lager aroma of malts and fresh hops. 
Sweet malty taste, light hoppiness, just a slightly bitter. Light body, light mouthfeel, light carbonation.
Pale gold with a thin head and a mild, malty nose. Well-carbonated with a sticky mouthfeel and a somewhat bitter, malty finish.

When will they learn?
Now brewed under licence in UK
Not Becks any longer , just an excuse of a beer ...no longer premium

Just do not even look at it as an option anymore
Numptys!
0.5l can. Pours clear straw with white head  Aroma of faint malt and cardboard. Taste is grainy and some lemon with a decent amount of bitterness. Definitely german, but a light one at that.
Middle of the road lager. Does not specifically tastes german style but acceptable on a hot Sunny and lazy afternoon.

Clear golden with a thin head.
Strawy smell of hops. Flavourful at the attack, the whole sip is mainly bitter. Medium carbonation.

Bottle poured to wine glass	
Sight: Light yellow,  white foam 	
Aroma: scent smell of malt
Taste: not a lot of flavors,watery	
Mouth feel:  carbonated 	
Overall: good beer, repeat: no look for: no

Blade złoto. Klarowne. 
Piana średnia. Szybko dziurawi się, ale nie znika. Biała. Trochę łapie szkło. 
W aromacie kwas i skunks. 
W smaku to samo. Ratuje trochę goryczka. Nie polecam.
Clear lager. White head. Nicely bitter on end. Refreshing but in same time feel watery like.
Bevuta alla spina. Tipica bionda industriale. Niente di particolare.  Leggera e dissetante.
Cerveza de un color dorado pálido, ligera y de carbonatación media. Aroma herbáceo y a malta. En boca es mas rica de lo esperado, con notas maltosas y de cereales.

Never tasted it, but is worth mentioning. Slightly pale clear golden pour, with white head that retains well. Little aroma, malty and grainy, surprisingly slightly herbal. Taste is more bitter and nicer than expected, bit yeasty. Slightly watery/light feel. It had an own character, so for a regular and big brand lager not bad.
drunk many times on bottle and draughtthough not a big fan always a bit pissy and grassy
Clean and smooth taste. Reminds me of light beer but has more taste. Good for people that don’t like strong beer.
Ultimate pisswater. Nothing good, nothing bad. Just a waste of money. Not refreshing, just empty.
the aroma is malty and herbal with shades of grain, straw and some grasses... the taste is malty and cereal with notes of grain, hay, grassy hops and some herbs... the aftertaste is dry and bitter...
This one was 4.9 ABV. Same label. 0.5 l bottle. Pours straw with small head. A: hoppy, grassy T: medium crisp and body, grassy bitter, low malty,
Amargor pronunciado e um leve salgado. Custo alto no Brasil em relação a categoria.
Cerveza comercial de color claro, sabor muy disipado, totalmente trasparente.
Beck’s is a classic German lager beer with a distinctive full-bodied taste.
Bottle in PMO lounge. Nos lightly skunky, thin malt. Flavor is ok sweet malts, some skunk, lemon, herbs, and an ok, peppery finish.

Backlog, another staple in college, we played beer pong with this spicy and astringent mass produced lager. Golden with light body. Notes are straight forward and macro like. Grains, malt, lager yeast, and spice
Pissgul med tunt vitt skum. Doftar lite malt, hö och halm. Smaken fyllig, lite maltig och besk. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång med liten beska och sötma.
Not a bad lager, refreshing in the sun, a nice cold one. BBQ and a few of these you can't go wrong if that's what your looking for

Aroma: Malt sweet
Taste. malt - sweet with a delicate bitterness.
Euro lager.

Goldgelber fester und beständiger Schaum. Angenehme Hopfen-Bitterkeit, aber immer noch süffig. Für mich eines der besten deutschen Pilsbiere von "großen" Brauereien. Ich persönlich bevorzuge die 0,33l Flasche vor dem Fass, was sonst nicht der Fall ist.
Bottle from Spar. Clear yellow appearance with thin white head. Aroma is malt and corn. Flavour is malts, lime and sweet/

Smell- weak, some nonalcoholic feel, some hops, some caramel, some citrus, hard to tell.
Foam- thin, to watery side, but not there yet, very light feeling, after shaking some citrusy bitter notes, but weak. Medium white head.
Appearance- clear yellow amber, no carbonation visible.
Taste- citrus, weak bittersweet notes, light, refreshing, some hops also, very drinkable light beer, and for that it gets extra point, because reasons.
For its price and standard it's an exceptional beer slightly bland but with a decent flavour

A: Clear gold with a small white head. 
N: Faint hint of pale malt
T: Faint malty profile with a hint of bitterness.
P: Thin
O: Standard light lager.
Very standard light lager. Crisp as expected, not much flavour, predictable standard beer.  Harshly astringent, maybe lots of dms. Lidl Hamburg can

Bière bue à la bouteille ; j'imagine qu'elle doit être blonde! Goût assez prononcé de moufette auquel je m'attendais. Bière de soif allemande sans trop de finesse, mais ça étanche bien la soif, ce qui doit sans doute être sa meilleure ou seule qualité. Cheers!
Its not that bad, i expected it was very watery, but it's not as much. Correct beer.
Zlatno zute boje, deblja bijela pjena, trajnija. Arome kvasca, blago citrusa i sira, pomalo i trave. Blage prema srednjoj gorčini, kraćeg vodeno-gorkog finiša. Vodene teksture, jake karbonizacije.
Piwo z charakterystyczna niemiecka metaliczna goryczka bez treści wodniste bez smaku. Wad nie ma ale raczej słabo
Asitli hafif malt tadı ile Efes Pilsenden bi tık iyi Alman Lager Beck's içilir mi içilir.
Light golden pour, quick head.  Nose is herbal.  Middle is herbal bitterness up front, slightly metallic flavor, thin  malt behind.  Finish is bitter, but not too long.  Meh.
Can @ Winterberg. Bitter but also some sweetness: a very decent German pilsner
Une énième lager, classique, industrielle. Elle rafraîchit et c'est là tout ce que je lui demande.
La tedesca più venduta al mondo.. Solita birra da tutti i giorni per chi probabilmente non ha mai assaggiato la buona birra
Quite a strong punchy beer with a bad aftertaste. Metallic. Zero sweetness.
Can. Malty aroma, grainy notes, metallic notes. Tastes the same as aroma, light to medium bitter. Light body, malty bitter finish. Average.
Since they stopped brewing this in Germany its joined the ranks of all the other faux continental beers for me.
Color naranja, transparente. Espuma blanca escasa y efímera. Aroma a cereal, metálico. Sabor escaso a cereal, dulzona y metálica. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear gold pour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, crisp lager yeast and some noble hop. Malt and slight hop flavor with a crisp finish.
Pozytywne zaskoczenie, może w aromacie słabo ale w smaku jest fajna goryczka, trosze mokry karton ale tak to jest super.
La definición perfecta de lo que sería una Pale Lager: Rubia clara, fresca y suave. Sin pretensiones pero ideal para tener siempre en la nevera. No decepciona.

Green bottle, no skunk. Pours straw gold. Aroma is macro lager, lemon and grass. Hint of decent German beer, taste dissipates within a second, shame as it has a nice spicy, malty, bready taste up front. Overly sweet too. Ok but bland AF!
Bottle. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Aroma is honey and wheat. High carbonation. Taste is bitter, wheat, flat. A bit of bread. Not interesting. Short taste
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
From backlog. On tap at Blattlaus, Bremerhaven. Clear Golden with white head. Malts, hops and bitterness.
Clear golden colour, really fizzy, abundant head with good retention, light body, herb aroma and flavor.
Nie wieder, hier im Osten gibt es einiges objektiv betrachtet besseres, sowie günstigeres, merkt euch das Gäste ✌🏻
.5l bottle at home. Nice german pilsener. Great malty body and hoppy finish.
Its as easy to drink as water , it has an average bitter taste , but you would expect more from a German beer.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Flaska 330 ml från Systembolaget 5.0 % ABV. Ljust guldgul med fint vitt skum som snabbt lägger sig. Maltig doft med inslag av frukt och citrus. Smak av malt och bröd med inslag av frukt och citrus. Medelstor beska. En frisk lager som passar bra till kryddstark mat.

A Beck's original é uma cerveja lager alemã clássica com um sabor distinto e encorpado, um bouquet “lupulado” fresco, cor dourada e cabeça rica. Somando-se à sua complexidade, é levemente frutada, porém firme, e tem um acabamento seco e limpo.
Lekker verfrissend pils met een moutige en hop bittere smaak. Mooi geel met een dikke schuimkraag. -backlog de BierApp-

Bottle, 275 ml. I haven't drunk Beck's since a while, so i had to taste it now. Light yellow with a faint shade of green. Foam goes away immediately, medium carbonization. Cardbox and sweet malt,  right after pouring i felt green notes reminded me to unripe bananas. Palate is average malty, hoppy bitterness on the end, short finish with metallic taste on the end comes out time to time. Just a barely fair lager, but at least it contains enough amount of malt. Not the style i can hook up on. UPDATE: i've tasted on tap, and it's quite OK. Huge, huge carbo, pleasent sweet malt nose. Thin palate but it's fairly OK, it's an OK summer choice, but not a lager u want to drink all night.

22 ounce bottle into lager glass, bottled on 1/26/2018. Pours crystal clear pale golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Bit of skunky aromas initially, but dissipated as it sat in the glass. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice robustness and balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Very clean on lager flavors, with minimal fruity notes present. Light-moderate increasing dryness from bitterness. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy and fairly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a very good German pilsener. All around nice robustness and balance of robustness and balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the moderately bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful and never watery for the ABV. Nicely rich and clean pils malt flavors, with nice earthy hop presence/balance. A very enjoyable offering and spot on style example. Would have preferred trying it in cans, but could not find any. I got the bottle knowing the skunk would be there, and it turned out just fine.

Canned 0,33 Hungary.The tasted beer is produced in Hungary. Theoretically, it does not contain corn. It is extremely light, its color is weak, its foam ... it really isn't. Its odor is also minimal, which suggests little extract content. Luckily, the taste was a minimally better than what the look and smell offered. Better than some domestic corn large farms, but not really much, with almost nothing. Not recommended, even though it is a world brand .. I think there is a place where it works more delicately :) ×xx 15.11.2019. Its foam is nicer, lasts even, and is especially beautiful, dense snow white. The aroma was better, the taste was more hopy, with a definite sweetness, German malt. They could say something "from the center" that needed to be improved, there was a clear quality improvement. Although there was a slight fart odor at opening :(
***
A kóstolt  sört Magyarországon gyártják. Elméletileg nincs benne kukorica. Rendkívül világos, gyenge a színe, a habja ... az igazából nincs is. Illata is minimális, ami kevés extrakt-tartalomra enged következtetni. Még szerencse, hogy az íze egy minimálisan jobb volt annál, amit a kinézete, illata kínált. Jobb néhány hazai kukoricás nagyüzemitől, de nem igazán sokkal, szinte semmivel. Nem ajánlott, hiába világmárka.. Gondolom van, ahol finomabban sikerül :) ××× 2019.11.15. Habja szebb, tart is, sőt kifejezetten szép, sűrű  hófehér. Illata jobb, ízre is komlósabb lett, határozott édesség mellett, németes malátás. Valamit azért szólhattak a központból,  hogy javítani kéne rajta, egyértelmű minőségi javulás történt. Bár kinyitáskor volt egy kis fingszag :(

Becks 12oz bottle - Picked up at Camp Stanley burger bar after trip to Camp Red Cloud library to get some CD’s to copy. Nice saturday get away from everyone. Very pale, almost white yellow. Minimal foam, nicely balanced hop and malt aroma, firm body, like a German model on a beer poster. Quite dry in finish, as if giving the impression that it’s no longer on your breath and feel safe to go back to work after having one or more for/with lunch. Crisp and light on the middle and tip of tongue, as if to possess it and spew hot game on the Korea-for-a-year 8’s who will revert to 5-6 status once back in ‘States. After sitting a while, gets a bit more malty in balance and grainy aroma takes over, most likely mirroring what your breath actually smells like going back to work after that two+ beer lunch. At least the bitterness of that gig has been replaced by sweet sugar malt coating your perception of life. Probably why beer has always been so popular.

(12oz bottle) AROMA: light biscuit and yeast, soft malt, wheat APPEARANCE: medium-light straw yellow, clear, nice visible carbonation, one finger white head, foam is dense small bubbles TASTE: soft malt, some dairy/cheese, small touch of smoke and barrel, grass and herbs, some noble-ish (Bavarian) hopness PALATE: relatively light body, good sparkle upfront then some softness, tad creamy, good balance OVERALL: a nice looking lager, nothing too special but better than many average lagers, respectable nose, has some nice Bavarian taste, missing that extra kick however easy and pleasurable to drink.

Typical cloudy golden colour. Has a hoppy aroma which took me back to my teenage days of sneaking into dive bars and staggering into a urinal. Not sure if that's a good thing. Beck’s pours a clear lager-yellow color. Its head is tall, of medium lifetime, and leaves no lacing behind. The nose isn't particularly complex, but it is solidly noticeable with cereal notes from the malt with grass and light cannabis notes from the hops. It has a faint acidity right from the front palate, then it proceeds to reveal the simple, metallic-bitter contribution from the hops. The finish is rather short, wherein the heat from the alcohol is well hidden. The medium to lively carbonation offers a decent texture. Inoffensive, trivial, boring.

I remember the olden days when Beck's was deemed to be a North German style pils with its grip and a solid, aromatic hop profile. Sure, it has never been world class, but it used to be decent. Alas, it has turned into another mass-produced industrial lager. What a shame.

Bouteille 33cl. Dégustée comme une pils, c’est à dire que je la noterai uniquement comparée à d ’autres pils ou lager, pas à d’autres types de bière.

Robe blonde, couche de mousse généreuse ; bière limpide, faible carbonatation. Au nez c’est plutôt faible : des arômes maltés, les céréales et le pain. En bouche, le corps n’est pas très sec, et je suis un peu plus surpris car même si la longueur en bouche n’est pas exceptionnelle, les saveurs sont plutôt équilibrées : on retrouve également le pain, mais aussi les céréales et le miel. On retrouve également des notes herbacées, de réglisse, avec une amertume correcte en fin de bouche.

En bref, une pils classique, rafraichissante plus que goûtue, mais plutôt satisfaisante pour une bière de ce type. A boire devant le foot !
