Bottle 275 ml from a London supermarket. Aroma of malts with hints of pine and citrus notes. Taste of slightly bitter malts. A decent industrial lager.
Can. It pours clear golden with a small white head. The aroma is grainy mainly. The flavor is grain and malt with a whiff of hops.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A golden pale yellow beer with a medium white head ; average retention. Honey, herb, flower. Light sweet, medium dry bitter refreshing. Light body, watery texture, average carbonation, floral dry refreshing finish. Overall, enjoyable !
Goldgelb im Glas mit schöner Schaumkrone. Den muffigen Geschmack kennt warscheinlich jeder Biertrinker! 100% Wiedererkennungswert!

Powtórka po latach... Importowane, renomowane, znane od bardzo dawna piwo powinno dać sporo przyjemności z picia! Niestety, tak się nie dzieje... Beck’s wygląda nieciekawie - słomkowy kolor, niemal przejrzyste, słabiutka piana... Aromat słodu i mokrego kartonu, z przewagą tego drugiego... W smaku również wypada bardzo kiepsko. Wodniste, lekko słodowe, trochę nieprzyjemne. To wszystko po chwili zastanowienia, bo ogólnie można rzec, że jest bezsmakowe. Rozczarowanie...
500ml on tap in Leipzig. Aroma is light sweet malt. Appearance is clear yellow with a small white head. Taste is light sour and light bitter. Medium to strong carbonation. Well ...
Całkiem dobry lager. Czuć nawet trochę goryczki ale raczej, trochę kłującej.
Aus der grünen Flasche getrunken (Supermarktkauf). Ist halt ein Industriebier. Es gibt Schlimmeres.
500ml can.Pours clear golden with white head. Aroma of grass, wathery,metalic finish.bad.

Can from LCBO. Not purchased for drinking but rather for inserting up rear end of my bbq beer can chicken. Dumped a few fingers into my glass & was stunned to learn I’d yet to rate this. Maybe my rating had been deleted cuz of a simile comparing this to "hairy testicales steeped in sugary corn water". Does have that corn water sweetness. Not very enjoyable. Sweet & slightly skunky is not how I like my lagers. Back in high school this was the good stuff (along with hash oil cut with cough medicine, mullets & Glam metal). Now it’s probably not even worthy for beer can chicken. Avoid.

330 ml bottle from a supermarket in Italy. Colour is pale yellow with a small white head that quickly disappears. Aroma is light malt, corn. Taste is a little bit different from the standard lager. There is a particular bitterness. But I don’t appreciate it so much. Light body. Mild bitterness in the finish.
Had to try it. Now it’s done. The usual old 80’s beer. Common, nothing different, still better than average.
Bottle at Tania’s parents’. Pours clear golden with white head. Aroma of grass, hay, vegetables. Tastes slightly bitter with some sweetness. Thin bodied, watery finish.

Bottle from the Brussels, Beer Cafe, Gurney Paragon, Penang, Malaysia. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a thin broken white head. The aroma is dry cardboard malt, light hop. The flavour is moderate to light bitter with a light mineral aspirin malt, woody light floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Easy drinking and fine on a hot day but with little defining flavours.
0,33l fles bij de sugarfactory, tja wat valt er over te zeggen. bijzonder weinig. Gewoon eren commercieel pils gebrouwen om zo snel mogelijk weg te stouwen
Nose is hoppier than usual (for a lager): sweet pale malts, a bit of wetboard. Aroma is malty, a bit fruity from the hops. Metallic. Dry, crisp finish. Will do once or twice.
Wypite jakis czas temu, ocena w ramach uzupelnienia profilu. Zwykly lager, nic wiecej

Bottle at HaMispara barbershop, Kfar Saba, while haircut. Probably pale yellow, but I was drinking it straight from the bottle, so I can’t really know. A simple lager which smells and tastes like grains with some herbs, bitterish. Light-bodied. Nothing special, but good enough for passing the time at the barbershop.
Very clear, light yellow colour with a quickly dissipating short, white head. Aroma and flavour dominated by corn and malt. Little to no hop bitterness.

Golden with short lived white foam. Grassy/herbal hop aromas with just a hint of skunk. Slick mouthfeel with moderately high carbonation. Cider like sourness mixed with a mild bitterness. Finish is crisp and dry with a slightly metallic hop bitterness.
Bottle into shaker. Golden colour with white head. Aroma of malts and corn. Thin texture and a slight hop finish.

Macro German stuff. Really enjoy the 25oz (free extra ounce!! Ha) on the train home from work. Better than most the other options. Any way, aroma is horrible but the rest of the beer is decent. Nothing to write home about...
Clear yellow colour with light white head, aroma of malts , tastes like an average german lager, realy bitterr.

As it is in German lager, too much bitterness for my taste. Carbonation was high to medium which may be a little less. Cheap lemonade taste could be felt from miles. I wouldn’t buy again unless it is free.

Light straw color. Medium carbonation. Quickly dissipating head. Has a pleasant, sweet, hoppy aroma with just a bit of fruitiness. Taste is perfectly balanced between bitter and sweet. Has a long lasting hop finish, a bit herbal, some citrus-like acidity. You know, for a mass produced lager beer, this was quite tasty. I was surprised by how much I liked it. Not to be a staple of mine, but if I’m at a bar with only light lagers to choose from, I know I’ll be at least satisfied with this.
Właściwie to jest woda ze słodem. Niczym się nie różni od polskich konerniaków. Najbliżej mu chyba do trochę rozgazowanego Tyskiego.
Ljusgul klar. Skummar en del. Var rätt mycket bättre än befarat. Lite söt, men det var ju i alla fall lite smak.
A tucatsörök egyike, de végülis ezek a sörök robbantották ki a kraft forradalmat.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer

Colore biondo dorato, schiuma leggermente scarsa ed evanescente. Odore di cereali, leggero erbaceo.
Sapore delicato di malto, cereali, amaro finale leggero.
Classica lager, rinfrescante ed "estiva".
Pours yellow with light white head. Aroma is malts, grainy, white bread, some bitterness. Taste is metallic, grainy, bitter, some malts, light grass, even citrus. Proper lager!
Pours pale golden with medium sized white head. Aroma is malts and mild citrus. Taste is pretty basic macro.

Aroma: Cereal, yeast, cheap lemonade ; Appearance: Pale clear golden ; Taste : medium bitterness ; medium to low sweetness ; Palate: medium to light body, thin texture, average carbonation, long kinda unpleasant bitter finish, but not the pleasant bitterness (lasts for hours in the throat). Overall, completely bland and average beer, which, for a pils, is quite a good rating.
275ml bottle. Pale, straw colour with a frothy white head. Sweet, grassy aroma. Taste is sweet, not much more evident. Pretty forgettable really
A fairly typical lager of the type. Not a huge amount of aroma, a slightly sickly sweetness along with some bitter hop but not especially tasty and not much to it by way of body or aftertaste.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Review: 16 oz Can of Beck’s: ABV: 4.9% 

This is the canned version straight from Germany and not the green bottle variety that many have complained about on the various beer sites. So I imagine should be less skunky….

Incidentally, Becks were the first German brewery to use green bottles…..

On pour get a very clear, very, very clear, light golden yellow appearance, with some nice carbonation, bubbling away. Has a decent sized frothy white head that looks good, but does reduce in size but maintains overall.

Some small lacing. Overall looks pretty decent

For the aroma I get a very slight whiff of a real beery smell, but its quite faint, can smell the grains, all nice but faint ………… 

On taste we get a nice creamy intro…..but there is a very strong lingering bitter taste throughout that pierces this beer. It is slightly stringent and not very nice to taste
No real aftertaste? 

Bit of a cardboard taste detected as well
Is possible to get a nice mouthful and the beer has some depth to it with the barley and malts, but….that overall sour bitter taste prevails, of sweet corn perhaps, and its not good, and I found this beer overall fairly hard to stomach to be honest. Not a good beer at all……….

50 cl. can. Clear light yellow with a medium but short-lived white head. It has a quite metallic aroma which consists of malt and grains. Taste is medium sweet with a very light sourness, and a light bitterness at the end. Light body, thin to oily texture, average carbonation, dry finish. Another watery lager which you can drink on a hot summer day to refresh yourself.

Bottle. Flat and boring. Metallic, grassy and skunky by default. Used to drink loads of this when I was younger and didn’t know better. A little bit more on the bitter side than some of the other big German Pilsener but that really doesn’t mean a lot...I will never spend money on it again but when it’s for free...
Small bottle. Pours clear golden with small white head. Aroma of skunk and malt. Light sweet taste of grain and straw. Watery and light bodied, carbonation is average to lively. Another boring lager.

Pale clear yellow with white head. Light sweetness in the aroma though not much specific malty notes, more like wine gums or some sort of candy. I can’t really sense much if any hoppiness. The taste is light sweet with malty notes of bread with a little grassy hop flavor and very little bitterness. A bit weak bodied and undercarbonated to my taste.
Review written before I made ratebeer account. Like the polish pale lagers I’m used to, except more watery.

24. 11. 2016, Ljubljana @ Žarana's place. Bottled. Watery, watery, watery. An awful beer. Should be banned.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma: Acetaldehyde, malts. Appearance: OK head, golden colour. Taste: Sweet, acetaldehyde, malty, light herbs. Palate: Sweet finish, low body, medium-high carbonation.
330ml bottle at Purecraft Bar, Birmingham. Pale yellow gold with a thin, frothy white head. Slight metallic scent, along with rubber bands. Slightly buttery with a sharp cutting flavour.

Proefglas van 25cl-fles in les Zytholoog te Syntra Kortrijk. U: Goudgeel met kleine witte schuimkraag. G: Brood, pilsmout en licht fruitig. S: Licht (pils)moutzoet en droogtrekkend nabittertje. M: Weinig body en medium carbonatie.
Lager allemande très classique. Légère amertume. Une Pils donc rien de grandiose.

Bottle from the state store 

Pours clear light golden with a small white head, light lacing. Aroma is skunky and wheat. Taste of hay, grassy and spicy 

I would assume this would be better without the green bottle

Clear yellow color with low and rapidly disappearing head.
Aroma: bread, malt
Taste: medium bitter

Our original Beck’s is a classic German lager beer with a distinctive full-bodied taste, fresh "hoppy" bouquet, golden color and full rich head. Adding to its complexity is a slightly fruity but firm crispness and a dry, clean finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample from a friends Bottle at Restaurant Wally, nijmegen. Golden yellow, medium head. Aroma is grain, malt. Taste is the same, meh ok ish

Pours clear pale yellow with low white head 
Aromas of light citrus, bread, malty syrup, water 
Taste has notes of syrupy malts, bread, slightly herbal, citrusy
To piwo miało nawet sporo chmielu w sobie. Nie wiem, jak teraz, ale te 5-10 lat temu naprawdę było bardzo przyswajalne, mimo, że z Pepsi albo czegoś podobnego. Dla mnie ma wartość sentymentalną.

-German-brewed Version (canned)

L:
-pours a clear straw golden with a medium,foamy,white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-floral,dishwashing liquid,pears,lemon,grainy,metallic,cooked rice,tea
T:
-metallic,grainy,mineral,lemon,slightly toasted malt,cardboard
-a barely detectable, but lingering throughout bitterniss
F:
-medium carbonation
-light body
O:
Beck’s has basically turned from a German Pilsener to a below average Euro Lager throughout the years.

[backlog] 27-08-15 / bottle. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 2.5/5

Uzupełnienie profilu

W zapachu bardzo podobne do polskich lagerów, może leciutka nuta chmielu. Wysokie wysycenie, słodowe, wodniste
Bottle. Mild bitterness, finishes with a hint of fruit. Some malt in the background. Just a very basic lager. Nothing wrong with it.
500ml from a keg. Refreshing, clean lager. Slightly herbal bitter. Okay though.
Zielona butelka. Klasyka gatunku. Osobiście spodziewałem się więcej. Eurolager, słodowe, diacetyl, nikczemna piana. Z braku laku.

I’m surprised that I had not come around to rate this beer so far! Pours pale golden with a foamy white head that dissipates rather quickly. The aromas are sweet, grain and also sweetcorn. Sweetish flavours, in the same character, some hoppy gradient to it, some malt, with an average finish. Watery, thin, but refreshing.
Pours clear pale yellow with thin white head. Light herbal and malty aroma. Taste is light honey, malty. Light body, refreshing.
Muito boa, levemente amarga não estufa, preço em.sp 2-99p para 275ml mesmo preço da Stela

Draught about 100 times at summer music festivals. Funny I never bothered ticking it before :) The first one is kind of painful, the second one almost feels alright, the third one slowly turns into sparkling yellow water. Drink it fast and fresh, and make sure to share the fun with some good mates, prost!

Bottle in the Singapore Airlines SilverKris Lounge at LHR. 

Golden with a white head. Sweetish with bread, some vegetables and cardboard. Thin and boring with a light bitterness.

Tap@ restaurant in Waren, Deutschland. Standaard pilskleur en kraag. Ruikt frishoppig en lichtmoitig. Smaakt goed, goede combi van hoppig en moutig, vers fris, goed mondgevoel, doordrinkbaar. Lekker pilsje.
Grains, pale golden, light body, medium carbonation, taste has no character obviously...like many others unuseful.
Usual, no thrills lager. Not too malty, refreshing. Too much of this in the world, but it is not so bad as most ratings say.
Malty notes in aroma and taste. Pale gold, minimal head. Light sweet, together with some bitterness. A hint of malt sweet and hop bitter aftertaste, not too thin.
330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear pale golden, small white head, no lacing. Sweet boild vegetable aroma, grass and malt. Light soft mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Sweet taste, mild grassy finish.

0.5 l can bought at a local Lidl store. Shared with Martina. I never liked this one. Clear pale golden, diminishing white head. Cheap malts, virtually no hops. Very light, medium carbonation, finish is close to none. Taste is metallic with some sweetness. This is so fake it hurts. Never again.
Bottle. Ah, that’s why I shouldn’t drink this from a glass. Metallic, artificial, industrial. Cheap hops, some bitterness, malts are something you have to imagine. Ugh.
Słomkowe, blade, z drobną białą pianą. W aromacie estry. W smaku niby lekko słodowe, lekko kwaśne, ale bardzo nijakie.

Can at home, poured into a mug. Very light yellow colour, small white head. Nose is funky, unpleasant fermentor smell. Taste is very light bitterness, light sweetness, but almost no taste at all. Watery and bad overall.
Gezapft, Goldgelb mit festem Schaum. Kein besonderes Aroma, leicht zitrus. Geschmack belanglos, etwas bitter, leichtes Malz. Aber irgendwie erfrischend
Tap. Clear golden colour with stable head off. Aroma and taste almost the same with malts,bread, grain, moderate carbonation, light bitterness.
12 oz. bottle. Pretty nice beer for a mass produced. If you’re in the mood for a decent European Lager, this will do.

F: white, thin, quick gone.
C: pale gold, clear.
A: malty, light grassy and caramel.
T: malty, sweet caramel, bread, toast, light to medium body, average carbonation, below-average beer, 5%, 33cl bottle @ Bar Carducci in Como in Italy.

0,5l can. Clear pale yellow colour with slowly shrinking big white head. Aroma: Light grassy, herbal but watery. Taste: Sweet watery start with a light bitter mouthfeel. It has the usual indastrial carateristics but not too much. Light body with lively carbontion. Medium lasting bitter/sour finish. Meh...
Standard macro euro lager with Heineken like euro malt aroma & flavor. Luckily my bottle wasn’t skunky. Very drinkable and thirst quenching for a hot day. A decent average beer.

Bottle, lovingly aged by my brother in the bed of his pickup truck. May have been frozen once or twice, who knows. Clear pale, some head. This beer tastes like a skunk pissed on sheet metal. Light corny body. Overall: Blech.
0.5 l can. Entry based on older, numerical notes only. ---------------------
Typical green troll beer :) pale geen pea checz hop taste and aroma. Fat carbonization
for the first time after a long time. Watery: no flavour no taste, but just a hint of metal . Terrible

It is a drinkable beer though disappointing overall. Skunky aroma very off-putting. Such a light shade of yellow it’s nearly clear as water. If offered I would drink it again...I wouldn’t purchase it to drink again.
Archiwum. W aromacie słodowe, pustawe. Piwo barwy złotej, piana niska. W smaku nic się za bardzo nie dzieje prócz lekkiej słodowości z rachityczną goryczką. Nie ma co pisać.
I can’t say much about this beer. Its an average macro brewed bland beer. Its a beer that is bland and leaves you wanting more. No wonder I never see anyone drinking this beer.

33cl bottle at Hotel Comtes de Challant in Fénis, Italy (7 V 2016). Golden yellow, rather pale too with a diminishing collar on top. This brew is a very basic lager, almost pilsner styled (therefor it is called a premium lager - I guess). Medium carbonised, easy too drink, yet very dull. With a clear balance of malts, bitterness and water. Nothing noteworthy, I’m afraid.

Another unwanted pub-quiz prize. What you can say about Beck’s is that it doesn’t have any unpleasant flavours but that’s at the cost of having almost no flavour at all. If I were to really try I would say a little hint of apple and a very short finishing bitterness, but that’s it and I really had to struggle for those. OK if your water supply has been cut off...
bland as fuck. does the job tho. but i dont like the way it sits in me so its gonna lose a point for that shit

Bottle to shaker glass, pours clear golden. One finger quick white head which leaves no lace with minimal retention. Aroma of noble hops and a little skunk. Taste is moderately malty sweet with some grassy bitterness. Light bodied, lively carbonation, slick mouth feel. Finishes dry. Drank a lot of these back in the 80’s. Better than most American pale lagers but that’s not saying much!

Bottle - light clear yellow / straw. High initial carbonation giving large frothy head. Ok mouthfeel. Sweet slightly banana aroma .Only mild tasting - slightly bready - banana. Easy drinking - not fizzy as many lagers.
Historic rating, had a ’few’ of these over the years when there was nothing else on offer... Pale gold, small white head. Light hop and malt aroma. Light body, thin texture. Has done well for itself.
It’s a classy german pils, minimal white head. Aroma corn. Color golden, Taste was better than the aroma lightly bitter.
330ml bottle. Pours clear gold with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is herbal hops, hay. Taste is malt, grass and faint hops.

Originally rated on 6/25/08. not much to write about, however it wasnt bad either. It pours a nice golden color thats heavily carbonated, with a thick white cap. Smells a little skunky but not really bad, flavor was a little maltly and grassy.

Bottle up the White Lady.
Appearance - golden with a thin head.
Nose - sweetcorn and green beans.
Taste - dry metallic and slightly vegetal.
Palate - light to medium bodied with a dry astringent texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - dry and astringent but I’ve had worse.

Coloração palha,líquido límpido,brilhante,espuma com média formação deixando marcas pelo copo,no aroma malte,fermento,lúpulos herbáceos;sabor leve refrescante segue o aroma,baixo corpo,média carbonatação,final seco levemente amargo.
Golden yellow robe, with old gouda cheese and quite strong bitters, with a short finish.
Draft. Clear golden color. Aroma: a bit of german hop, cereal. Taste: watery, clean, soft hop bitterness, normal lager.
bionda chiara pulita...ed è l’unico dato positivo di questa birra... nessuna nota distintiva

Our club-standard beer. Almost every discotheque offers this 0815 bewerage. I never actually buy it, but somehow I always get bottles of Beck
s once a quartal. Its like a curse.
12 oz. bottle. Pours golden, minimal white head. Aroma was grassy and corn. Taste was better than the aroma, crisp.

50 cl from tap@Fat Albert’s, Soldeu in glass mug@approx 6 degrees C. Pours clear golden yellow with large white head with good retention. Malty aroma with a hint of German hops. More flavor than most mass produced lagers with a pleasant balance between hops and malt, sweetness and a quite pronounced bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium carbonation and not truly interesting, but raises it’s head just a little over your standard Euro pils - daring to display its German roots - especially in the aftertaste.

Pours clear yellow with a thick white head. Crisp, malty aroma is typical though pleasing. Malty flavor is about what one expects from a standard lager. Fizzy mouthfeel features average viscosity. Fine for a party.

33 cl, bottled. 5 % alc. Pours clear gold with a decent white head. Aroma: Malt, grains. Notes of grass. Taste: Medium+ sweet. mild taste. Malty flavour, bread and grains. Notes of some bitterness. Palate: Light body, notable carbonation. Unfortunately the body feels slightly oily, decreasing sharpness. Ok pale lager.
500ml can poured into a lager glass. Pale with white fizzy head. Strong hoppy aroma. Has a nice clean hoppy flavor but too much carbination. Not a bad beer but not a favorite.
Really enjoy the stronger hop and aroma of this lager. Has more flavour then the usual offerings in this category such as Stella or Heineken.

ThIs is a re-rate.  I had it on tap. The aroma is cleaner than most beers of the style. There is not much to it though. The flavor is slightly sweet corn, malt, and barley. It is carbonated with a clean and dry finish.  It is decent for what it is.
Drank in bottle. Average pills, bitter and well-carbonated. No distinctive characteristics.

Can 500ml @ Room at Gabriella, Sölden, Austria

Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, hay and hint of metal. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with an average bitter, grainy and fruity finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is fizzy.

For a Euro lager, Beck’s beats Heineken hands down. It’s a gentle beer, only slightly hoppy, somewhat sweet, even a tad light in mouthfeel. The aroma is a little stale but not to skunky like Heineken usually is. It is basically the same brewed in St. Louis USA than it was in Bremen, Germany. It’s okay, nothing special though. Pretty much your average Euro lager.
Pours golden with medium white head. Hoppy nose. Aromas are sweet malts, herbal hops. Average carbonation, light body. Medium bitter finish. Quite enjoyable for an industrial lager.
Keg. Slomiany jasny kolor z biala obfita piana. W zapachu chmiele. W smaju wodniste chemiczne z metalicznym posmakiem . Kiepskie
Klares goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, leicht würzig, dezent hopfig-bitter.
A nice lager, that has a pleasant balance between freshness and bitterness.

33cl bottle at The Kings Oak, Loughton, UK on 27-Dec-2015. Drank straight from the bottle. Light body and medium carbonation. Taste of grain, malt and lightly hopped. A little sweet and low on flavour.

Ha, funny I hadn’t rated this. From my folk’s fridge (desperate times): murky yellow gold pour with thin white head. aroma of muted grain, grass. tastes are sweet malt, bready, slight floral hops. not great, but easy drinking.
Bottle at home. Pours clear piss golden, nose is toffee, grassy, taste is sweet, floral, grassy, grainy.
Oftmals aus der Flasche und dem Fass. Ich meine mich zu erinnern, dass es früher spritziger, zitroniger war, mit bitterem Abgang. Kaum noch was von übrig.

Dette er min gennemsnitsøl. Farven er lys gyldengul og skumkronen er hvid og fast. Den har en aroma af hø og humle og smagen er den samme med en anelse malt. Eftersmagen er tør og humlet. Sådan skal en gennemsnitlig tysk pilsner smage.
Beck’s (Brauerei Beck & Co, Germany) - Overall Score: C - Acceptable Standard
Flasche 0,33l: Goldgelb mit etwas festem Schaum; leichte, frische Nase mit leichter Hopfennote; milder Körper mit Hopfennoten und angenehmer Bitterkeit im Abgang

Bright pale straw color. Weak 1 finger head, quickly dead.

Highly skunky smell with some corn. Faint bitter malt flavors, slightly citrus.

Light slick body with prickly carbonation. Faint and short bitter finish ending with a smoky skunky dry feel.

Overall : Too bland, almost no flavors. A little stale, missing some freshness.
Bottle. Characteristic fresh, slightly bitter taste, passing in a soft aftertaste.
Malty aroma, not very pleasant. High carbonation, malty taste, low, herbal bitterness.
Can at home. Skunky aroma of sweet grainy malt and cardboard with a hint of fruits. Flavour is unpleasantly sweet with a little bitterness in the finish. Too sweet and skunky.
A study in crisp, clean, bland drinking lager. I wouldn’t say this is terrible but there are so many better beers (even lagers) out there.
Had one on a hot day in San Antonio River Walk. Not bad, probably over rating given the circumstance.
Old rating from bottle. Mass produced lager, same as many others. Prefer the better German beers

Bottle. Golden colour, small white head. Hoppy aroma. Slight bitterness. Pleasant lager.
(old rating, 2010)

50 cl can from Konzum, served in a snifter. Golden yellow with medium white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is malts, a hoppy grassy element, a bit metallic at times. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet with slightly bitter finish. No astringency, clean and crisp, but somewhat watery.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance – The beer pours a clear golden amber color with a big billowy white head. The head fades fast over time to leave a tiny bit of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell – The aroma of the brew quite off with a rather skunky smell overall. There is a little bit of caramel and brew, but overall the skunk dominates.
 Taste – The taste begins with a rather bready taste with a light bit of caramel. As the taste advances some lighter grassy and corny tastes come to the tongue. At the very end a little bit of a hay, skunk, and grain taste meets the tongue, leaving one with a rather crisp and slightly grainy but just slightly odd flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is rather thin with a carbonation that is rather high. For the lighter flavors and lager characteristics of the brew the feel is rather appropriate, making it an overall very easy drinking brew.
 Overall- Ahh. Nothing too exceptional. It would likely be much better if not in a green bottle which taints the whole experience with the nose. It is easy drinking, but otherwise, ahh.
Aroma and taste very similar to Grolsch, this having a bit more body with a stronger aftertaste. Decent lager.
Typowy browarek niemiecki o slomkowej barwie,niezle wysycone i chyba jedno z llepszych niemieckich"sikaczy"koncernowych
Not bad beer, but nit particulary good,, its drinkable, taste is little bit of bitter and lot of bubbly, which is not very atractive for me
with all the great German beers in the world to mass-produced Becks is one of the worst

The original Becks, that’s actually brewed in Germany, tastes great! It’s not a lager, it’s a pilsner with decent hop overtones. The problem is most of the Becks you find nowadays is brewed under licence somewhere and is not the real thing, not the real taste.
Not a bad pale lager, but not a particularly good one either. Little bit of hops hidden in this one.
tastes good, not so different that other good beers, but good enough. bottle design is good too.

660ml bottle from local shop.Yellow gold colour, white foamy head and malty grassy aroma. Taste is malty, grain, papery with some grassy bitterness. Light bodied, high carbonation, grassy metallic bitter finish. OK cold.

Bottle. Clear golden body with a short-lived white head. Lively carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of used tea towel, grain, sweetcorn and metal. Flavour of metallic bitterness and lemon. Thin body with a watery texture. Soft fizz. Astringent and metallic.

From a fresh bottle.
I haven’t had this for some years. 
This lager met my low expectations. An adequate, mildly bitter pils.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Artificial and a bit boozy smell with some apples and canned corn. Light taste, a bit artificial. Light bitterness. Light body.
Geruch- und Geschmacklos....zu besaufen aber OK... Farbe ist Gold und der Schaum grob und hoch...

Clear pale yellow, thin white skim, sparse lacing. Light grainy cereals, some citrus, and grass. Helps that this came from a 16oz can. Light bodied, moderate carbonation, gentle sweetness, rounded finish. Passable.

Bottled, 33 cl. Color of bright transparent amber, visible fizz and no head. Aroma: muted hops. Palate is first felt on the tongue, later it comes on the roof of the mouth. Taste: light and sweet, later bitter.
Just piss-looking water, sour ,full of esters ,it tastes like addle apple juice.

Ulice 9/8 2015. 50 cl can from local market (Voli). Pours clear very pale yellow with big white head. Settles quickly leaving thin lacing. Aroma is sweetish with a sour tang. Medium carbonation. Taste follows the nose and is dominated by sweetish malts. Aftertaste is sourish. Ok thirst quencher if consumed cold. Should not be enjoyed lukewarm.
Pours ultra clear pale gold. Aroma is paper and corn. Taste is showing some cereals. Lightly bitter. Carbonation pretty high. Still pretty flat.

22 oz bottle purchased for $2. I’m not really sure what is more interesting; this beer, or the articles online that surround it. I’ve read about the possibility of AB halting the brand, all the way to them paying people back their money (and then some) for drinking it. All because people can’t fathom the idea of an imported beer being brewed in their backyard. Or in this way, the great gateway to the west. I’m not one to care. When it comes to this kind of beer, I tend to remain on the less picky side. Although a US brewed Becks VS a German brewed Becks would be a fun blind taste test. All of this added up to the thought crossing my mind that I better rate this before I lose my opportunity. That, coupled with the fact that growing up, this was my Dad’s favorite beer, and drank it about as much as I drink every other beer combined. I suppose I also hadn’t submitted a long, random, rambling review in a while, so I guess I’m killing a half dozen birds with one beer. I felt very silly pouring this into a glass, but I did for color and appearance reviews alone. Don’t worry, I’ll drink the rest properly out of the bottle. When it comes to green bottle, premium import/export (see above) lagers, this one is decently refreshing and most importantly, finishable. Nearly transparent pale yellow color with an aroma that filled the room upon cracking it open. Extremely light flavor. About as watery as they come. There isn’t a single flavor strong enough to identify or point out. I certainly wouldn’t use the word "complex" in it’s description, but no heavy complaints here. Just an average, water forward light lager. For two bucks, I’m sure I’ll find myself in a "why not?" mood again someday.

Yellow beer with no head. aroma is malty sweet, nothing off putting in sight. Flavor is a bit sweet with some light but malt and some light bitterness. Refreshing palate.

There is much worse to choose from but obviously much better. A bit light but much better than some other pale lagers.
This one is definitely drinkable...just kind of average....malty bland metallic...way better ice cold....
Poured from bottle, clear pale gold with medium head. Classic lager notes, but very faint, taste is watery with some bitterness.
Lots of carbonation, bitterness and sour. Getting some zest here. Not all that bad. Refreshing in fact.

Lager never was my type of beer, and Beck’s never was my type of lager.
But, today we have here 35 C, and the can was cold. Pale yellow, big white top fast vanish.
Awful piss water that is so bad it has to be served nearly frozen to be able to drink it.

Dourado pálido.Sabor a resina, a mel e a metal.Durante alguns meses a minha cerveja de eleição em Portugal - porque sempre era melhor que as zurrapas Sagres e Superbock e porque não era assim tão cara.Estando a estudar na Alemanha e tendo acesso a maior variedade diria que esta é das cervejas mais fracas que já bebi estando em terras teutónicas.
Pours golden with quickly deminishing head. Nose is unpleasent with some metal. Taste is astringent grassy and soapy. Standard stuff...

Kad se sjetim koliko puta sam znao popiti ovo pivo a nikad ga nisam ocijenio ..sjecam se Becks party na kojima sam bio ...ipak lose pivo ..cak nakon vise komada boli glava i lose se osijecas ujutro ...

Botella. Dorado muy claro. Poca espuma blanca.
Aroma casi neutro.
En boca resulta carbonatada y refrescante. Amargor bajo pero más notable que en otras de su clase.

The beer is golden colored with a stable white head, and average carbonation. The aroma is malty, also grassy and with tones of hops and a hint of citrus. The taste is a little sweet and light malty. Finish is fruity and light bitter and has some tones of apples. Standard lager, but well drinkable.

Lattina. Colore giallo dorato. Schiuma compatta a rapido dissolvimento. Intensità olfattiva normale e persistenza discreta, di malto e di pane. Amaro moderato. Corpo leggero. Fluidità beverina. Persistenza gustativa sufficiente, retrogusto fresco di limone. Plus: on tap. L’intensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine medie rimane con qualche merletto sul vetro. Il perlage è dato da bollicine fini con carbonazione persistente. L’aroma rimanda a sentori di frumento e cereali.

Bottle. Clear and golden in colour, white head. Malty, grainy with herbal hops and lightstrucked aroma (green bottle). In taste medium sweet with solid bitterness. Rather low bodied, high carbonation, dry. Typical German commercial pilsner.

The formation of foam is little. The beer has a typical pilsner color. The smell is not that good. At first, it reminded me of the zoo. The taste is weird and has a metaly finis, which was also present in the smell. After a few sips a nice bitter and hoppy taste appear. Reconsidering, the smell isn’t that bad. It is like you need to get used to the aroma’s and tastes in a few sips to be able to appreciate the beer.
@ Röhällavägen 150620. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Sweet and malty with grassy notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter, sweet and malty.

330 ml bottle. (5% ABV) Pours a clear, pale yellow with an average, short lived, white head. Aroma of malt, grain and grass. Grass flavour with grain, malt and a slightly dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation.
Dorada ligeramente amarillenta. Aroma a malteado, algo herbal. Ligera, poco cuerpo. Lager bebible del montón, con algun recuerdo de pilsenes alemanas en el lupulo. Bebible.
0,5 l Flasche. Goldgelbes Bier, weißer Schaum. Leicht grasiges Aroma, leicht süßer, leicht herber Geschmack.
Bottle 500 ml. Standard, mediocre lager with bad malty notes and some almost-like-pilsener rotten smell.
This used to be a great German beer. Sadly it’s now owned by InBev and made in the USA. Following inbev’s usual strategy the quality of the ingredients has diminished greatly. I avoid becks now.
On tap at Rock Am Ring! I must say, this probably tastes better being here,nevertheless: Metally, hops, refreshening, no off-flavours noticeable. Certainly not the worst pilsener.
Smager af en masser ingenting. Kedelig og ordinær øl. Nu er den smagt, det er det mest positive, der er at sige
From tap at the Beerstore, Thessaloniki. Clear golden color with white head. Malty grainy aroma, light grassy. Sweet and light bitter taste. Light thin body with average carbonation.
From carrefour. Playing Kings Bounty Dark Side. Boring stuff. Not bad but average. Easy to forget
Bottle. Dull heavily lightstruck aroma and taste. Finishes with unpleasant sourness. Pale yellow colour, poor head.
Niezły eurolager. Słodowość na szczęście niezbyt wysoka, goryczka nawet, nawet. Zimne da się wypić.
Bottle @ Home. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of light malt, grain, grass. Flavor is light sweet, malty, grain. little sugar, grass. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. 230515
Hay aroma is nice balanced bitterness and sweetness and smooth drining and nice palate

Bottle (green). An import product (fancy). Pours very pale crystal clear gold pour with a surprising white head. Aroma is grainy, lots of skunk, definitely skunky grassy hop on the nose. Taste is lightly bitter, good grassy hop flavor, light grainy finish, quite tame. Palate is light, dry, almost watery, strong carbonation.

Product of the USA. Pretty good for fake German beer. It was on sale, great value. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a gross beer from germany and I wouldnt drink it again it you would pay me.
Bottle poured into a shaker glass. The color was a clear straw yellow with a white head and strong carbonation. The aroma was just plain skunky. The flavor was light sweet caramel.
Für das was es ist, ein Industriebier, ist es ok. Man sollte diese Art von Bier auch nicht mit irgendwelchen wunderbaren Craftbieren vergleichen. Naja für den suff ok aber nichts für den Genuss.
AB has ruined this beer in the US. It is now a watery tasteless Bud Light with a nauseous aftertaste.

16oz canned version:
This is a good German Pilsener-Euro lager, and in some ways, its slightly better than Heineken and Stella Artois. Even though this is the American version, its still good. I Paid only $3.99 for a 4pk of 16oz cans, no skunkiness and tasted nice and fresh. The best thing about this is there’s no corn and no rice adjuncts.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- smells skunky, the green glass curse has struck again.
Appearance – A golden yellow with a very small white head.
Taste- skunky
Palate- A medium to light bodied beer with moderate carbonation
Overall- I have had this beer before when it was fresh and it tasted better, but it is not a world class beer either way.
From bottle. Delicious initial flavour on first sip, then it all goes bit watery for the rest of the bottle.
Really nice beer, that I tried yesterday for the first time. Easy to drink and really good!
Bottle . 0,33L Price : 0,81€. Skaidrus.. putos beveik nėra. Gerti galima...

Tomada en Cerveceria Kraken

Es lo esperado. Suave, refrescante, con escaso sabor, simple. Producto alemán estilo Heineken. 
Rubia, de espuma blanca. Recomendable para el verano y la sed.

No recomendable para cerveceros hechos a sacar aromas a lupulo, tostado y madera. 

No tiene nada, cerveza comercial, ...
Golden with a white head - Malts in the aroma - Malt body with some hints of hop bitterness in the back - malts goes into the finish - This was ok

Keg (Zum Schiffchen, Dusseldorf)

Fresh light lager malts and gently floral hops, maybe a bit papery. Crisp palate, slightly sweet malts, again, floral hops. Nice thirst quencher.

Bottle at comfort hotel in Bremerhaven. Clear golden with white head. Smell is grain and a little lager yeast. Taste is crisp grain with light citrus and light bitter finish. Dry with low bitterness and medium carbonation.

I don’t know why people knock Becks so much. This is another one of my "Old School" beers......stuff that I first started drinking. But Beck’s....that is going WAAY back, to like pre-high school...probably the first beer I started drinking now that I am thinking. Maybe I am biased towards it, but I never disliked this beer. Still prefer the dark, but the regular is a pretty good average beer. PLUS, it’s German. It may not be that great for a German beer, but compared to the domestic piss they have here, I’d take a Beck’s any day or night. I don’t find it too skunky neither.

Golden colour with white head. Almost without aroma, you can notice only little presence of hops and thats all. The same empty is taste. Original German version was ok,, that means well balanced carbonation and bitterness, meanwhile croatian version is really hard drinkable - overcarbonated.
This beer drunk in Croatia (international mark) is very bad, the worst for me

330 ml can. Grass smell with notes of sweet malt in the end. Clear gold color with white head, wich are correctly formed. Correct taste has well, not any toxic or funky taste/aftertaste, superior to it’s supermarket lager brothers, and palate shows the same. Strong 2.4, but packaging is bad, it seems like a cheap version of Heineken, when is maybe even better.
500ml can from Walmart in China, labelled as 4.9%. I think it might be brewed here. Pours yellow with a dissipating white head.Aroma of malt and cardboard. Sweet finish which is reasonably pleasant.
Beck’s USA is nothing at all like the real German Beck’s. It is a weak substitute with some similarities in flavor, more like a Budwiser with flavor. Don’t waste your money on this beer.

Very grassy and floral aroma, fresh hops. Pours clear golden liquid with a large bubbly white head. Medium bitterness, flavour of grassy hops and hay that vanishes quickly, watery finish. Medium body, slick texture, not too fizzy in the mouth. The palate allows for the beer to be very drinkable. Overall this is an okay Lager, not much flavour, but the flavour that it has is nice and it’s very drinkable and refreshing.

Podane/Served: 2015.03.31, Lager, 9°C
 Partia/Batch: 02.2016, 0,5l bottle (green glass)

Aromat/Aroma: 
Głównie skunks, lekka ziołowość, zbożowy, trawiasty.
 / Mainly skunk, light herbs, grain, grass.

Wygląd/Appearance: 
Bladozłota klarowna barwa. Średnia piana, dość trwały korzuszek.
 / Pale golden clear colour. Medium head, small lasting coat.

Smak/Taste: 
Zbożowy, gorzki, kwaskowy.
 / Grain, bitter, sourish.

Odczucie/Palate: 
Wodniste, gładkie, lekki trawiasty posmak.
 / Watery, smooth, light grassy aftertaste.

Ogólnie/Overall: 
Cienki pils. Przyzwoity pale lager.
 / Weak pils. Decent pale lager.
Grass aroma, appear pale without a head. Taste light bitter. Light bodied, Lively carbonation and a light bitter aftertaste
An ok Lager with nothing special to it, But a solid beer if served chilled.
22 oz bomber. Pours a pale golden color. Some pale head, not much lacing. Aroma is faint hay and grass. Flavor is bitter malt. Fairly crisp finish. Overall an okay pale lager.
I got this for xmas and I want it out of my beer fridge crappy pilsner that is a shocker would make a good beer to give to someone you hate
Nothing wrong with this beer, also nothing special. Just good German lager. Malt, honey and herbal hops in aroma, same in taste. That’s it.
Cerveza de color amarillo con una cabeza de color blanco. Aroma dulce a malta y a lúpulo. Sabor afrutado con una amargura al final.

03.06.2016 -- 0.5l can from a local supermarket. medium body, medium to strong carbonation, medium bitterness, floral notes, citrus, fresh, dry finish. a kind of benchmark lager; almost everything is medium about this beer, but nothing too repulsive.
Aromat- nic specjalnego. Kolor słomkowy. Klarowne. Gęsta piana, szybko opada. W smaku słabe. Typowe przemysłowe piwo.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 2A). Bottle 27.5 cl - Batch L1354202 15:20. AROMA: hop aroma that vanishes quickly. grainy malt notes. clean lager profile. slight metalic aroma. APPEARANCE: gold color and translucent. thin white head with average retention. TASTE: slight malt sweetness that evolves into a medium-low bitter and an almost dry finish. PALATE: light body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: a german pils that lacks the german hop aromas and bitterness.
Golden, white head. Malty aroma. Malty taste, medium to low sweet. Low bitterness. Light bodied, medium carbonation. Boring and below average.

Old rating. Drank from the bottle. Slight hop aromas with a hint of pear present. No taste to speak of. Fizzy, carbonated slightly sweet on the palate. Dry finish. I guess it would be refreshing on a hot day, just devoid of any flavour.
Medium foam, yellow color. Aroma of hops. Surprisingly non bitter. Average industrial lager. Easy to drink, but nothing special.
A great beer. Crisp, fizzy, slight sweetness, dry floral. Small head with minimal foam.
Bottle from Shakespeare Hotel, Bedford. Bright yellow, heavily carbonated. Heavy lemon scent. Pleasant. Bittersweet citrus taste. The carbonation is too heavy, still quite acceptable though.
From can. Industrial lager. Hardly any taste at all. Not worth the money or the time.
Flaska från SB. Blek, klar halmgul färg med liten vit skumkrona. Svag, söt, maltig doft. Lätt, fadd malt smak med litet inslag citrus. Väldigt klen beska.
Flaska systembolaget. Gyllenfärgad klar vätska. Brödig sötaktig doft. Klen småbrödig smak. Konstgjord med lite majs. Vattnig och trist

Bomber pours a pale golde/straw with a large white head. Grassy slightly skunked hop aroma. Mellow light caramel malt with light grassy hops. When my grandpa wouldn’t spring for Pilsner Urquell he’d get this, no comparison but drinkable.

A couple of pre-review notes. I’ve noticed mostly European reviews on this, not a lot of American reviews, which prompted me to double check. Yep, it’s the right beer.

I noticed a lot of reviews mentioned freshness in their reviews. I’m guessing this is Julian dated, and if so, this bottle is about 5 months old.. Not too fresh, but not too bad considering....


It pours with a thin head. It seemed to pour heavier than a lot of beers. Not a lot of lacing, but even after several minutes, lots of bubbles rising from the bottom. It does have a pretty spicy aroma, hoppy, fresh. It screams, ’Drink me!!" It is very clear and clean, it looks like a light beer.

The beer is 5 months old. No, I don’t taste skunky. It is bittersweet, hoppy, spicy. It finished slightly bitter though. The bitterness lingers. It’s pleasant. 

It’s tricky on the palate. The mouthfeel is slightly heavy but the spicy aroma makes it more bold than it really is. It’s different, but it’s the two are conflicting.

Overall, it’s better than most. I like it, but no so much that I’ll make it a habit. It reminds me somewhat of Corona.

Flasche (33 cl) aus einem beliebigen Edeka-Markt. - Goldgelb, blank; hübsche Schaumkrone. - In der Nase nicht besonders kräftiger aber angenehm würziger Hopfen, der aber bald verduftet ist. - Antrunk sehr schlank und etwas wäßrig mit schwach würzigen Hopfennoten und ein klein wenig Zitronenschale. Schwache Süße, die kaum an Malz erinnert, eher an Kölnisch Wasser, wie überhaupt das ganze Bier etwas Duftig-Parfümiertes an sich hat. Durchschnittlich rezent, dünnes Mundgefühl. Trockener Abgang mit blasser, eindimensionaler Hopfenwürze. Wäßrig-herber Nachtrunk. - Arg dünnes Industriebier, eher Bierlimonade als richtiges Bier. Immerhin frisch und ohne störende Fehlaromen. Im Notfall noch trinkbar.
On tap several times in Germany. First time tap in 2010. A decent German premium lager. Smooth, watery, thin, tangy and refreshing.

Butelka 0,66; kupiona we włoszech. Podobno ważona wg. niemieckiego prawa czystości.
Kolor żółty, piana o małej fakturze, szybko schodzi, prawie nie zostawiając śladów. 
Przyjemny aromat, trochę jakby suchej trawy, wanili. Piwo mało gazowane, powoduje uczucie małe pełności w ustach, niemniej po wypiciu pozostaje uczucie cierpkości. Krótki finisz, średnio gorzki.

Jak na piwo komercyjne, w zielonej butelce, lagera to naprawdę moim zdaniem bardzo porządne.
Butelka. Barwa słomkowa. Piana obfita opada. Aromat delikatny słodowy. W smaku niska, krótko trwała goryczka. Piwo średnio nasycone pijalne.

Bottle left over from Xmas. Nose is light malt, corn. Taste is corn, very light hop, caramel, slightly stale overpowering corn note in the short dry, slightly spicy, finish. Mouthfeel is lager fizzy. 

It’s a bad commercial larger.
500ml can into glass. Sweet bready malt nose. A few tiny bubbles , yellow/amber, soapy white head. Taste is a little malt, a little hop. Longish slight bitter finish. It’s ok.

Classic 0,33 l bottle. Clear golden in the glass, off white head. Mid grainy on the nose. Starts wirh a pleasant bitterness. Later more malty. Typical northern german Pils, with an easy to drink component. And not a bad one.
Can/ Like the refreshing tangy flavor/ Best when i drink it right after drinking Guinness/Average beer overall
Klares Bier von goldener Farbe. Zuerst erfrischend und dann sehr herb im Nachgeschmack

We bought a case for our New Year Party, and I decided to rate a sample on the following day. 2x275 ml bottles poured cold into a Weizen. Bright golden yellow with a white head. I have some respect and affection for mass produced German lagers for their crowd-pleasing, does- what- it- says- on- the- tin qualities. Like sending "Johnny B. Goode" into space, this would be a way of communicating the initial, unrefined concept of "beer" to aliens. Lemon and popcorn aroma. Similar slightly citric, cereal flavours. Clean crisp refreshing, invites more than one sup. So ubiquitous, I think you should just try it. I’m pretty sure you won’t think it’s awful unless you get a duff ’un.
Anything good or special thing to say. Just a drinkable kind of lager beer.

Probably the most underrated brew on Ratebeer. It has the perfect skunk aroma, and the brew tastes fresh and it is so easy to drink. It is very delicious, and a shame so many people hate on it, a fine German brew!

If you get a fresh bottle of this stuff, it’s decent; that said, for the past few years, all I’ve been able to find were skunky bottles; granted, they were singles and they tend to sit around longer, but seeing that I actually like this stuff when it’s fresh, winding up with a gross, skunky old bottle of it is a real let down.
A couple of years ago, I was visiting my brother’s house, and we were going to watch The Social Network; in that film, there’s a scene where Mark Zuckerberg grabs a beer from his dorm fridge that is apparently intended to be a Beck’s (the name on the bottle not shown, apparently, to avoid any copywright issues, or to enforce a rule of not giving any company free product placement in a film).
Remembering the scene, I was eager to get some Beck’s before starting the film; I didn’t want to go too far, so I wound up at a gas station, where they had a large, single bottle of Beck’s, which I purchased.
I noticed the date, that it was over a year old; my brother insisted that beer stays fresh for years provided it’s kept cold; I tried a sip - awful!!!
My brother tried some, proclaimed it was fine; I informed him that I KNOW what a good, fresh bottle of Beck’s should taste like, and that ain’t it!
I gave him the bottle, and cleansed my palate with some Yuengling or something....

I really have little to say about Becks. Pale, kind of clear looking beer. Bland taste. The aftertaste is what makes it particularly atrocious; there’s a metallic, almost acidic aftertaste to the stuff.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass at Cleo’s. Clear appearance with a small white head. Pale malty, light sweet notes of corn and rice. Light body, pretty easy to drink. Pretty bland and not very good overall.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 09.2015, from Alko, 20141120) I had wished I could tick Bremen by drinking some other beer than this one but no. The beer poured pale golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had sweetness, starch and hint of grass. Palate was rather light bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, something metallic and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and bitter. A harsh and thin brew.

12 oz bottle poured into a wine glass. Aromas of minerals, some floral, some grass and herb, and a slight skunkiness come through as well as a lemon and orange citrus late. It pours a crystal clear, effervescent pale color with a soft and foamy (whipped) white head that retains thick ring and decent layer and leaves an OK amount of puffy lace behind. The taste is a medium bitter and light sweetness. It’s a thin and light beer with a soft champagne-bubble carbonation. The taste is a dry citrus peel with a mild spicy, clean finish to it. It’s crisp and dry with just a slight, acute bitter fruit hint in the aftertaste which is mostly a mild stone-like touch and light spices.
Una buona premium. Seppur molto commerciale, presenta buona presenza dei malti e buoni luppoli. Lunga persistenza in gola, gradevole perchè amara
0.5l can. Clear golden color with small white head. Taste is little sour and bitter. Typical mass product beer, but not bad.
Pretty carbonated. Mildly bitter. Mildly tasteful, but not necessarily a good one. Pretty average.

"mmmmm...skunk. that’s unfortunately the predominant flavor here. i’ve heard that Becks Dark isn’t bad, but i enjoyed this one so little, i have no intentions to spend my hard earned $$ on another of their products. This is the german bud."
Relativ herbes Pilsener, mit schönem Hopfen umd deutlicher Malznote. Süffig mit langem Abgang
Bottle from the local supermarket. Pale blond. Good carbonation, crisp, bitter. Nice but it’s too industrial….drink only when there’s no other option.
0,3l on Tap in Kassel. Gelbes Lager mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht leicht malzig, schmeckt auch so; leichte Hopfenbittere.

aroma of dish water and also a colour to match floral, golden, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, 

not great !
clean crisp lager with a bit of malt flavour. not terrible but a very generic lager. bottle at Maries wedding reception.
its ok. but since the brewery change and the miss of the weed flavour its not the beer anymore i knew.
Couleur dorée, mousse qui disparait. Bon nez houblonné et malt doux. Corps assez pétillant et gout avec bonne amertume, notes douces, fin amère houblonnée. Bien meilleure a ce que je m’attendais.

Aroma: herbs, sulfur.
Appearance: clear golden color, white head.
Taste: medium bitterness (herbs), sulfur, quite dry, bland.
Palate: medium body and high carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Nice bitterness, but this is all.
è una lager, quindi non una birra complessissima, aroma di malto percettibile, una lieve dolcezza iniziale bilanciata da un finale secco. Discretamente pessima, ma almeno bevibile.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color dorado. Sabor a malta. Lager industrial de baja calidad.
12x330ml bottles available everywhere, pours pale gold, it is quite mild but more bitter than many comparable macro lagers,
Tasteless lager, with no aroma, no taste, exactly the same as all others concern beers. Shame for german brewing :)
Zwykły lager, nic specjalnego. Są gorze i lepsze. Ludzie kupują chyba tylko dla marki.
Fairly generic. Pours a light gold with a white head. There’s a bit of hop in there to stop it being too bland.

Weisser kompackter Schaum auf klaren goldgelben Bier. Ein aromatischer Duft steigt in die Nase. Der erste Schluck ist erst einmal bitter. Bitter wird der Gaumen umspielt und fliesst prickelnd die Kehle hinunter. Der Abgang und Nachhall sind auch bitter. Wer’s bitter mag...

Sampled in a 33cl bottle with a Pop Art label in Turkey on holiday. Possibly brewed under licence. Rich golden colour and white head. This world famous lager is pretty poor. Malty aroma with quite a full bread-like taste, but little fruitiness in the hops. Not enough bitterness to balance the very strong malts. Rather bland flavours and a very abrupt finish which is distinctly metallic. A poor advert for German beer.
Klar lys gyllen farve med minimal lyst skum. Lukt av lys malt og gress. Smak av gress og humle. Lett bitter ettersmak. Import.
Duft av humle og malt. Klar lys gyllen farge. Lite skum. Syrlig noe fruktig smak av humle og malt.

One of the many standard lagers in the hands of AB InBev. Pale golden blonde, snow white head; aroma dominated by lightstruck effect (cat pee!), never a good idea to use green bottles just because they’re cheaper than brown ones. Otherwise malt sweetishness but only faintly, thin, grassy hop bitterness in the finish with the retronasal lightstruck effect ruining the small amount of taste it has. I guess this is better from tap, but it remains just another drop in the world-wide ocean of bland pale lagers.

Ein Beck’s hält auch eine Bewertung hier aus, aber muß zunächst als Retter in der Not erwähnt werden. Der Anblick des Bremer Engels im Ausland wenn es nichts Anständiges zu trinken gab ist eine Wonne. "A Beck’s please"... endlich ein herben Geschmack wo sonst nur Wasser und ungewolltes Light Beer war. Genug. Optik und Geruch sind appetitlich. Beck’s ist ein Pils wie es im Lexikon stehen sollte. Die Flasche schwitzt bei meinem Exemplar tatsächlich wie in der Werbung. Die Aromen deuten auf Bitterkeit und Gewürznoten. Im Einstieg schmecke ich die Gewürze die Bitterkeit im Körper liefern. Besser als gedacht. Diese Bier überzeugt mich auch Heute in Deutschland, sogar hier in Bayern. Der Abgang untermauert nochmal die Würznoten. Es ist kein kompliziertes Pils aber es schmeckt paradigmatisch gleich - erkennbar und Pilsig. Macht mal ein Blindtest - man schmeckt den Beck’s!

Reviewed from notes.
I poured this into a pilsener glass.
The appearance was a very clear yellow color with fast rising carbonated bubbles filling a rapidly dissipating head. The head was about less than a quarter finger’s worth. There was barely any lacing.
The smell was pretty skunky and grassy.
The taste was once again skunky.
The palate, well, that was about a light to medium with a decent sessionability running over my mouth and tongue. The carbonation is somewhat harsh but not overly done.
Overall, this was not a bad Euro Pale Lager for the style, however, that skunkiness just doesn’t cut it for me. One and done for this guy.

Piss pale golden yellow colour; Razor-thin head and residual soapy white foam which fades in 5 seconds; Small sticky lacing with very slight carbonation; Pungent smell of malt, with initial skunk (gone in 1 minute) light syrup, light grains, bread, lemon and grass; Mid to light sweet taste of light malt, with light floral, molasses, bread, potent lemon and moderate bitter grassy hops; Light body, thin palate; Mouth feel is like a cheap Helles - thin, with notable malty body, quite good floral, strong notes of molasses, solid breadyness and strong lemon, pretty rare for a macro. Quite okay… Hoppiness is lemon and smelly grass in nose, strong lemon and moderate grass in taste. Bitterness is close to light for an abrupt, low-bitter semi-finish; Dry after taste, fairly easy and lemony to mouth.



Comments: Aside from the green bottle-induced quick skunk, this is actually not bad - solid, Premium-level maltyness, sweet in aroma but not in taste. Flowery, bready and with strong if a little dull lemony hoppiness. Quite okay as a Premium Lager or even a low-end Helles, just steer clear from the green bottles and you got yourself an easy and quite tasty quaffer. Bremen, ticked!

16 oz can into a pint glass.

A: Pours a clear straw color. There’s one fingers worth of white colored head. While retention isn’t great, it’s better than other macro lagers. 

S: There’s some malt sweetness, some corn sweetness, but no skunk, though! Shame there aren’t any hops to cut through the malt, though. Better than Bud, at least.

T: Really, there isn’t much. It’s got malty sweetness, touches of creamed corn, and - most distressingly - a green apple/formaldehyde finish. Finishing bitterness is nonexistent. The flavors aren’t any good, and the off notes are the final nail in the coffin.

M: Nice and light on the palate, but too sweet. Carbonation is healthy, as expected.

O: Well, it lived up to my expectations. No more, no less. Next!

Pours from the bottle like any common lager, with a sunny yellow color (with maybe a hint of green) and a white fizzy head. The aroma is a combination of musty hops, a little bit of lemon, and some light cracker-like breadiness. The flavor features sweet cereal grains, a bit of corn, and only a faint earthy hop character. There is also a little bit of a metallic flavor in the finish, which always tends to turn me off. There is some body, but the light, fizzy carbonation cuts right through it. Overall, this beer is fine and drinkable, but not appreciably different than most other common, mass-produced lagers.

~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

I poured a 24oz can into a 1-liter boot stein. It was canned on July 14, 2013 and cost $2.19 ($0.09 per ounce).



Appearance: Dark gold hue, crystal clear body with plenty of carbonation visible. Pours to a small, white, soapy head which fizzles away and leaves almost no lacing.



Smell: A little less clean-smelling than most macro lagers. Nothing in the way of adjuncts, but nothing appealing to the aroma. Generic "beer smell" if ever there were one.



Taste: I didn’t realize it until I was halfway through, but Beck’s is now brewed in America by Anheuser-Busch (aka Budweiser). I’d like to think the authentic German version, though it is a macro lager, would be a little bit better than "just barely tolerable." While I’ve had several fizzy yellow beers that are much worse than Beck’s, I have to say I’m genuinely disappointed by how bad this beer is. The flavor is virtually non-existent (which is nice, actually), but it’s the awful finish that ruins it. If it tasted like generic macro lager it would be an improvement. Honestly, there’s just nothing for my taste buds to latch on to. Though, the backside of each swig brings with it an astringent, foul taste of something akin to saltwater or maybe even bile. I’m not sure what’s accounting for this, but I definitely don’t like it. I don’t see how anyone could.



Drinkability: Though the beer was plenty bubbly in the glass, the mouthfeel was surprisingly tepid and smooth. I had no trouble drinking down Beck’s in large gulps, but it was at not point refreshing. There’s also a slightly bitter, starchy aftertaste that I could do without. Thankfully, it’s fairly light at 4.8% ABV (according to ratebeer - the can doesn’t indicate). But there’s no reason to buy Beck’s when there’s better macros available.

To be an industrial lager it’s quite good. Malty and softly hoppy taste. Nothing else to say.
Sample at Marianos. Poured clear light yellow with thin head. Aroma of funk malt. Quite smooth corn taste. Ok for the masses.
a german pils, not disgusting... there are more less good lager than a Beck’s (kronenbourg, heineken...)
Can (5 %): Malty, grainy aroma, some hops. Golden color. Flavor is malty, light hoppy with grassy and bitter hops. Boring.
Personalmente la trovo imbevibile. Inodore, amarognola, senza carattere e con un pessimo retrogusto.

Smooth, balanced, and with a clean finish, Beck's is a decent Euro macro-lager. Not complex but offers decent mildly hoppy bitterness to offset average lager sweetness. That being said, it's enjoyable but not hardly memorable. Nor is it really authentically German as I hear it's brewed through InBev in USA and elsewhere. I personally recommend Stella Artois over this if you're interested in European pale lagers. Still, it's drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Tasted from a 12oz bottle. It poured clear golden with abundant effervescence and a bubbly white head with no lacing. A mild aroma of malt and hops. A smooth tasting beer that goes down very easy, but without much to it. It has a slightly bitter finish.

Hoppier, crisper, and more bitter than most mainstream American beers. Clean, straightforward, orderly. Not as complex as most German pilsners. A very strong metallic quality is what I find most off-putting about this beer. Still enjoyable though. It’s not a beer I ever buy, but I enjoy it when it is available at parties and there aren’t more appealing options.
Pale yellow colour, medium carbonation. Artifical taste, sweet malty with some bitter notes. Not good at all.

Refrigerated 12 oz. green bottle poured into a shaker. Pours pale golden with small white head. Aroma is corn with a hint of skunk, light body, medium carbonation, and some thin lacing. Taste is crisp hops with balancing malt. Not bad for a pale lager, but nothing too special.
Пил нашего разлива. Вначале был супер. Сейчас вообще не торт, обычный лагер от ИнБева.

33cl can (5%) from a supermarket on Rhodes. Pours clear pale golden with a dissipating white head. Mild malty and grainy with hints of fruits and some hoppy notes. Medium sweet with a light bitterness and not much flavour. Fairly clean and easy too drink, but boring and forgetable. Pretty nice compared to Mythos, but that doesn’t say much.
Quite good for a premium lager. Not as watery as the others, but with a firm body of bitterness.

Pours clear yellow with a quickly dissipating white head. Nose is grain. palate is a light medium body with an ever so slight malty sweetness that is quickly lost in the slight bitterness of the hops. it is on the light side of German pilsners. 

Sadly, it: It is now brewed in the USA by A-B/InBev. This was done a few decades ago with Lowenbrau. Miller was brewing it in the USA. It was nothing compared to the German brewed beer. The original could still be had in Puerto Rico. After it tanked in sales, it was re-imported. The last time I looked it was still from Germany. When will the macros learn?

It is a nice beer that you should try once. Buy it is not one of my favorite beers.

Bière jaune pâle tirant sur le vert, parfaitement limpide, effervescence moyenne, col blanc très mince. Au goût, c’est plutôt léger, un petit malté sucré suivi d’une finale de houblon herbacé à l’amertume légère. Une bonne bière de soif, mais qui offre peu sur le plan de la dégustation.

In a way this brew epitomises this style of green-bottle pseudo-authentic lager: it’s clean, simple, unadventurous and boring, but definitely not offensive. Refreshing on a hot day. This is a bit better than most mainstream slosh, though, simply because the flavour is not as empty/hollow in the middle. The taste, light though it is, travels very linearly from front to back, not favouring any particular part of the tongue. You could do a lot worse than this.

Très mince, or pâle avec très peu de mousse, et encore moins de bulles. Mouffette, cretons et houblon. Peut-être un peu de sucre. Désaltérante, très aqueuse en fait. Effet "Perrier" et amertume proche de l’aridité. Pas beaucoup de bien à dire de cette version en bouteille de la célèbre allemande, sinon qu’elle étanche la soif, à peine moins bien qu’un verre d’eau. Bon, elle n’est pas franchement mauvaise, mais est loin de soulever la moindre brindille de passion.

ok, german lager.... to acidic, metal.. I cant understand why so many drink it. dry...

12oz bottle, with a limited edition art label (WIlly Chyr). I’m pretty sure that this has been sitting in my parents’ fridge since some point last year... No date anywhere on the bottle, though. It’s a clear green glass  bottle, brewed in St. Louis, MO. Pretty much nothing in the nose. Light bitter taste. Light bite in the finish. Little sweetness. Stronger carbonation. Light body. More dry overall. Clear golden color. Minimal white head around the edge. Few dots of lace. Fine particles visible suspended in the body. I’m not sure if that’s normal for Beck’s, but I don’t mind it, visually. Flavor is mostly watery, but some bread, light hop, hint of corn is there. Not bad, really, especially considering that it’s not fresh. When I was underage, this might have been the first beer (of the macros I’d been trying) that I was impressed by. I have my uncle George to thank for that. Even now, I still think it stands out over other macros. Maybe it’s the nostalgia.
Seems like this should be better than it is.  Don’t detect the complexity - seems like a simple beer

Endlich mal ein norddt. Pils, das wirklich zu überzeugen weiß! Der Unterschied zwischen Faß- und Flaschenbier ist dabei jedoch spürbar unterschiedlich: Vom Faß geradezu unschlagbar süffig, aus der Flasche nicht halb so überzeugend. Nichtsdestotrotz ein Pils mit herbem Einschlag, ohne bitter zu sein! Der Geschmack läßt noch andere Einflüsse zu; der Abgang ist aromatisch herb und nicht metallisch-bitter wie so oft. Über Bremen liegt fast immer dieser aromatische Hopfenduft und verleitet geradezu zu diesem Genuß. Sail away!
