Aroma - green bottles skunk this, but even beyond, there’s not much else except some lager yeast and sweet malts with very little hop presence.  Pale yellow in color.  Head starts out nicely, but it dies quickly.  Lacing is average for the style.  Taste and texture - rather watery with some sweet malt as the aroma suggested.  Bitter hops become more noticeable the more sips I take, but there is a metallic element that is far stronger than preferable.  While free of adjuncts as a premium lager, and essentially drinkable overall with some good points (I’m still tasting the sweet malts several minutes later, for instance), it’s still not great for the style - I would take a macro like Steinlager Pure over this.  With that said, I think Beck’s is better and has more character than Peroni, Bavaria, and Tsingtao from some of the premium lagers I remember and have taken notes on before.
Light straw color; Medium body; Aroma & flavor of hops, grain, and some malt; Finish is slightly bitter; Overall, pretty good macro lager.

Bottle 275ml. Marked down accordingly. If you have huge lungs and use thier full capacity you can just about smells some hopes and a slight maltiness. Appearance wise its very pale - 1 step darker than budweiser and the head doesnt stay around too long but the cardonation does. Taste wise there is a slight hoppiness and maltiness with a mildly bitter finish. Not un[pleasant but not remarkable either. A mass manufactured, not as successful as others, lagre lacking in character but not harh on the taste buds.

Very pale straw colored pour with a small white head. Mild skunk, despite the can, with a bit of sulfur, water, and straw. Incredibly bland and aroma-less. The flavor is not really any better. Light grain sweetness along with some straw and grass. A touch of sulfur and a very watery flavor profile overall.
Inte mycket smak. Väldigt vattnig. Tyvärr samma nivå som "mainstream" från danmark och USA
Jag säger NEJ! Det finns inga undanflykter och inga advokater i världen kan försvara det här. Det här är inget annat än onödigt och ett slöseri med utrymme på jorden.

I don’t reallly understand why this beer is so popular. it has a clear colour, the foam is gone right after pouring it into the glass. It tastes very watery and there is next to no palate one can distinguish. Disappointing.
Viele gute Biere weltweit, aber egal wo ich bisher auf der Welt war. Wenn ich die Wahl hatte, habe ich immer zu Becks gegriffen.
very light malt aroma, golden in appearance with a nice head. taste is slightly malty at first and finishes with a slight bite.
Blank and emotionless, though mild hops, but otherwise do drink, not kudiagi not remember and do not call again meet.
A lager from Germany...with all of the other good beers to be had, this is just average. Slightly more flavorful than the macrobrew pale lagers, but not much.
Bottle@ streets of Kolymbia, Greece, 33cl. Foamy small head, yellow coloured to golden. Aroma of hops and malts. Taste: a little bitter hoppy in the taste, medium bodied. medium finish.
Bottle@home, 33cl. Head: white colored foam. Color: yellow golden. Aroma: hops, malt. Taste: hops, some bitter. Palate: smooth, low CO2, bitter, medium body. medium finish. Overall: nice.

500ml can. A clear straw body, big white head, medium retention. Aroma of grass, autumn leaves, hay, cereals. Taste is pretty malty, a good dose of herbal hops with some metallic tones, cereals. Light body, soft carbonation, medium long bitter finish.

The smell is powerful, very chemical and volatile. Hardly an "aroma’. It hits your nose immediately as you open the bottle. That funny bitter note into a lager flavour, malty, cheap, watery and a bit of cardboard, with hardly any palate. Nice drink to have very very cold, or else you’ll taste how bad it is. I love Bremen, but there’s better beer in that city. This one, I will give das Boot...
Bigboy bottle at Pete’s. Pale piss. Fizzy. White head. A fairly bland Pilsener. Some bitterness on the end. This doesn’t have a strong character.
Bottle. Quite okay pilsener. All the typical pilsener hints are there. Good hop taste. Also a nice lingering aftertaste. One of the better German pilseners.

66 cl bottle, 1.35€, 5%. Pale yellow color with classic white head. Hops and straw on the nose. Aroma of straw, mild honey, grassy hops. Taste is slightly bitter. Texture is watery to oily, average carbonation, thin body. Industry standard, a bit weak.

On tap at the Thistle Hotel Atrium bar in Brighton.  Headless pale lager with a barely detectable dirty, metallic aroma.  Crisp and clean to taste but lacking anything beyond the initial metallic bitterness.  I recently had the alkoholfrei version and if I?m honest I preferred that one. Re-rated and upgraded slightly 11/02/13 at Ibis City Hotel London, from a bottle.

Bottle @ Kriterion, Amsterdam.
Bremen and Hamburg have always had an intense rivalry, but beer wise Hamburg wins this hands down; Jever is much better than Beck’s.
Don’t get me wrong, it is a pretty good lager. I just don’t like the strong maltiness and lack of bitters. Other than that, pretty ok middle of the road. Nothing memorable, or it should be the fact that the Das Boot crew drank it on board.

Lattina da 33 cl.
Giallo paglierino carico, limpido, con schiuma bianca abbastanza persistente...
aromi lievi di luppolo 
in bocca è secca, amarognola, con sentori metallici......
da bere esclusivamente ghiacciata, altrimenti risulta imbevibile.....

Muy en la onda de otras cervezas alemanas y checas. Con su personalidad, sobre todo en el tránsito, que la hace reconocible. La sucede un poco lo que a la Pilsner Urquell, que siendo una cerveza "sencilla", no es un prodigio de la facilidad para beberla...como si fuera demasiado densa para una Lager.

Aroma: hay, barnyard, slunky. Appearance: a clear straw pour with a billowy white head that quickly disappears and no lacing. Taste: biscuit, grain. Mouthfeel: medium-light moderate carbonation. Overall: yawn 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quaffable beer, pouring golden with a white wee head. Noses a bit hop and hay/straw like. Develops a certain sweetness and is rather medium bodied. Lively CO2 and a bit thin. Finish is rather unspectacular but ok.

On 50 cl can from Kiel.
Golden color, good foam.
aromas of wheat, very small hoppy note
Light body and complexity.
Some bitterness?
Pretty ok but not impressive
(bottle) pale yellow colour with small white head; aromas of noble hops; weak balanced flavour with no finish, very much an inoffensive  mass produced lager

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear golden color with mid-sized frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of barley and corn malt, grassy hops and some hay. Taste starts sweet malty and is followed by dry, crisp and relatively bitter finish. Medium body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. It’s a bit above average industrial lager...

330ml bottle. Calabria, Italy. Pours a crystal clear golden yellow with a medium quickly fading white head. Aroma and Taste of lemon citrus fruity flavors, some grainy grassy cereal notes, and light bitterness. Palate is a medium slightly crisp body, with moderate carbonation. Finish is citrus fruity notes, grainy grassy notes, light bitter notes as well. Overall an ok summer time lager.

0,5 l bottle. Pours in thin gold. Smell is citrus and the taste has a hint of it. At the finish it is very bitter. In the end it is a beer to get refreshed. Drink it fast - only then you’ll enjoy. Typical industrial made beer. But compared to others a good one.
Nothing special. Light golden in colour, slightly bitter in taste, aromas of citrus fruits combined with cinnamon rolls

Location/Date:Can on July 31st, 2012 at Fairgrounds outside Nationals game.



Appearance: Clear gold. 
 

Aroma: Largery malt aroma of hay.
 

Taste: Faint bitterness, overwhelming light malt.
   

Palate:Light body, non-lingering aftertaste.



Summary: I’ve had worse lagers, that’s about all I can say.

330ml bottle. Clear pale golden colour with average, frothy, white head. Grainy and strawy aroma. Monotonous bitter hoppy taste with almost undetectable grainy, malty undertone. Bitter, slightly soapy finish.
0,33l bottle. A clear golden lager with white head. Soft aroma with notes of malt. Slightly sweet taste. Soft bitter finish. A drinkable beer.

50 cl. can @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn. Pale yellow with a tin quickly disappearing white head. Grainy, grassy, perfumy aroma. Thin bitter taste with a hint of resin. Lively carbonation and a rather short aftertaste

500ml can. Pours plain yellow (Lovibond 4) with average disappearing head. Thin lace. Smells of faint hops and floral once the wet dog smell from the head dissipates. Taste is bland. Mild yet plain and uninteresting.  Rates higher because of the thirst quenching and easy drinking attributes. Palate is wonderfully dry, crisp and lively.
Bottle. Not the worst lager and it fulfilled it’s task of being refreshing on a hot day.
eines der besten deutschen Bier -- Beck’s geht immer -- Warum muss ich hier so viel schreiben?

Draught; free airport lounge rating, Frankfurt
Yellow color. Honestly, this has at least a very light malt aroma and flavor, and balanced bitterness. Boring but not offensive.
Absolutes deutsches Lieblingsbier. Schmeckt gut, riecht gut, ist gut. Absolut empfehlenswert!

275ml Green bottle at 5% and imported into the UK. Really surprised to find I’d never ’done’ this beer on the web.

Becks have been importing into the UK for many, many years, one of the first German breweries to do so since WW11.

Anyway this beer looks the part: clean, clear and bright, typical Pilsner in fact.

Drier than a lot of the German Pilsners and certainly well carbonated, one of my minus points about Becks is the uber fizzy nature of the brew once bottled.

A staple German Pilsner that does have a hop taste and a dry finish unlike some of its counterparts.
one of the more acceptable watery supermarket beers. quite a vegetable type aroma that could be mistaken for hops

Aroma has stuffy vegetable and barn. Malting on top. Not that nice aroma. Clear golden with short head. Taste is a lot like aroma, stuffy. Medium bodied with standard carbonation. Stuffy like potato cellar, did not like.

0,25 l bottle on the rooftop of Hotel Adriana in Hvar. Small white head on a sparkling golden body. Sweet, light malts and a little metallic hint on the nose. Sweet and bitter with a papery note in the finish. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Yawn.
Can@Poggio. One finger vaporising foam.Faint malty notes. Quite dry some sourness. In the bucket with all the boring lagers in this World. Rerated 8/3-14. Gressoney. Watery.
0,5l can. Clear yellow color. Small head, disappears quickly. Malty, plastic, filthy aroma. Watery, malty, plastic flavor. Nothing special.
Solid beer for any occasion nothing special but always satisfying, always avaiable and for those who don’t know whaz to order ypu can never go wrong with it
Nothing special but you get it everywhere - wether you want or not. Sadly the marketing is better then the product
Aroma is hooi en wat friszoet. Smaak is gebalanceerd, hangt naar het zoetige toe met softe bitters, bloemen. Uit blik. #2 van de tap @ brouwerij. Beetje hetzelfde.

Skunk like aroma and an active golden pour with a surprisingly balanced taste and basic mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is crisp and clean, but it didn’t leave an overall lasting impression on me as being unique.
710ml bottle.  Pours golden in colour with small white head.  Pretty sweet, light hop hit.  Good.

Beck’s is one of the leading beers worldwide. If you encounter it, you know that you’ll get a solid drink, especially if it’s served cold. But on the other hand, it just isn’t any special at all. It’s got a nice colour and a bitter, maybe harsh taste - but not bad, more, like, refreshing.
500 ml can. Pours a clear gold with medium head. Aroma of honey and cereal. Sweet cardboard taste with light bitter finish. Good for quaffing after mowing the lawn...
Bottle to pint. Looks fine. Smells skunky, but in a good way. Tastes like it smells with a little bite. Average on the palate. Not bad for what it is.
Nothing special. Typical mass beer. Though a bit hoppy. Good if only other  mass beers are available.
Gutes Bier, vielleicht etwas zu mild, aber man kann es gut Trinken und schmecken tut es auch
Not a bad beer but you can drink better beers with its price. This is my fourth or fifth choice if my local grocery store is out of other beers I prefer most lol
Clear golden colour with large white head. Aroma is hoppy and malty with dry gassy mouthfeels, fresh with medium body and mild finish.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the can.

Golden color bitter smell and taste. Decent enough pilsner style in a pinch but nothing great.           

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bouteille 330ml. Couleur jaune paille translucide, mousse blanche fugace. Arôme de céréales, sucré, un peu herbal. Goût similaire aux arômes. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-faible.

Bottiglia da 50 cl. La cosa migliore è l’aspetto, oro carico con schiuma bianca fine mediamente persistente. Al naso il nulla o quasi, latta un leggero malto e nulla di più.Al palato sentori di latta un leggero citrico con un inizio tendente al dolce per chiudere con:"non si capisce come chiude". Da bere fredda in caso solo di grande sete.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a finger of white head that settles to reveal only a few spots of lacing.  Aroma is grainy with some floral and grassy hops.  Taste is light malty sweetness with a crisp, clean hop bitterness in the finish.  A slight step above a typical macro lager due to the clean finish.
Transferring my data before I used to rate at Ratebeer. I’ll add a more detailed description as I drink it again, I promise.

330 ml bottle in a private party in Hamburg
One of my favorite macro pilsener beers from Germany
A bit hoppy and fresh beer.Ok carbonation and a balanced pale beer.

Aspetto classico, oro limpido con fragile schiuma bianca. Aroma molto debole vagamente maltoso con isolate punte di dolce; gusto dolciastro inizialmente ferroso che evolve verso un amarognolo sgraziatamente luppolato. Leggera ma non acquosa, finale molto pasticciato; annoia in fretta.

what can i say, the beer is far too hops based, and the for me there was no fruity flavours, but rather the taste of metal.

An example of mass produced shit.
Bottle. Light  brownish color mil foam on top sort of tryin to stick to the glass. bready and sllighty hoppy. well balanced for a macro

Pours a straw color with a thin white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is floral with a little bit of skunk.  Flavor is a little bit biscuit and finishes dry with not a lot of hops.  Very light.  Its not offensive just not a lot of flavor

Can 0,5l  - Brewed at Bergenbier SA (StarBev) 

Appearance: Clear pale yellow color with an average, creamy, good lacing, long lasting white head. 

Aroma: -light- malts, grains, metal 

Taste:light sweet with a light bitter, dry, soury finish 

Palate:Body is medium,  carbonation is average.

Well, apparently I’m in the minority for liking this. I do, though. I see nothing wrong with it in the slightest; I consider it a very nice representation of the style, largely because of the mouthfeel, which goes very well with the flavour and is not watery at all. Smooth like marbles.

UPDATE: I’d just like to point out that I’ve only had Beck’s in Asia, which would be the German version instead of the American, I’ve heard they changed the recipe for that market.
So average that it hurts. This beer does not stand out in any direction, some hoppy flavors, but more crispy and fresh.
Bottle at a bar in Hamburg.  Clear golden pour with a white head.  Aroma of light malt and hops with a little skunkiness.  Flavour is bland, light malt, light bitter.

Pours a clear yet carbonated light golden with a decent white head.  Aroma is grainy and skunky.  Taste is as well, but not as dreadful.  Has a bit of a grassy taste to it as well that helps.  Lighter, yet not exactly refreshing.  Instead of settling on buying this, try digging a little deeper for something better.

(Flasche) Es hat eine helle, goldgelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Beim ersten riechen nichts gerochen, dann kommt irgendwann ein leicht würziger Hopfen vor einer leichten Süße. Der Geschmack ist wie das Aroma, Nix->recht Bitter->leichte Süße. und die Bittere bleibt im Abgang leicht hängen. Die Karbonisierung passt. Zusammengefasst; langweilig bis wässrig.
Golden with low head. Peppery aroma. Roasted malt dominates taste, some metal. Low carbonation, low bitterness.

A decent every day drinking beer.  It’s not full flavored, bitter or dark enough for my taste buds, but there’s nothing wrong with the taste either.  The lack of distinctive qualities, will make this beer appeal to many beer drinkers as there’s nothing to get turned off by.

Clear yellow collor with small head. I didnt like it. It has watery taste with overly carbonation. Smell was skunky hops and some wheat.
Maybe original Beck’s is somewhat better than this one in can which was produced and filled in Zagreb, Croatia.
Pale yellow color with a small head; aroma is somewhat like sulfur, grass, and light malts; malted barley, flowery grassy hops; crisp finish

Notes I found from back in 2008. Clear light gold with white head. Nose is some grains and a good bit of skunk. Taste is about the same. Reminds me of Heineken but just a little better. Overall, not my cup of tea. I’ll drink this tonight because it’s free.
bread, hay, grass, golden, clear, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation,

0,5L, bottled. I drank this beer after work when I was in Germany. Its main quality being that it’s a refreshing party beer. I had some good moments with friends drinking this one beer, symbol of our Erasmus time in Berlin.
Bottle; pale yellow; crisp, refreshing; the dry fizzy flavourlessness of sparkling water; short, dry, slightly bitter finish; a useful thirst-slaker, no more.

Standard clear and yellow commercial German pils with some grassy and citrus notes. Medium bitter taste and lively carbonation. Well, one has to admit that it is really refreshing out of the famous green bottle on a hot summer day. But that’s it. Still one of the better German pils beers.

Green bottle poured a clear yellow with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of straw, corn, light spicy hops and a hint oif citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread, straw and a hint of spicy hops with a crisp finish.

Bottle- Pours a pale yellow color with a small fizzy head and only bits of lacing. Smell of grain and hint of sweetness but with a musty aroma in the background. Taste of grain with a mild sweetness. Sort of a husk bitterness and a fairly clean finish. Light body, smooth crisp and quite refreshing.
Standard Euro Style lager. not much else to add.
One of the better commercial beers, my bottle is German brewed. Still despite what I’ve just said this lacks character. Hint of hops and malt. Pale and small head. Not hugely exciting.
Clear bright yellow, foamy white head fades. Sweet grainy malty aroma. Light skunky malty low hopped Euro-lager flavor. Average carbonation, thin and watery. finishes bitter. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

Bottle. Pours a yellow body, with an average white head that diminishes, leaving a fair lacing. Very nice hoppy aroma, with notes of grass, and a little bit sweet. But, the flavor was a disappointment. Very watery, light bitter, like soda. Thin body, medium to high carbonation, not worth it.

pours a straw yellow with a small white head fades to nothing.  aroma is of sweet malts, pilsner malts, and some citrus hops. Taste is sweet malts and some citrus hops mainly.  has a light body with a super watery mouthfeel and a slightly dry, very slightly bitter finish.  overall, decent for a macro brewed by Inbev.
Pours a very pale yellow color. Smell is of grains and malts. Taste is crisp, light and mild, some grains and malts. Overall a mediocre beer.

Bote de 330ml.Vaso de Tubo.Saboreada en ene´12.Color dorado pálido.Transparente.Corona blanca,túpida,con retención por encima de la media del Estilo.Olores a levadura,grano y lígeramente metálicos. Entrada chispeante,amargor seco.Cuerpo lígero y carbonatación alta.Final astringente y cítrico.Fácil asimilación. (Etiqueta: 5% ABV. 330ml can.Stange glass.Enjoyed on jan´12.Pale golden color.Cristal clear.White,close, froth.Retention above style medium average. Yeasty,grainy,slightly metallic odors.Crispy upfront,dry bitterness.Light body,high carbonation. Citric astringent finish.Easy drinkability. (Label indicates 5.0% ABV).

16 oz can.  When is a German beer no longer a "german bier" - when it is made in St. Louis by Inbev, that’s when!  Sorry folks, this beer now goes off the "buy list" as the Brazillian Suits running Inbev under the cloistered shadow of Belgium have finally struck a nerve here!  This Beck’s is no longer a German import beer.  It looks like the old Beck’s, but be careful.  The can is deceptive with words like "originated in Bremen, Germany" not "made in Bremen, Germany! "   The can is even shorter, yet claims to be 16 oz. - sorry ,I left my pipette at the office so no way to check accuracy.  This whole deception reminds me of Miller Brewing and Lowenbrau back in the 70’s.  Lowenbrau was a great German beer imported by Miller.  Then, Miller took a turn at  " making " it here in the US which was a disaster! Walk past this product and buy true German beer  made in Germany  -beer like Bitburger or Spaten .  It is time to send those Inbev badolero boys back to the slumgulch Brazil, heavens!  Prosit!

Can.  Pours a macro clear yellow with a white head that dissipates quickly.  There is some mild lacing.  The aroma is pretty dead.. some malt.. some skunk.  The taste is medium bodied and fairly crisp.  The flavor is pretty much a malty lager with nothing but a dry finish to distinguish it from any other macro-brew from Europe.  Pretty meh.

Just like those German beers, although this one is very pale. Bitter taste is good, foam is good.

Pale honey light coloration with a light crisp head. A bit skunky, but better than many lagers. It starts with a light sweetness, but finishes with a strong dry hoppy taste. Drinkability is Ok.
fruity, floral and a musty/soapy lager yeast on the nose.  Taste is fruity, some apple notes, floral hops and a bitter finish.  It is OK, not too offensive but nothing really going on.

Just had one. God awful! Tastes like piss with alcohol in it. ;p
Why even bother making stuff like this and calling it beer!? It’s an insult to our taste buds. If you wanna get drunk, then drink shots of whiskey, for God sakes! When i drink beer i want it to taste Delicious. This crap is horrible.

Pale colour, clear, medium thin head.  Had a typical fresh north german pils smell with some noble hops, slightly industrial.  Tasted crisp, had a grainy finish, not too much going on but refreshing. Not a great feel to it, it was tough on the palate.  Becks is best enjoyed in Bremen on a warm day near the Weser river.
From first tip circa ’96....consistently balanced, medium bodied and pleasant. Touch above commercially.

aroma, malty cereal, tottise roll sugary 
color, golden hue, white head that has good retention
taste, malty sugar totties roll on the front, hardly any hops
overall, nice ok easy to drink.

As I said on the Heineken comments I prefer this over most commercial beers. Is had decent taste and decent lager.

Straw color with not much foam or lace. Aroma is that of almost invisible hops, sulfur, and dank. Initial taste contains moderate carbonation and a watery hop taste with some bitterness, malt also present in minimal amounts.

From a can. Clear yellow/golden with a medium head. A quite nasty smell arises when you open the can. After this is gone, some typical grass/hay-flavours can be noticed. A little malty, medium bitter with a few floral grassy notes. nothing special.
spruce, cereal, butterscotch, leaves, golden, rocky head, hazy, medium body, thin feel, bitter, soft carbonation, medium bitterness,
I"m was really disapointed. Too sweet, the hops flavour is much too weak for a northern pilsener. No character at all.
Bottle.  Germany’s finest mass export beer is a clean tasting and flavoursome, its weak look disguised by the green bottle.
Pours a clear pale gold with a medium size white head that dissipates quickly.  Nose is hay and grass.  Taste is pleasant and crisp.  It is a decent beer for the style, nothing special.
Cannette 500 ml. 5%.  Arôme de maïs, houblon. En bouche, céréale, malt et un peu d’herbes. Finale avec une très légère amertume. Bonne.
Classic Lager, tasted several times in bottle. Nothing intersting in this beer

+ een pils met een aparte smaak
+ aroma is erg lekker, het doet me denken aan wiet
+ verfrissend bier
- na 2 pils is de aroma en de smaak volledig weg

Helaas kan ik niet meer noteren als deze rating. Dit komt doordat ik dit biertje te slecht vond om er meer over te kunnen noteren.
Can. Clear golden colour with a white head. Slightly metallic aroma of malt and hops. Taste is mostly malt. Clearly on the better side of bulk lagers.
İt is a decent german pilsner but fresh, some hops aroma and nice golden apperance makes it pretty cool..
I’m a big fan of german beer but this is very ordinary.  A  hoppy aroma with a somewhat bitter taste.  It remonds me of beer party beer from my school days.
A typical pale yellow pils/ helles. Some vague herbs in the aroma. Palate mild watery with semisweet maltiness. Aftertaste hints of hops, short watery finish.

10 YEARS OF 2PAC "not too bad. not too good either. it’s drinkable, but not if it’s overpriced. " -2pac.  Skunky, drinkable.  I agree when 2pac says that it’s not drinkable if it’s overpriced - because I simply won’t buy it if it’s over priced.  Not too bad, not too good.

When 2pac wrote "not too bad. not too good either. it’s drinkable, but not if it’s overpriced." he provided us with an honest statement about the beers mediocrity and his concern over it’s price. 

I’m not sure what the price of this beer is in Australia, but I paid about $2.50 usd for a 24oz can of it at the grocery store the other day. 

The beer pours a very clear golden color with a big fluffy white head that goes away fairly quickly leaving some lacing on the glass. 



The aroma is grainy, with some honey, and a fair bit of alcohol. A little bit of fruity hoppiness shows through, but it’s pretty sweet and grainy smelling all together. 



The flavor is fairly herbal and hoppy, but this sort of clashes a little with the astringency of the beer. The malt character is fairly grainy and the finish is very clean. The alcohol is fairly noticeable in the flavor as well, which is sort of weird. 



The mouthfeel of the beer is lively and sharp and this would have a nice overall palate but for the astringency. 



I don’t remember ever thinking that this beer was all that good, but I remember enjoying it more than this.

Yes, it’s a macro-lager, but I don’t mind Becks. Poured a clear amber with a small head and fine sparkle. Taste is mainly malt with an overlay of hops. The palate is longer than I expected. Just a tip for those in Australia, this is the imported version, not the watery local one.
12 oz bottle pours straw with a white head.  Aroma of yeast and malt.  Taste is also yeast with a hint of the bitter hops.
As they say in München: "Beer for little girls", but later... it’s not bad at all. It looks like pee, but it is easy in the mouth.
Bottle. Pale gold with a white head. Grainy aroma with some floral hops. Light, clean and sweet with modest bitterness. Dull but perfectly respectable and refreshing on a warm night.
Can. Golden colour, white head that did not last long. Aroma is grass and grains. Taste is sour grains, light hop, non-descript. Nothing interesting of note here.

33cl bottle. Golden colour with a good formation of white head. Aroma is herbal and grainy. Flavour is fresh, grassy and herbal, with a final very slightly bittery. Carbonation is medium. Body is light.
Nothing to write home about, that’s for sure. Crisp beer, best served cold. OK white head...definitely better than most of the mass produced Canadian lagers.

Drank from a bottle. Tough to see in the bottle, but it appeared to be pale and clear. Minimal head. Minimal lacing on the top. Minimal film on the sides. Will give it the benefit of the doubt because it was tough to see and go with a 2.5 (5.0 for RateBeer).

Smelled of skunky malts up front. Grainy, earthy and corn malts as well. 

Tasted similar to the nose. Skunky, earthy malts up front. I want to say cereal malts, too. Slightly bitter finish.

Light body. Thin texture. Average-to-lively carbonation.  Long bitter finish. Crisp, clean and refreshing.

Overall just a below average beer. Skunky rules the day.
Bottle and can. Nothing really special for me: a typical lager, perhaps, a little bit better than the average. Almost no, watery taste for me.
Bottle.  Very forward nose, with lots of carbonation.  Typical German beer, very dry, light hop flavor.  Slightly astringent finish.  Very drinkable, would buy again on occasion.
J’ai évolué dans ces lagers désinvoltes.  La Beck’s c’est d’abord la moufette, mais aussi une bière de party.  C’est mieux qu’une bud, moins qu’une pilsner tchèque.  Elle mérite un upgrade.
nothing to say. it’s something easy to get drunk. I suggest to try it very cold in the bottle.

33cl bottle. Clear and boring golden with a little white head. Nose : fresh grass notes with bread aromas. Once poured into a glass the aromas are getting weak. I sensed some little herbal and citrus aromas too. Sip : a little bit more "full" then a water. Strong carbonation. Weak taste of slightly sweet bread malts, very little sour transition into metallic little bitter hops on the end. This kind of beer I get reflux from ....

Herb-bitterer Antrunk, klar und frisch. Geringe Grasnoten sind in der im Vordergrund stehenden Bitterkeit vorhanden, diese steigern sich im Mittelteil. Wenig hopfig. Weiter frisch und ausgewogen. Gelungen herbes Pils. 9/11/11/10/8/11
Clean, crisp and refreshing..there is some sweetness, malt and a hops bite. Its quite a good lager, but not my favorite.
Bottle. Skunk bomb! Clear pale yellow pour with a decent sized white head. Nose is all skunk. Lighter palate. Taste is skunky grain, with slight hops. Pretty terrible.

Not bad. More flavor and less skunk than your typical mass-produced green bottle lager, but nothing special for sure. Yellow with a small white head. Aroma of decent pale lager, taste the same. Light-medium bodied.
For a lager it is not repulsive.  Wet hay, grain and a tad metallic.  I would have no problem drinking this if handed to me.
500ml can mountain top. nice lager slightly bitter aftertaste. would have again but its dear for what it is.

500ml can. Not much aroma, aluminum can cuts down on the skunkiness, only a tiny whiff of it. Poured a pale, clear, light gold with a medium white head that disappeared right away. Taste is somewhat better than most North American macros with some actual hops present even if it isn’t that bitter. Not too sweet, either. Taste is mostly kind of a hay/grass sort of thing with a little herbal hops. Palate is quite light with lots of carbonation. Easy to drink. Overall, somewhat better than most macros, but not so much better than it won’t be popular with the 12 pack crowd.

330 ml bottle. Pale gold in colour with an aroma of grass and a slight urine smell. The taste is slightly sweet with a fairly crisp, dry finish. Not the nicest of aftertastes, but fairly muted. The aroma is clearly the worst offender here.
A bit of hops and malt on the taste and aroma..... Nothing special.... Just a descent lager...
From bottle 33cl, pours a clear yellow and almost no head.  Aroma, terrible smell, roten malts.  Flavors, just plain roten rice.  Horrible stuff.
12oz bottle.  Looks light and golden with a thin, white head.  Aroma of light, pale malts and light hops.  Flavor the same, with a little sweetness.  Average to light texture.  A decent beer.
Better than your average, run of the mill mass produced lager, but not by very much.
Slightly spicy and sour aroma of malt and hops. Fresh and slightly sweet malt flavor, but unfortunately also pretty thin and watery. But still quite okay beer on a hot summer day!

On tap at Dubai airport. Not too interesting, but not offensive either. Aroma: hay, wet leaves, hint of caramel. Taste: sweet, with short duration. Palate: thin and watery. Appearance: yellow, with a frothy head.

I think the skunky, hoppy smell of beck’s is the best part about it.  The taste doesn’t leave you with nearly the same taste of hops as the promising smell.  Kind of fouls after a while.  Inbev, go figure
bottle at fabulas, lisbon, portugal. High hops, barley and cereals aroma. Nice golden and slightly cloudy apperance, and nice small head. Overall interesting.

can.  Poured clear pale straw coloured with a big rocky bleach white head. Crisp fresh grassy aroma, a bit of skunkiness though. A light-medium mouthfeel, crisp,easy drinkability. A nice sweet, bready malt flavour, just enough grainy bitterness to balance it out. A nice imported macro.

On tap. Probably my preferred of the macros widely available in UK, although it’s too strong for sensible drinking. Pale gold colour, some hint of dryness of a genuine hoppy pilsener, but still has something of that metallic menace of overly strong fighting lager.

Poured from bottle into nucleated pint glass. Clear golden color with thick white head, no lace. Aroma of grain and some flowery hops. Well-balanced flavor, but no real grist complexity. Crisp, dry lager aftertaste. Very neutral and drinkable, though interchangable with many other lagers.
Bottle - unable to pour out of bottle, light crisp flavor with a nice mild fruity aftertaste

Bottle:
Oh yeah, Becks, didn’t rate it, yet…
Small white head on top of a clear light yellow colored beer.
Smell and taste are not that good. Though it’s absolutely not spectacular either…
Some older hops, herbs and malts in the taste. Bit low and dirty like Heineken, but than again, different, but not good.
What else… Oh I am waiting for the barrel aged series of this one… Pfff…
It poured a yellow color with a small white head. The aroma was of sweet pils malt and faint grass. The flavor was mostly sweet, with a touch of hops on the finish.

Very pale yellow, white head. Aroma of malts, flavour of malts. Refreshing but thin and rather bland.

(From 33cL bottle)

Bottle, Paradise Sports Bar, Dundas St. W., Toronto. Pours straw yellow with frothy white head. Pronounced grainy aroma with hints of skunk. Light bodied, well carbonated. Some bitterness in taste with dry, crisp finish. Drinkable.

Very light yellow, good white head.  Some skunk in the aroma followed by a crisp and light malt taste with a good balance of bitterness - most of that skunk disappears in the taste.  The finish is dry and bitter

Skunkarrific serve this beer ice cold! Nothing special here. The national BMC beer of Germany!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear fizzy yellow with a white head.  Grassy aroma.  Taste is sweet honeyish malt w/ light herbal hops.

Beck’s has a thick, white head and a clear, yellow-straw appearance, with lots of bubbles streaming up and lots of lacing left behind. The aroma is of roasted barley, clean water, and bitter hops. Taste is likewise of mild barley, water, and at the middle to the end, bitter, pleasing hops. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Beck’s finishes crisp, clean, refreshing, and dry. If there is a negative to associate with this beer, I don’t know what it is. I love it, and I strongly suggest giving it a try.  RJT
A watery simple pale lager. Not much to distinguish it from Bud, Michelob, Miller etc other than the German heritage

Originally rated July 2006. This review was taken from a single 330ml can bought at the LCBO. Rated at 5% ABV. Pours a light yellow colour with active bigger bubble carbonation. The white head is a good size, creamy and fizzy, with decent retention and sticky lace. The nose is crisp with malt and some little hop behind. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel with a good amount of grass in the taste. Mild bitterness in the middle with a soft clean finish. Light honey seems present as well. Nice blend between it and the grassy hop, and not being too sweet. A well-brewed average German lager that is easy to find across the world. I prefer this one over Heineken.

66cl bottle in Milan.
Ok white head.  Pale golden pour.  Nothing to write home about.  Bland

33cl Bottle.  Appearance is clear, golden yellow color with medium, off-white head.  Aroma is mostly sweet malts, a little musty, some herbal hops.  Taste is similar with malt sweetness dominating along with the herbal hoppiness.  Palate is light-bodied, crisp texture, average carbonation, and a sweet finish.  For a macro-lager, this one is decent and drinkable.

(Can 0,5l)
Sweet, grainy aroma. Clear light yellow color. Minimal white head. Medium grainy sweet, light sour. Light fizzy. Medium body. Astringent finish.
( 4 . 2 . 4 . 3 . 9 = 2.2)



(Bottle 0,33l)
Light grainy aroma. Clear yellow color. Quickly done white bubbly head. Light sour, light sweet. Light fizzy. Very light bitter, very dry finish.
( 4 . 2 . 3 . 3 . 8 = 2.0)
1/5 i mörkhet. Luktar lätt maltigt, vattning, lite söt och besk i smaken med en lätt besk eftersmak.
Little head, many bubbles and a yellow colour. Nose is very ligth and crisp. Medium body and length. Taste is very light, but pure. High drinkability but nothing to remember.
Bottle. A little bitter. An okay, pretty generic pale lager. Nothing special here.
in pint form this can be either really good or really bad. it is one of the better world available lager beers.
Can. Pours light straw coloured with a small white head. Aroma is light hoppy and malty. Taste is light crisp hops at the end, everything else was just sweet water. Average.
Bottle (66cl) Nice hoppy pilsner in german style, highly drinkable and good for a global industrial beer

Makes you think the can had more influence on the aroma than the ingredients. Tastes like rather traditional German Pilsner but with more water and more metalic. Not a very good beer not even as a refresher.
Basic lager rubbish like there are scores upon scores. Nothing noteworthy about it at all.

0.33l bottle. Clear golden and smooth body with a small white lager-head. Aroma is very good an metallic. Some dusty hops and hints of pale malts. Not much more. Really oily mouthfeeling, medium- to light-bodied and average carbonation. Flavors are pale malts with a mild dusty and light bitter finish and a watery and almost burned aftertaste. Boring lager.
(This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

0.33l bottle. Pours a clear pale golden body with a small white lager-head. Aroma is subtle. Some dusty hops and hints of pale malts. Not much more. Really oily mouthfeeling, medium- to light-bodied and average carbonation. Flavors are pale malts with a mild dusty and light bitter finish and a watery and almost burned aftertaste. Boring lager.
It pours a light yellow with a fizzy head, it smells of straw and slightly skunky hops, it’s bland with a little bit of skunk, it’s significantly better than Heineken but it’s still pretty crappy.
Pale straw, white head that subsides in time. You know what you’re getting with Becks. There’s nothing wrong with this beer, but the its not exactly perfect so I would say alittle above average  brew
Clear, drinkable, it deprives of body, little acid, bitter taste. Like Many.
Its a shit beer to be honest would only drink it if ther was nothing else in sight

Classic mass production lager that has nothing special to offer. Typical appearance, yellow gold colour and a white head. Medium bitterness, some hint of hops and a watery feel. Like all lagers of the same value it drinks easily.

12oz bottle.  Hyper filtered orange-tan.  Thin, fading head.   Peppery sweet classic aroma.  Light to medium bodied, rather simplistic and straightforward.  A little bit buttery and faded, not so impressive.  Mild, standard Euro-Lager.  Whateva.

Bon, aujourd’hui c’est très chaud et humide ici (28 degrés C) et cette petite bière fait l’affaire. Elle n’est certainement pas extraordinaire, mais son odeur de mouffette me plaît. Elle est très pâle, goûte très peu et se boit presque comme de l’eau.
Easy to drink pilsener. Nothing really special. Not as bad as the ratings here say. It’s just the style that can be a bit boring.
L’ho bevuta proprio l’altra sera che ero a cena a casa di amici, e la padrona di casa aveva fatto un ottima pizza...

Looks for all intents and purposes like a German lager. Pale straw, white head that subsides in time. You know what you’re getting with Becks. Light metallic hoppy notes, metallic bitterness, metallic sameness. There’s nothing wrong with this beer, but the trouble is that there’s nothing right with it either.
Probably unfair rating as bottle was oxidised. Will re rate when I find another one. Aroma and tast pure cardboard. Not botherng wirh more of a description.
Totally decent average lager. Everything is standard, color standard pilsener, smell not bad not good, taste average, palate ok.

Pretty average beer adjunct lager across the board.  24 ounce bomber cost $1.99 -- the same price as the Bud Light and Miller Light bombers sitting across the shelf from it.  This was an import, though, and a hair better than a light beer.  Went well with a spicy Chinese tv dinner from the microwave and a couple pieces of toast while watching a movie.  Nothing special, but nothing really bad either.  Second glass tasted better than the first.  Taste is sort of reminiscent of a standard adjunct lager crossed with a Heinieken -- a little metallic, but smooth and refreshing.  Worthwhile if you like adjunct lagers and want to try something new.

330 ml can.
Pours a light yellow colour with a small white head which collapses quickly. Aroma of grainy malts and hay. Flavour of grainy malts, honey, hay and some grassy hops. Light/medium bodied with a dryish hay finish. Sauna beer. 5-2-5-2-8 2.2



500 ml bottle. Enjoyed at Dubrovnik, Croatia. Grassy aroma with some graininess. Flavour has grassy bitterness too, but the slightly cardboardy malty harshness ruins it. Mild and watery. Meh. Still 2.2.

Pint can into a weizen glass.  pours pale and has lots of head that stays put.  Bubbly.  Aroma is skunky yeast and malty malts.  Fairly bland.  I don’t get how this is a Premium lager or even "hoppy" (probably because I live in Louisville and everything here is super-hoppy).  A refreshing beer, good for drinking while mowing the lawn. Overall, there is nothing special about this beer, considering how much effort was made into importing it from Germany.
Great taste and appearance Nice fail safe beer to enjoy. Will not disappoint i promise.

Flasche und Etikett sind Klassiker. Der Inhalt ist optisch eher Durchschnitt. 
Becks beginnt mit Frische im Antrunk, angenehm bitteren Mittelteil und etwas Hopfenherbe im Ausklang. 
Durchaus beachtlich für ein Massenbier, ein Geschmacksfeuerwerk wird hier aber nicht abgebrannt. 
Auf Grund der geringen Komplexität wirds nach zwei bis drei Flaschen ein bißchen öde.
Very sessionable lager. Nothing to fault but nothing to brag about. Fairly decent quaffer to have at the pub

Becks... underrated?? I’m not sure. I’m not a huge fan of Becks. I have never drank it in an other way than from the bottle and the bottle looks ok. The beer itself has limey notes that makes it fresh. Nice for a hot summer day during a barbeque. Becks is a fresh beer, but certainly not my first choiche
Goes down very smooth.  Smells a little like some great weed, and goes great with it too.  Fancy looking green bottle. The best beer ever made, no question about it.
500ml can, Hungary. Malty and hoppy smell, then floral and grassy hop, yeastly aftertaste. Normal lagerbeer with a lot of Co2.

Bottle. Light golden, short and fully diminishing head.  Light to moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, grassy hoppyness. Body is light to medium, malty and dryish flavor, grassy hoppyness, some cardboard and alcohol. Finish is average, malty and dryish, grassy hoppyness, some alcohol. OK dryish lager, although there is some alcohol in the flavor/finish and notes of cardboad.

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. delicate aroma of floral hops, butter, slightly spicy grain and tarte flambée. flavour is mostly the same, with a quite inoffensive malty profile and a light bitter finish. light to medium-bodied with soft carbonation. not that bad.

Bottle. Pours light golden, very thin white head. Very mild aroma, hay, cereal, fruit. Flavor is a little sweet but not much flavor, pretty watery. High carbonation, light body, oily finish. Not great.
Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur blond pale, mousse honnète pour une pils. Rien d’inoubliable mais pour le coup elle a su étancher ma soif avec brio. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

Bottle. Pours straw coloured, lots of carbonation. Nose is a little bit if biscuity malt, some citrous. Taste is quite dry and bitter for a mainstream lager. Little bit of grass and pine off the hops, then very crisp and dry on tongue.

Aikoinaan ulkomailla maistoin tummaa Beck’siä. Tämä vaalea onkin vielä kokematta. Olut on kullankeltainen ja melko niukkavaahtoinen. Tuoksu on maltainen eli hyvin peruslagermainen. Maultaan olut on hieman katkera. Hieman ruhoista humaloinnin tuntua on tässä oluessa läsnä. Hiilihappoja on reilusti. Hieman tunkkainen olut.

I thought it a mild skunky like aroma. Poured a pale yellow with a small head. Tasted rather corn-straw like.It does start off mildly bitter but finishes dry. Taste similar to "St. Pauli Girl" if you ask me. Not very impressed.

Straw colour with a two finger sized (thick) head.

Grain and some light hops along with a metallic aroma and some corn. The taste is pretty similar to the nose.

Has nice carbonation and a pleasantly crisp finish, if a little dry. Light bodied although not watery like a lot of it’s rivals. Moderately refreshing as well.

A pretty average lager on the whole although it is definitely better when drank from the bottle.

More at:
Can.  Pours gold and clear.  Tastes slightly hoppy and bitter for a lager.  A little citrus.  Not bad.

A hoppy if not overpowering beer, it tends to be rather generic and fails rather miserably at having some distinct taste. However it isn’t terrible and has a pleasant aroma. It leaves a pleasantly bitter after taste and if it’s the only thing you’ve been offered, drink it.
Jolie bière cristaline, couleur or, sous un frêle col blanc.  Des arômes de céréales et de résine.  Légèrement acide et peu amère.  Corps définitivement léger, mince, rafraîchissant.
Für mich das beste Pils, nicht zu bitter und herb, auch gut für Frauen geeignet
I always see this beer, but had never tried it, really nothing special to this one, pretty light easy to drink, similar to bud, very corny flavour and aroma
Golden coloured. Small head. Smell is malts, citrus, light spiced. The taste is light dry grass, citrus spices. A bit hoppy.
Draught at Ceilidh House Hamilton. Pours a ale yellow, white head. Aroma is not much, slight hop. Taste is sweet and again a slight hop and bitter finish.
I have always seen this beer in the grocery store as non-alcoholic, so surprised by the alcoholic beer taste

Bottle.  Pours a light golden with a small white head.  Aroma is sweet malt and spicy, floral hops.  Flavor is surprisingly full and malty, even fruity.  Medium mouthfeel.  Crisp, dry finish.  Classic German lager.
Pours a crystal clear light yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is heavily oxidated, skunky wet newspapers.  Taste is very oxidized, bitter and a slight malt.
Pale yellow color with a white head. Its aroma is that of mild hops, as is its taste. A mild beer with a slightly bitter after taste.
Pale yellow colour with little head. Medium bitterness. A beer among so many others.
Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is light malty and hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Decent pilsener. 041210

500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a clear light golden yellow with white head that quickly recedes to nothing.  Aroma is grainy with some appley sweetness and light grassy hops.  Taste is stale cereal grains, generic sweetness and light grassy hops.  Little in the way of a finish.  Pretty underwhelming.

For a pale you could do worse, but hey I prefer my beer to taste like beer and my water to taste well, like H2O. Why would I need a beer flavoured water? Oh right - so I can get pissed easily. Point taken and beer to be avoided.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a somewhat-deep straw color with a multi-finger white head that leaves behind the tiniest bit of lacing. Smell brings some very light herbal, floral hops and some grain. Taste is slightly bitter and mostly consists of a plain grain and husk flavor. Large amounts of carbonation on a light body. Drinks okay and better than a lot of its "peers," but not one of my favorites.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-13-2010
Aroma of cereal, paper, hay, grass. Taste of faint cereals and malt? Hard to say it tasted like water out of a puddle. Slick mouthfeel, some grassy hops. So bland, but tastes better than Heineken
I have only had it from a minikeg. IT pours a pale gold with a foamy white head. It is a macro pilsener, but still manages to be okay.

Can. Pours a yellow, fizzy lager body with a foamy, short-lived white head. Aroma is cereal, pale malts and hints of dusty hops. Taste is slightly sweet and malty, with some hop bitterness. Ok, but pretty much like most other nondescript lagers out there.

Bottle. generic Euro lager on the slighty more flavorful end of the spectrum. Light, crisp with moderate hops and grass aromas. Definate sweetness that stays around longer then i’d prefer. Does in a pinch but not soemthing i’d go back to.

The beer is a pale yellow that is quite light for what is assumed to be an all malt beer.

The head is pure white and developed two fingers thick in my pilsner glass. Head retention was lacking and no lacing was noted.

The aroma is, to be honest, boring and skunky. There is a grainy smell with a stale hop presence. The dominant smell here is skunk. Damn green bottles...

The taste is smooth and crisp but again the skunky odors are making it up the back of the mouth and influencing the taste. I can barely pick up on the malt and the hop presence is faded and stale. The beer just does not taste fresh.

The body and carbonation are moderate and the mouthfeel is the best part of the beer. It does go down quite easily but without much else to be impressed by.

Very reminiscent of other euro lagers or mass brewed beers of the style. When picking from that lot I wouldn’t judge this choice but there are better beers of the style to choose from at an equivalent price point. Check out your local producers.
Rather light hops, simple German pilsner, easy to find, could be much worse.
Light beer, better than other macros in the price range. Nothing extraordinary in the taste department.

A golden pour with a carbonated white head. Not much to talk about when it comes to aroma and taste. Just your run of the mill lager. I expected a little something more. 

12 oz bottle
bottled  unsure why ive never rated this. anyway its got spme german grassiness so not quite as awful as it could have been

Flaske 33 cl. Gyldengul hælde med en stor hvid krone med medium til lang holdbarhed. Aromaen bære meget præg af humle, men noter af hø viser ig også. Smagen virker bitter hvorefter humle smagen fremtræder. En god tørst slukker til en varm sommerdag.

Pours the clear yellow reminiscent of the urinal and the style.  Minimal head that doesn’t last too long.  Bready nose - no offensive notes (when poured from a can - avoid the green bottles as they tend to be skunky).  Light and somewhat carbonated body true to style.  Ok taste.  Some notes of grain and a light sweetness and a hint of bittering at the end.  Of all the widely available lagers I’ve had I like this the most currently.  But that’s not saying much.

Aroma of hay, minimal floral hops and some other light estery qualities, such as apple and red grapes. Appearance was light gold with frothy white head; head retention was acceptable. Flavor matched the nose, but with a jump in the estery qualities, pushing the hay the the back of the overall flavor. The palate was lightly bubbly and the finish was abrupt. I had really low expectations coming in, but this turned out to be a pretty decent lager.

Feels like a non-alcoholic beer. Seems to be a little bit of malt here, nad maybe corn or some other cereals. Skunky, really. Decent hoppy bouquet, even though cheap hops. Decent white head, bubbly - too strong carbonation. German feeling here, but really just a feeling. I guess I would still choose this one instead of a X-ICE something at my regular convenient store...

From a 330ml bottle on 31/12/2010. Brewed in Australia under licence. Has a very faint aroma of malt and grass. Flavours are sweet malt and a touch of honey. Has a moderate hope finish. A clean pale lager which is quite drinkable, but also forgettable.
A good German macro lager with a nice-beery aftertaste, recommended only  when Lowenbrau is not available...
Regular appearance of clear gold, aroma and taste of hops and yeast with agricultural origins. Typical lager beer of the cheap kind.
Pours a golden color with some lacing.  Aroma of classic hops.  Taste is hoppy and funky.  Ok daily lager.
Don’t like that much this beer. Sub par euro beer in my standard. Goldent color. Skunky taste. Not much in my taste palate.
Everyday lager. Fresh but watery taste. Not much aroma but the one thing that is noticeable is fresh hops. (Can 50cl)
Bottle pours gold with a white head.  Another one of those fantastic green bottle beers where you never know what you’re gonna get.

Aussie licensed version. 5.0%. Not a bad lager. Crisp and clean, with some nice hoppy bitterness. quite carbonted, but the head that quickly disappears after pouring. Chuggable, if you want a pilsner. Nothing bad here, but nothing special either. Good to have alongside a BBQ for an beer that’s quick to acquire and quick to forget.
Small bottle 5,0%. Pale yellow, OK head. Aroma is grainy and a little hoppy. Taste has some hops too but in general feels too watery. Below average.

Clear straw with a bubbly white head resembling, quite literally, the effect one gets when blowing air into their straw to make their beverage burble and gurgle. We all were kids once; we’ve all done it. No lace and his head disappears just in time for me to suffer through his nose. Hard and very mineralistic. Take rock, water, and rinse. Mmm. Tasty. Lime rind, dry husked grains, and crusty bread rounds out his nefarious plot of suffering just in time for my first of thankfully just a few quaffs. Bless those kitchen sink drains for they sure put up with a lot of abuse, in my apartment that is. Crunchy crusty husked bread crusts suck the moisture out of my mouth while key lime bitterness flitters and fails. Another quaff and hard salty minerally water sucks the moisture out of my mouth. Blech. I’d rather suck on some ocean water than this turbulent mess of a brew. Judging by the back label, she still has a few months of life left in her. Hope she enjoys spending them in the sewage system of Vero Beach because that’s exactly where she is going, going, and gone.
Not my favorite. Something I would not drink regularly. Just had to try it.

Lucent gold, thin white head, medium body, high carbonation.



Aroma: noble hops, pilsner malt, clean.



Taste: noble hops and pale malt, with some earthy bitterness and adjuncty film in the finish.



Better than expected, but I was careful to select the least light-subjected bottle in the store.
Pretty good ...has a bitter taste to it...not frothy...pretty cheap...goes down smooth...

[300ml bottle, Peckhams (Brutnsfield), Edinburgh] Distinctive skunked Becks aroma, you’d recognise it from across the room blindfolded. Bitter for a pilsner, quite crisp on the finish. The taste is adequate but there’s always been something about the smell that put me off. Just don’t let it get warm, as it tastes like drain cleaner [02122007]
From a bottle poured a golden color with a small amount of head.  light grassy malty flavor with a lingering finish.

Huh, there must be something attributed to "skunky" - what is it?  Cereal grains would be my guess, but who knows.  Predominant is the skunkiness in the aroma and the taste.  It’s refreshing if there’s nothing else better around I guess.
It’s not really as Premium as you might like to believe. Just another in the line of advertised Lagers in green bottles (like Heineken, Grolsch, Rolling Rock, etc.)

12 oz. bottle.  Pours out a clear  yellow color with a large frothy  white head.  The nose is pale malts and slightly floral hops.  I guess its not that bad considering it’s a big macro brewed lager.  Some pale malt  flavor. Hops are barely noticeable on finish. Drinkable if there is nothing else around.
Ok. Nothing special here but okay drinkable and relatively refreshing Euro lager
Golden Pale color, Medium head, Mild bitter aroma, Smells like Hallertau hops but not positive if this is the hop used. Definitely a decent German lager.

Bottle 33cl. A clear yellow beer with medium head. Smell is hopy and a bit caramel like. Aroma is medium to low malty, very hopy on the spice side, quite dry. Long bitter aftertaste, correct lager very drinkable, nuts notes at the finish.
Piss colored without much carbonation or head... Strong skunky smell typical of german lagers, a little plain in this case but still nice... Same thing for the taste

Why did I put myself through this?  Is ticking really that meaningful a pursuit, that I should waste a dollar that could have gone to orphans or animals or cancer patients or anything else more useful?  Alas, I have sunk this time and cost and I am left searching for answers.
pours pale straw yellow, nose is grainy and light, taste is watery and bland.

Bottle. Gold with a white head. Caramel and weak hops and weak malt. Bitter. Watery, some oiliness on the palate, with lots of crispness and a dry finish. 4 2 4 3 9  #### Bottle. Hops, lager malt, some spice, some fruit. Bitter. Dry finish. 4 3 5 2 10

(Draught at Berlin Tegel Airport, 25 July 2010) Golden yellow colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of hay, grain and slight hints of grass. Malty taste with hay, grain, hints of tropical fruit and a slightly grassy bitterness in the finish. Hints of boiled vegetables and sourish malt come through after a while. Rather thin body, with some sweetness. Overall a quite boring macro lager.
Last time I had this was on a fishing trip.  It did its job.  But I haven’t had it since.
Pale yellow and short term white head. Grass and hops in the aroma. Bitter at the beginnig, then some slight sweetness. Light body, short term after taste.

Bottle.  Pours golden with a small, short lived, white head.  Aroma of hay, grassy hops and bready malt.  Bready malt, grain and floral hops balanced nicely in the mouth.  Light crisp body.  Average, earthy finish.  It’s been a long time since I drank this beer and I didn’t expect much.  However, this Helles is better than most I tried.

I purchased a "super size" 24 OZ  / $2.30 - After tasting Beck’s, I consider it a more enjoyable version than Heineken; both beers have a pretty funky aroma, but Beck’s is more palatable.  So yeah, I’m pretty serious about the 2.6 and I stand behind it.  Usually I would not bother with a massed produced rating, but its Beck’s.  Who knows when I might get back to it.
Initial skunk with a nice grain/grass finish. Very drinkable with good taste.
Pours a straw yellow with a dissapating white head...aroma is skunk, slightly bready and metallic....Grassy, slightly sweet, metallic after taste.  Probably not my first choice for this style.

In 500ml cans. Terrible beer, has very little taste, this lager has been filtered over many times and leaves an unpleasant aftertaste in the mouth. Becks have produced a very dull beer and I will avoid this one in future.
bottle. Clear golden yellow, mid-sized white head. Rather pleasant green hoppy nose. Shy malty base with some grassy-green hops and a touch of vegetables.

Poured from 24 oz bottle.  It’s 11 AM and this was already opened, so I figured "what the hell" and decided to imbibe.  Aroma is like a traditional lager, smells like corn and hay.  Appearance is clear yellow with a frothy head.  Taste is a bit more hoppier than a traditional mass produced lager, has a nice malty backing.  If I have to drink lager, I wouldn’t mind drinking this.

275ml bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with no head.  Some very faint citrus hops.  Some floral hops on the tongue and a crisp, slightly bitter finish.  A bit watery.  Not the worst lager you can get in the UK.

500ml bottle. Waiting outside the apartment building for my lost luggage to arrive from the airport, we discovered the most peculiar mangy and dark little bar in the basement. It was like cut out from a Dostoevsky novel (It was what I’ve imagined the place in "Notes from the Underground" would be like). As their refrigerators were broken, the only cold beer they had was Becks. The bottle was green and misty, the beer was cold and refreshing with a flavour of hops and grass. A decent beer. I do not ask for more when spending time sitting on a curbstone under the baking sun. Thanks to Stefan for waiting and finishing the beer with me, but most of all for taking part in my adventures June 15th 2010.

Bottle at Frazer’s in St. Louis.  Green bottle Euro lager that I haven’t gotten around to rating yet.  Pretty much like every other in its class- grains, corn, grass, light hops, and a bit of lemon citrus.  Not as skunked as expected, and for that I am thankful.  Light boded, with high carbonation and a grassy mouthfeel.  Meh.

Beck’s isn’t awesome but it sets out to be what it intends.  The dry, crisp, bit of hops at the end German Pils. There are better examples but for pale lagers you could do so much worse. Serving: Bottle
Pours pale gold with a wisp of white and little lacing.  Hop aroma typical of beers of this kind.  Tastes the same, too.
I do like the smell of skunk, so that alone boosts the rating up slightly.  Nothing special - after skunked, tastes the same as Heine and Grolsch.

aroma grassy and beningnly malty..pale golden color not much head after it dissipates..taste is a bit malty and tingly but mostly bland sweetness kind of like seltzer..leaves a weird aftertaste but goes down easy otherwise i guess..overall not awful like some but also not much to recommend

Beck & Company Brauerei--Beck’s Lager--4.8% ABV.  20 IBU’s?

1999--24 oz. Bottle.  (3.0 / 5.0)  Clear thin straw golden color.  Light hoppy Saaz front with German Pilsner note.  German accent to smooth light malt body with good flavor.  Crisp easy light hop finish.   Drinkable and refreshing.  Sampled 1/10/2000.

2000 12 oz. Green Bottle.  (3.25 / 5.0)  Very clear very light straw golden color.  Light Saaz hop floral front.  Very little head.  Bavarian flavored malt body is light but crisp clean smooth and refreshing.  Mild hop spice at end.  Thin.  Sampled 5/9/2001.

Beck’s Bier-Beer--2007 24 oz. Green Bottle.  (3.5 / 5.0)  Pale Lager.  Stank hint.  Foamy thin white mild lace head.  Clear bright yellow gold color.  Light hop front.  Mild creamy butter hint easy refreshing smooth malt adjunct body.  Clean mild hop stank end.  OK Macro.  Sampled 3/5/2007.

if this was dirt cheap, i could appreciate it for what it is, standard but slightly above the other mass produced ’premiums’. unfortunately, many places in australia seem to think this is the be-all-and-end-all beer, so charge you way over the top

I have no illusions about this beer, and it’s just what I want it to be: a balanced and refreshing German lager AND often on sale. How can I not love a nice clean beer with no real faults (for its style) that’s $10.99/12? Only trouble is it goes down too easily.

275ml bottle. Poured a clear, pale yellow with a small & disappearing white head. Notes of lemon with a faint hop aroma. Crisp, light fruity hops, some grain and a short but noticeable bitterness. Light body and medium to full carbonation. In all, a refreshing but relatively bland thirst quenching lager.

Straw golden pour fluffy white head .... floral "skunky" hop aroma as well as bready sweet malts .... light taste not overpowering: bready and sweet malts and a dry floral hop finish that lingers a little ..... easy drinking macro
I appreciate the skunky smell of Becks, I’f I’m going to some sleazy bar somewhere, I will order this in the bottle. It’s cheap and decent, but I wouldn’t say much more than that.

Have had this beer several time over the years.  This is the first time it wasn’t "skunky".  Still a pale, clear golden lager.  Just not much to write home about.  Had a 4-pack of it in a Carnival ship as I deemed it the best offered out of a can.  Had in plastic cup and saved one for a glass a night - with only slightly better results.  I’ll pass next time.  Not a good representation of a German beer of any kind.

A light, uber-airy fizzy, frothy white head atop a clear, semi-cloudy light pale yellow color.  Strong, sweet lager aroma.  Bitter, but light lager flavor.  Cool, refreshing mouth feel without a stale, metallic bitterness.  Thin-bodied.  The offensive bitter metallic taste subsides after a while, making it easier to drink and making you believe this is actually unoffensive to the palate and making it incredibly easy to drink.  Nice.
Che dire. Per me è discreta perchè è tra le più amare del suo stile e preferisco di gran lunga le birre amare e luppolate  a quelle dolci e maltate. M rimane comunque ordinaria e poco complessa.
I see little reason to distinguish this from most other macro lagers. Watery, grainy and bland. Slightly sweet and unpleasant finish. Nothing to see here.
Va bene un pò di amaro, ma quando è troppo è troppo. Sembra di bere succo di ferro.
Pale golden, white rocky head that diminishes fast, no lacing. Watery, no maltiness

I’ve had this beer so many times over so many years, I can’t believe I haven’t rated it until now!
Pours a nice golden yellow, with a nice foamy head. The head lasts failrly long, and eventually settles as billowy, fluffy clouds. A pretty beer, with nice carbonation.
Good floral hop nose, with a nice touch of baked bread. Flavor pretty much like the nose, but with a good, grassy hop flavor up front. Mildly complex. 
It may have fallen out of fashion with the beer afficianado crowd, but it’s still one of Germany’s most consistent offerings to beer lovers around the world!

Bottle. Straw golden with tight white head. Aroma is earthy with straw, butterscotch and grass, Flavors of straw, grain, and butterscotch. Slightly metallic. Thin body with slick mouthfeel and bright carbonation.
It’s just a Becks. Pours clearish yellow. Nose and taste is slightly peppery pilsner. Rated 1/3/2000
Typical "produced in masses" pilsner without any touch of quality. No noticable aroma, slightly bitter flavor, weak on palate and lacks a finisjh. What else could a beer miss.

Pours yellow with a small white head. Aroma of sweet pils malt, skunk, and faint grass. The flavor is mostly sweet, with a touch of hops on the finish. Not bad for a carp maco, but wouldn’t willingly purchase.
Bottle. Yelow golden colour with a light white head that disappears quickly. Standard mass market brew
Mid carbonation with a head that quckly dissapates, aroma is a bit like an ash tray, but has a nice dry crisp taste
33 cl bottle. Definetely a bad beer, I didn’t like it. One of the worst beers ever tried.

Acid, Grassy, Fizzy and pale lager with a mild fruity complex of sensations on the palate I have to say though this is horrid and leaves a very nasty feeling on the tounge and a bad hangover the next day this is definitley one to avoid in the future and you wont miss it much as it has little taste

SKUNKED aroma and flavor.  UGH!  Beautiful clear light gold with brilliant white dense head.  Fizzy, watery mouthfeel.  FOR THE LAST TIME: GREEN BOTTLES ARE PRETTY, BUT THEY DO NOT PROTECT YOUR BEER FROM ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT!   When I was young, I thought Grolsch / Heineken / Beck’s were supposed to taste this way.  I never liked them.  Now I know why:  They were skunked.  I also realize that there is probably an entire generation of North American men who have never tasted an un-skunked "German" Pilsener / Pale Lager.   Their sole experience with this style of beer was an unfortunate episode involving a soured Lowenbrau in 1988.  PLEASE:  NO MORE GREEN BOTTLES FOR US YANKS AND CANUCKS!  YOU ARE LOSING OUT ON A HUGE MARKET BECAUSE YOUR PRODUCT IS DAMAGED BY THE TIME WE GET IT.  Sorry for the rant, everyone...
bread, toast, golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, creamy, lively, nice germany beer.
Crisp beer with a nice texture. Worth drinking for a session though it can be expensive. No hangover so good beer.
Can - Thanks Mads. Clear golden - white head. Bread, white bread, egg, light hoppy, sour hoppy, sparkling, can, aluminium, candlewax. Plain.
Can 0,5l. Yellow color with white head. A hoppy aroma. Light sweet taste, very light body. Very simple beer, drinkable when you are thirsty, nothing more.

Very subtle aromas of fruit on the nose, pleasant however. Appearance is pure urine sample, equally as flat. That said, the taste is not so bad. Crisp, refreshing and not too sweet. There are only the tiniest hints of hops and fruit on the palate. Premium...no. Drinkable...yes, why not.

Bottle from the LBS. Thin is the key word here and very watery in taste. Some decent bitterness but not very well balanced. I also got some vegetable soup in the smell and taste which means this was probably on it’s way to going bad.

On tap from De Bier Haus Tauranga. Pale golden hue, white diminishing head.  Served ice cold with what I would call macro lager aromas and my wife would say "it smells like beer", a bit grassy a bit of cabbage. Some mild malty sweetness,  a bit of grassy citrus hop bitterness.  Well carbonated thin texture light to medium light body.  Noticeably better than the Oranjeboom I had prior to this but just OK.  In the wet and cold category.
Can at home. Clear deep golden pour, thin foamy white head. Aroma of hops with some smooth malty base. Flavor is watery, mildly bitter and with a nice hoppy finish. Quite good for a pilsener.

Bottled, clear light gold with bright white head, aroma of grassy hops with slight papermill smell and no hints of malt or yeast character, taste watery with faint grassy hop finish, highly carbonated with no residual flavors
12ounce bottle at pirates spring training. Ice cold, foamy white head. Golden clear in color good hoppy bouquet.

Not a big brew. Pale smooth body, frothy head. Some corn-like feelings in the aroma and flavour. This is a can, last time i tasted the bottled one, and i remembered a better one. But it is misleading. i’m disappointed. Mass.

500ml can.  Pours a clear, pale yellow.  Good sized white head.  Aromas of metallic hops, faint green veggies, sweet malt.  The taste is heavy on the metallic hops that seem to define so many mass produced Euro beers.  Sweet malt.  Pretty average, but I would choose this over any mass produced North American lager any day.
light body, lively, light sweetness, pale, golden, clear, minimal head, Delicious!

24 oz bottle into lager glass. Aromas of skunk (green bottle--what do you expect?), wet hay, Sweet Tarts, adjunct grain. Pours piss yellow with a medium dissipating head and decent lacing. Better taste than your average American macro; more depth. Still not very good. Starts out with a very neutral taste and finishes with just a slight bitterness. A faint sour taste is left on the tongue after the beer goes down the gullet. Also grain in the aftertaste. Highly carbonated. Tastes very similar to all the other mass produced European lagers. As such, it has no character.

Name: Beck’s

Date: January 03, 2010

Mode: Bottle

Source: Tasting, Cellar Ticker

Appearance: clear gold, wispy white head, streaks of lace

Aroma: skunk aroma with a hint of floral hops

Flavor: pale malt flavor, floral hops, light balancing bitterness, long bitter finish

Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 5/20

Rating: 1.7/5.0
Drinkability: 4/10

Score: * /4

Hey you there!  Yes you, d-bag drinking a Heineken.  Do you want something that tastes exactly like your beer, costs 50 cents less and has a cool aluminum foily thing on the neck for you to play with?  Well then this is your beer!
Good German beer. I love it as a party starter or as a refreshment in summer.
Clear pale yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is mainly of skunked malts.  Taste is of malts, hops, and some skunked flavor.  Has a malt finish.  Blah.

Golden pour, medium foamy head.
Aroma of malts and faint hops, slightly fruity.
Somewhat bitter flavour, but nothing special.

bottle: arouma is skunk, grass and cheese. Some pleasant caramel malts, skunky hops, corny and grass. Smooth going down. This bottle was free, so I figured I would tick it. Seriously starting to reconsider this policy.
bottle from thirdeye11.  pale yellow with a white head.  skunky hops and grass.  watery on the palate with light hops and grass for flavors.
( 12oz bottle bb 10/2010) Pours very pale yellow with lingering bubbles. Nose of apple, butter, and earthy hops. Taste of earth, butter, with a watery but slightly oily finish.
Golden colored brew. Aroma is grainy, grassy. Glavor is a bit sweet, citric and way too much carbonation. Standard crappy beer.

In bottle; OK, not the best beer in the world though this is my standard fall back if their isn’t anything else on the menu I want. Standard macro brew; would take over Heineken or Stella (in bottle) any day
This is one of the best beers in the world. I like the bottle a lot while it looks so fresh. This beer fits to every moment.

Ok voglio farmi male, ma il bar sotto casa ha una scelta mediocre e spesso finisco con lo scegliere questa. Che dire color oro chiaro che più standard non si può, schiuma chiara, non particolarmente ampia, effervescente. al naso un pò luppolata, un pò erbacea. al palato è piuttosto amara, secca, si trova di peggio in circolazione.
12 oz Bottle. Pours a light golden yellow., with a suprisingly generous head that dissapaited quickly. Very slight hop aroma, maybe a hint of malt. Carbonation a bit much. Slightly bitter finish.

Appearance: Pours out a crystalline, yellow body with a well-sized, frothy, white head.

Smell: Nose of very pale malts with some thin, faint notes of spice and florals.

Taste: It’s your basic, run-of-the-mill pale maltiness and accompanying sweetness. Slightly spicy hop presence with just a kiss of bitterness. Grows a tad grainy as it warms a bit. Drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Yes sir, Australian for... wait, that’s one of the others. Another forgettable member of a seemingly endless parade of lagers.

Pours a clear yellow color. Small head. Aroma of grass corn with a hint of sweet. Taste is light malt light sweet. Decent hop finish. Light brew, but crisp. One of the better macro beers you will find.

12oz bottle.  Pours a very pale clear yellow golden with a thin fizzy white head.  Aroma is sweet and grassy, biscuity, a bit oxidized, green bottle stink,  cheesed nobles.  Flavor is the same, dried out nicely, probably actually better old and oxidized, lightly fruity, cracker, grassy, fairly clean.  Light bodied, spritsy carbonation.

12 ounce bottle from Whole Foods Market, Charlottesville, VA. Pours a very pale yellow color with a medium frothy head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of mildly skunk with weird almost meaty and slightly funky notes. Acrid malts aplenty. I wish it were just skunked but this is just bad. Taste is not quite as offensive... sweaty malt notes, corn, some huskiness, grassy hops. Thin bodied. Wow, what a bad beer.
16.01.2010, 0,33l Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a large white head. Aroma is malt and bitterhops.
Can’t stand this beer. Skunk describes it well, but this is so tasteless and boring I would avoid it wherever I go. Nasty beer.

Pours yellow with a small head.
Nose shows some aromatic floral and grassy Euopean hops with grainy malt in the background.
Flavours are too sweet with lots of cooked vegetables.
Quite watery.
Bottle. Pours out light golden coloured with a dense head. Aroma is hoppy, taste is also hoppy, with fine bubbles which gives a good mouthfeeling. Hoppy and bit dry finish. Not bad for a pilsner.

Not that bad for an InBev Macro.  Bottle to lager glass.  Pours golden with short lived and thin white head.  Very nice skunk and vanilla.  I get coffee too.
Light sweet with a touch of bitter in the finish.  A little thin in the mouth, but does have a certain crispness.  The six pack won’t sit in the ’fridge all winter.
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is skunk, honey, vanilla, and peppery hops.  Flavor is honey, skunk, with a nice peppery hop finish.

A pretentious macro lager which I don’t even find refreshing. Skunky with a small bit of hops and not much else. I’m not even sure if there are any food pairings I’d have this with - I just can’t see myself ever getting this again.

While this is a macro brand all the way I have always had a soft spot for Becks. It delivers exactly what I want from it every time I drink it. A hoppy German lager with good "stickiness" and funky burnt aftertaste.
33cl bottle, clear gold color, medium white head, lively carbonation, cereals aroma, grass notes, light bitter flavor, watery body, blank finish, balanced and drinkable if cold but nothing special

0.5 l bottle.
Pale golden colour, medium head, average carbonation.
Smell of hops, the taste is sweetbitter and light-sharp, body’s a little bit watery/medium.
Sweetish flavour of malt and light hops.
Finish is light bitter.
Easy drinkable Lager.

Ugly yellow pour with a quickly fading white head. Hmm. Looks better in the green bottle. Aroma of floral hops, honey sweetness, bread, skunk. Flavor is very similar. Mildly bitter. Medium bodied, pretty soft, mild carbonation. Very easy drinking. I don’t think this is nearly as bad as most seem to think it is, but it isn’t good.
skunky aroma to the beer, thin nose, minimal head, and light body. pale golden beer, clear. medium bitterness, light sweetness in the aftertaste

Oh what was I thinking. There was a time I thought this was good.....that time has passed. This stuff is not good, if you doing yard work in the south, have no beer in stock and someone GIVES you one of these for free....ok drink......
from tap in a bar in Trapani. Served in a limonade glass? Almost no head and yellow colour. Smell: skunk. Taste: very watery, strange bitterness. No good pils!
Tap, glass of 20 cl. Lemonade yellow to golden colour with little white foam disappearing soon. Aroma is grainy, taste is water with dirty grainy taste. Or to summarize in one word: BWEURK!
