Pours clear gold with a white head.  Nose is light malt, rice, lager, bread, and some yeast.  Flavor is similar with bitterness and astringency.  There is a hop or two thrown in, but mostly unremarkable.

Pretty standard macro Euro lager-pilsener.  Nothing too exciting.  OK.  There are better choices out there in this category, but this goes down easily enough and will do in a pinch.  Light malty sweetness and a dash of Mitteleuropean hops.  I am actually scoring this lower than a number of American macros.  Not that it is actually worse, but perhaps one of the things that bothers me about the Euro macros is that they are supposed to be high quality beers and often sell at substantial prices in the USA, yet they are not really high end brews.

Pours a classic golden yellow with a thick white head that doesn’t stick around long. Not bad lacing. Hoppy metallic aroma that pretty much matches the taste. Not bad, but recommend a St. Pauli’s instead.
Draft. Pours yellow with a big white head. Aroma is light malt and hops. Flavor is much the same typical European macro lager.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
Appearance: Yellow color with a frothy white head.  Poor head retention.
Aroma: Skunky euro lager notes with an off bitterness.  No thanks.
Flavor: Surprise, it tastes just like it smells!  
Palate: Medium carbonation with a light mouthfeel and a medium, bitter finish.
Overall: Don’t do this to yourself.  Not recommended.

Draught, Firenze, Italy.
One of the better known and common ’standard Euro lagers’ I guess.
Once again clean, quite crisp, hint of floral hop character in there, and a bready finish. Reasonably well made, but certainly nothing to get excited about.
A very typical lager, not much happening here a little bready malt taste.  With a very German smooth finish.
On tap at the Becks am Scnoor pub, Schnoor, Bremen 25-10-09    Pours gold its an easy drinking lager that’s crisp, refreshing and bitter  A5 A4 F5 P3 Ov10  2.7
Gents and ladies, you are totaly crazy - this is a really internationell crap beer, weak in flavour, like water!
I was recommended this beer by a frriend. Not the worst but very dry and bitter. No aroma. light yellow/gold color. also leaves to much of a not so pleasant after taste

Pours a weak yellow color.  Flavor is not particularly good but tolerable.  The only reason I even purchased it tonight was I walked past a display and couldn’t think of anything but "He stole it und now instead of Deutschland’s greatest beer we merely have fourth best behind Steinemarzen, Rottenburger, und... und...
Und Beck’s?
Ja und Beck’s"

A german classic.  Goodn like 200 hundred years ago.  Pours piss yellow and a tangy taste with a BAD bitter flavor but not dry.  Only had in bottle.  A friend said that if tasted on draught its  a blast.  Font believe have a drink but beware.  Just kiddin ../,./..,/l.,/l,.;/
500mL can, poured yellow into a pint mug. Medium-bodied, copper-flavoured, lots of skunk cabbage, dry finish. Hardly drinkable.
Bottle. Amber beer with a whitish head. Sweet aroma with a bit of grain. Sweet flavor with some mineral and hay. Medium bodied. Grainy sweetness lingers with a bit of butteriness.
33cl can. Pours yellow clear color, white head. Hard to find any aroma, dry finish. Refreshing.

Looks pleasant enough but smells like dirty copper tubing. Tastes stale and the bottles are no good for homebrew. Not much to like about this beer and I doubt any beer-loving Germans actually drink it.

colour is hay with an actually large white head that lasts, smells like wet grass, kind of metallic, taste is hoppy, toasted grains, bread, sort of a light sweet finish, moderate bodied, filling and with a very pleasant just barely noticeable alcohol feel. havent had becks in a long time but i remembered liking it, its really good!

While Becks tends to get over-exposed as the preeminent German lager, we must be careful not to discount it for simply succeeding in what it does.

It has a pleasant, hoppy aroma that provides the perfect foreword to the brew.  Lots of carbonation is evident, and the color is as pleasing to the eye as the aroma is to the nose.  There is something also to be said of its unique but pleasing packaging and distinct bottling.

The beer itself dabbles in complexity, but never really leaves the familiar.  There is a crispness to the beverage that is a nice touch, and the hoppyness of the beer itself is never forgotten.  

Not as easily swallowed as other lagers, it gives plenty to explore for its duration in your mouth.  The alcohol is not a strong flavor, and only when the bottle is nearly finished do you taste anything apart from the fine, complex lager taste that your first sip provides.

Becks deserves its esteem and standing among others of its kind.  Perhaps not the best, but formidable enough to earn the title it has.

500mL Can.  Clear yellow pour with a moderate white foam, mild retention. Aroma is inoffensive, sweet malts, barley. Taste is fairly bland, weak malty taste, corn, very mild hops. Finish is dry, but crisp. Refreshing, but boring.
I enjoy this German beer. Pours a golden color with a little white head. A little lacing on the glass. Not much aroma. Flavor of malts and grains that goes down easy. Enjoyable!"
(bottle). Clear, light golden color. Small white head. Grainy/skunky aroma and flavor. Short duration. Light dry finish. Thin/slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.
330ml Can - Pours a very pale yellow with a small white head.  Some malt aroma.  Not a great deal of flavour, crisp dry finish.  An easy beer to drink and usually at a reasonable price.
I love the hop flavor of becks, it has a real german sort of kick to it so it’s not for the chugger. One of my favorite imports!, love the dark color also.
Above average light brew. nothing special here.  I would not go out of my way to have this again.

12-oz. Fancy foil and other accouterments won’t change the fact that this was shipped in a pale green bottle. Meh. Pours a crystal clear pale gold with loose scungy film of gray smearing the top. Smells like a horny Pepe le Pew rubbing his tail in your face on a hot day. Blecch. Fizzy, watery body. Skunk and corn nuts on the mid-palate. Power of marketing at work here.

A pleasant aroma, light malt with no nasty wierd bits. Farily clear yellowish, but mostly clear. Poor head retention. A light flavour, crisp malt and hops but not really enough of the flavour, it really peaks at the beginning and end, but really lulls in the middle. The palate is surprisingly nice, feels good on the tounge and is smooth all the way, leave a clean taste.
Much like Heineken, I don’t know whether it’s the green bottle or if it’s just an awful beer.
This beer is a standard European beer. Not a bad brew, but not outstanding in any way. It is a drinkable beer but not worth hunting down.
Standard euro lager, not offensive, mild bitterness and a hint of dry hops, clean finish without much aftertaste.

Pretty standard, really.  Your usual pale lager pour - it’s crisp, and has a nice dry finish, but there’s not as much flavor in the middle.  Not the worst of the macro beers, but it’s not that good either.

It was the imported beer, thar I drank. The truth is, that it was nothing special. Recently I again tasted Becks. And again it dissapointed me.Weak color. Light, watery and fizzy. Had a pleasantly dry finish, though. Standart lager , call it pilsener . Not to complex , easy to drink , simple brew . Low on taste , some biterness in aftertaste .This beer is overrated.

330ml can. A classic party beer. Yellow color with white head. Its taste is really nothing special. Easygoing though but not the best choice when you need to drink beer. Not that bad but there are a lot better.

Pours a golden yellow with a light head that quickly disappears. It has a mild aroma of malt, and its taste is of slightly sweet but fairly bland malt. The hops weren’t very dominating in this beer. Overall, not a bad beer, but pretty bland and mediocre at the same time.
Had this in the U.S. and Germany and it is much much better in Germany.  It has that generic beer taste you find in big brewers like Coors Light but is slightly better.
Argh.  That’s right, argh.  Pirates must drink this beer.  Green glass = skunk without fail.  Pours an orangey straw, stinks of skunk... tastes like it too.  Thanks again InBev!
I’ve never had this in any form except from the bottle, which is disgusting skunky crap that I hate.

1 pint can
Standard sweet smelling, bitter tasting lager. Very sweet aroma with the slightest hint of hops. Very carbonated and "poppy" on the tongue. 
Not the best, but better than a gorramn Budweiser for sure
A dead-average beer this, but still drinkable.  Nice aroma and taste was okay, but overall nothing to rave about.  I’d take a Heineken over this one anytime.

Tap, old rating. Typical lager, though a touch better than the American macro counterparts, as it does actually have a touch of bitter in the aroma, the visual is standard clear pale yellow with fizzy bubbles.

500 ml can from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. 



App.:  Clear golden with a fair white meringue.
  
Aroma:  Light peppery, grassy hops and light fruity malts, a touch of skunk, some cereal and mineral.
  
Palate:  Medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Lightly fruity, cardboard, some light hops; dry with a little bitterness.



Quite drinkable and quite unremarkable.
Pours yellow with fizzy head. Nose is grainy with some sweet malt. Flavor is bread, grain, some noble hops. Crisp clean beer.

Light slight hop/citrus aroma. Pour is golden amber with lmited white head.
Flavour is a slight sweet malt that finishes with a nice long bitterness. Mouthfeel is spot on and is quite clean and crisp.
One of the better macro’s by a long way.
Bottle. Yellow coloured brew. Crisp and dry lager. Some hops detectable. A bit grainy.
Pours clear golden yellow. Very slight hoppy aroma, fresh and subtleVery crisp clean and dry. Hoppy, with a slight malty sweetness. Very nice beer.
Generic lager, sadly now produced by InBec. Many good memories of drinking with my roommate, but hardly worth the rating.
Bottle. Clear yellow body with small white head. Flavour is malt and watery.
Bottle. Weak malt aroma. Clear yellow colour with small white head. Ordinary lager flavour.

An average German skunky lager. Light in color, too much carbonation and familiar taste. Not a beer I enjoy but many do. I guess if it was free I would drink it again but I don’t ever plan on buying one. For what it costs you could go and drink yourself a nice stout or one of a million better Lagers.

Licence beer from Zagrebačka pivovarna Croatia, Vodice degustacion, 
No aroma, pale colour, white foam, sladovější  chuť jemná hořkost, sladčí konec slušné doznívání, better than zagreb brewery primary product Ožujsko

Bottle. Pours a pale gold color with a thin bodied white head. Aroma of malts, skunk, and grain. Flavor was a little bland... skunky corn would be as good of a description as any. Not horrible, but I won’t be rushing out to buy a sixer either.
Very light color, average head, hoppy nose. Aroma is lightly bitter. Better than average bitterness.
Pours a gold pale color with a typical German lager corn aroma.  Flavor has a mild corn taste with a bit of bitterness.  A decent lager beer, just not my style.
On tap. I hope that the drum was finishing or something like this because this beer was awful. No aroma, no body and very low carbonation and flavor. Shocking.
Bready hay aroma slightly spicy hop aroma evident, this beer has an overwhelming green bean taste to it which i dont really enjoy. Nice dry finish

Pours clear gold, short lived head.  Smell is sweet and a bit yeasty.  taste is similar with a bit more sweetness than I want in a lager, and more doughiness as well.  Some bitterness in the finish mingling with the doughiness.  Drinkable, but not one of my preferred lagers.

Can LCBO - pours very pale gold-blonde with ludicrously big noisy and persistent snow-white ice cream head. Aromas of spiky noble hop hint citrus, sweet. Taste pretty balanced straightforward sweet grapey malt & some honey and the light lemon feel. Overall feel is pleasant and not too parching, finish is simple with some lemony hops and light sweetness. Will certainly do on a canoeing trip.

Bottle. A clear pale golden color body with a small fizzy white head , medium to high carbonation. Aroma of floral  hops and faint skunk pee. Flavor is lightly sweet with the typical Euro lager hop notes, very boaring and not very good, light body , crisp mouthfeel . Drinkable but nothing I would buy again.

IVE HEARD THIS BEER COMPARES TO HEINEKEN IM NOT SURE IF IT DOES OR NOT I HAVENT DRANK HEINEKEN IN A LONG TIME, HOWEVER IF IT DOES HEINEKEN MUST BE HORRIBLE. THIS BEER POURS PISS YELLOW WITH A GENEROUS BUBBLY HEAD IT SMELLS LIKE A TRADITIONAL AMERICAN LAGER AND TASTES LIKE OVER CARBONATED WATER DRINKS EASY BUT LACKS ANY QUALITY FLAVOR.

My favorite of all the "Grocery Store Beers". It’s widely distributed to the point that gas stations and grocery stores generally tend to carry it. It doesn’t have the most sophisticated taste, but it is distinct. The slight skunk it carries reminds me of cannabis and induces pleasant emotions. It is very easy to drink and has a calming effect. I know this is distributed by a monster like InBev, but fuck it, The Replacements were distributed by a monster like Warner Bros, and they kicked ass. Same goes for Becks.

Bottled, BB Feb 2010.  Poured clear, apple juicey golden with almost no head sticking around.  The aroma picked up dank, almost skunk-like character first, with honey, pale malts, and floral hoppage behind.. actually came together decently.  The flavor had the same honey and pale malts at the core with light grassy and floral bitterness around.. the faint skunk was there as well, not really offending, but not doing anything beneficial.. finished quick.  Light-bodied with moderate-plus carbonation on the palate.. clean and crisp for the most part, but there were some tacky malts on the back third.  Not bad.

Canned.
Golden with white head. Aroma of light malt with some hay. Flavor is weak of malt

light gold color with a bad white head.

Bitter taste with a tad of skunk, nothing good here.

330 ml can. From Tallinn, Estonia.
Clear golden colour with small white head.
Grassy aroma with some corn and hint of citrus. Sweet malt, corn and slightly bitter hops in flavour. OK Lager.
Bottle, 275ml. A pale straw colour with a large frothy head. A grassy straw aroma. A fairly malty brew with some grass, hops, rice and a fair bit of sweetness. Over carbonated. Not too bad, actually.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a medium frothy white head that diminishes quickly. Wheat grass and a bit of skunk on the nose.  Thin mouthfeel with a bitter corn malt and sweet finish. Not much going on with this one.

Pours gold, with a quick diminishing white head.  Aroma of strong corn; corn husks, touch of citrus and hops.  Flavor is ok...sweet malt, low hops.  Drinkable but not great.  This bottle I’m drinking is a few months past the due date so I’d like to rate a fresh one some time to get a true rating.  Wasn’t impressed by this at all.

24oz bottle.  Pours a pale straw color with a big white head and good effervescence.  Aroma is light, with grains and yeast alongside a small amount of slightly skunky hops.  Taste is light and mild, with a body dominated by malt and grain ending with an oh-so-slight bit of hoppiness.  Less skunky than some of its kin, though lacking in any "flavor" or "character" as well.

Nothing exciting about this beer at all at least the odd few lagers have a tiny bit of tastes but this just leaves nothing whatsoever and occasionally a bit of skunk. very dull.

Update: This is now a never again beer. Terrible hangover and after affects from consuming this beer.
Pours a piss-colored yellow, with a white head and slight skunky aroma...it is what it is...

The Australian version is brewed locally and sold at import prices, so I usually boycott this on principle. Aroma is skunk, but weak enough to not repel you. Piss yellow with head that vanishes quickly. Crisp hops taste, slight fruity sourness but in a good way. Hoppy bitter aftertaste. Not great, not shit, meh. Will drink if it’s on special. And chill it thoroughly, it’s shithouse at over 5 degrees C.

Pour form a 24 oz bottle. Slightly skunky aroma detracts from an otherwise nice nose of hops and malt. Light body with slightly sweet malt flavor a the start and a mild hops bitter / astringent finish. Overall, well balanced flavor and lively mouthfeel with active carbonation. Not bad.

Beck’s is standard enough in most regards-nice color, decent but kind of weak overall flavor (more on that in a moment), slightly skunky but not as a whole terrible aroma, and a seemingly refreshing body. The issue is, however, that it seems to be two different beers in one bottle. On first impression, it is standard, refreshing lager. But the finish is very skunky and overbearing. Overall, not too bad, but really not good either.
A clear yellow colored beer, with a white head. The aroma of malts and fruits. The taste of fresh fruits, citrus. There are malts. The aftertaste is a little bitter.

This was the first beer I thought tasted "ok" and didn’t make my face contort. It still doesn’t make me face contort, at least. Flavors of grain and a touch of hops. A crisp, heavily carbonated palate. Slight bitter aftertaste.
Pee yellow color, nearly absent head. Light hoppy aroma, little bit of malts. Watery flavor. Plain, boring, no complexity. I’d love to see someone in Germany drink this.

If I’m in the mood for a European lager, it’s this. Average weak yellow, almost zero head that left a weak white ring. Nice better than average wheaty aroma with a touch of medium strength hops, sweet malts - a good mix indeed, but nothing out of the ordinary. Taste is straight forward. Prominent wheat, tangy bitterness is well balanced. Yum yum yum. Light bodied with a good middle and a fading bitter aftertaste.

Life sucks I’m drinking a Beck’s, must start mentally preparing for the Euro trash defiling of my mouth. Nothing for a cap was produced when dumped into glass despite my best efforts, the body looked beyond crystal clear pale gold, this beer looks so boring I’m falling asleep looking at it. Wow surprisingly pleasant aroma, light hops, weak sweet smelling malts, over all this doesn’t suck very surprised I wasn’t attacked by the typical Euro trash skunk lager smell (cough, cough, Heineken) Flavor is metallicy, with nice light hops, and very sweet malts, good flavor but a touch to sweet for my liking. Way better then I remember or thought it would be, not a bad beer to drink but there are a billion other beers that are a better choice then this, and finish it before it gets warm in your glass because it turns to crap then."

50cl bottle poured into a dimpled mug.  Gold piss color with about one finger white head.  Nose is all hops, kind of skunky.  Flavor has a dull hoppy bitterness but nothing else.  Palate is very watery.  Boring.

Probably the worst German beer that I have had.... Pours a dull golden color, a little bit of white head, tastes of watered down grains and alcohol... I guess it is on par with most "popular" beers in that it is light on taste and you could be really cool and say you drank 20 of them at the bar... and are now "totally wasted"... yet not heavy on the stomach.
Pale yellow, skunky, thin and dry. It’s decent, but very forgettable (as with most beers from this style).

Australia has Fosters lager and Germany has Becks - both are inexplicably popular outside of their countries of origin and rarely drunk within them. This bottled version is even brewed in Australia under license. If memory serves me well it is inferior to the German version. Pours pale yellow with a thin short lasting white head. The nose is light grain sweet malt and little else. The flavour is sweet malt with a hint of fruits and light hop presence. The finish is crisp, abrupt and watery. It is thin bodied and easily sessionable. The Aussie-brewed Heineken just about pips it in my opinion.
A pretty lame beer, not to much to say about the taste as it is lame. A bit frutish. Would be great for a trip to the beach.

Predictable pale yellow with a soft white cover.  Aroma of stale malt, light grassy hops, cold steel.  Taste is just bad, sourish malt character, hay, hope, then a finish like metallic filings in my mouth.
Clear copper color. This beer has a much more ciderish flavor than your typical lager, bubbly and appley. It exhibited a very mild skunk, but mostly showed its fruitiness above all else.
Among my favorite beers. Smooth, crisp, and subtly aromatic. An excellent German lager, considering its high profile and ubiquity.

No surprises here. The worlds most exported beer pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is light malty. Plain flavor with a light maltiness yet crisp and refreshing. The last gold medal for this beer was recieved in 1876 so that was a while ago. Anyway, simple, nice and fresh. Easy to drink.

If we’re all honest with ourselves while drinking this beer, you know going into it what it’s going to be like. While "drinkability" with this beer is high, flavorability (I know, not a word) is low. But that’s not why you’re drinking a Beck’s on a Sunday afternoon watching the 2nd day of the NFL draft, now is it? It wasn’t for me anyways. 



I had some baby back ribs cooking in the backyard, and I just wanted something clean and refreshing to drink. This happened to be on sale so I grabbed a 6 pack (along with 1 sixer of the dark) and cooled it down. Popped it open and here it is. Skunk city. Suprised? Shouldn’t be. Green bottle=skunk. Still, after that dissipates a bit what’s left behind wasn’t bad. Cereal/corn-like aroma buried under some grainy aroma. Really nice to look at, with a solid yellowish-gold color with 2" thick head. Flavors? Well, let’s just say there’s nothing wrong if by that you mean it’s void of flavor. If you really get on your hands and knees and dig deep, you might get some malty-grains out of it but that might be one it passes the point of no return (warm). Drink it quick, drink it cold and don’t think too hard about it.
22 oz Bomber at Blondies NYC. Nice refreshing lager. Light head and look. Goes down nice and smooth. I liked this beer.
Pours out clear as a bell with pretty much no head. Aroma is light grain, taste much the same. Better than your run of the mill lager, but still not something I want to drink very often.

Overall Impression: 
Germans know beer they just don’t mass export their best offerings like they do this one...

Metallic aroma, no appearance whatsoever. I could read a book through the beer. Head like soap scum that vanishes after ten seconds. Every sense is telling me not to, but date I take a drink? ....ugh. There’s hops and... water? Is this just hops-water? It’s a shame I hate hops as I hate hell and all capulets. Would not buy again if I had an option, but if the aternative is to be total stinking sober... hmm.
.5l can. Very simple lager. Sweet, a bit of a bite. Much crisper than other lager tries; sweet banana, grass, syrup. OK.
Un Becks! I had never tried this beer until after I had seen Broken Lizards "Beerfest." I tried it, and liked it. But its still too expensive to buy that often. Pretty good stuff though.
Can. pale yellow gold, white head. Not much aroma. Tastes a little grainy with a slightly metallic bitter finish.
Straw pour, no head and lace. Skunky aroma. Fizzy, thick sweet. Floral hops with a little skunk, and phlegmy candy hops. Not bad, leaves me wanting a drier brew.
very hoppy with a good aroma and easy drinkability that is great for any situation.

2009 Bottle - Pours a pale, clear yellow with a small white head...aroma is stale skunk roadkill and metallic urine...flavour is clean enough, water, slight grain, tiny bit of malt, none too bitter...this is a fucking terrible beer...horrible....
Bottle.  Poured a golden color with a white head.  Aroma was hoppy, grainy,  and a little skunky.  The flavor was pretty much the same.  It did have a nice crisp finish.
I would buy a 12 pack of this and leave it in the fridge, and that’s saying a lot. A very malty sugary beer. Crisp, Clean, and not at all bitter.

Draught.  Poured pale gold with thin head.  Hoppy aroma with a hint of grain.  Bland malt flavour with more hop and a rather thin crispy finish.  This beer is not bad, but it seems to me, save for hoppiness, to be characterless.  Someone told me once that this was brewed ’for the American taste’ and only policemen drink it in Germany.

I took a whif and immediatley was overwhelmed by the hoppyness of this beer.  Nice appereance, rich, clean pour with a ton of foamy, creamy white head.  Very hoppy taste.  Pretty skunky though.  I finsihed my first and had another, but not a third.  Try it. Not bad for a couple.
Bottle, 33cl - golden colored clear beer with a disappearing head. Aroma is hoppy with hints of hay and grass. Flavor is sweet malty with hoppy notes.
From bottle, yellow clear with small white head, aroma of malt grass and metal, flavors of sweet malts bread herbs and some alcohole, hop can be sensed in the aftertaste.

I agree with Oakes on the cat piss thing goin ’ on with the aroma.Add in the custom of skunkiness from the green bottle & then  i’d better get my oxygen mask. Drinking this beer is ok if you pretend you have no sinus function.Its clean ,refreshingly dry and grainy.
A firm maltiness...soothing   hop bitterness.
Very carbonated, taste like cheap German beer.  Its not bad but its not great.
Bottle.  Pouts an extremely light a pale golden color. Very carbonated and a very light tasting beer, big crisp finish.  It’s a shame this is the biggest german export.
Pours pale yellow into a shaker.  White head quickly recedes to nothing. Malt aromas. Crisp with sour malts.  Abrupt finish. Chuggable.

Clear gold, foamy white head.  Citrus hoppy aroma.  Hoppy flavor with a nice citrus bitterness.  This is a very refreshing beer when served ice cold.  My primary memory of this one will always be enjoying them on the shores of Narraganset Bay during the summer of 2008, at a residence named Farmlands, in Newport, Rhode Island.
not particularly good german lager. it has a simple flavour with a hoppy presence.decent
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow color no head. Aroma is malts,grass, and corn. Flavor is skunk and mostly malts. Very thin watery body.
Too hoppy in the bad sense - both taste & aroma. Too bitter for its style. Tad dry and what’s with the iron twang to the flavour (very slight albeit)?
I don’t know why they would think we would actually like skunk in a bottle.
Hey it’s the German miller light.  Golden color, incredibly light.  When it’s not ice cold it’s gross.
Försiktig i smaken, följsam utan att bli spak. Knappast oförglömlig, men ändå avslappnat skön. Kravlös. En omsorgsfullt smakande lager.

Bottle. The smell is sweet and quite hoppy, unfortunately also a little bit sour. The head is small, white and creamy-foamy with a short duration, the body is clear and pale yellow. The first taste is bitter, then it gets metallic. The aftertaste is only short and not really impressive. The body is light to medium and rather dry without much carbonation. The finish is also a little bit metallic. Overall a normal medium beer.

710 mL bottle. I’ve sampled it a few times before and for the purpose of this assay, it is no different. Pours a clear yellow with a thin soapy white head that quickly dissipated and left no lace on the sides. The aroma is malt, corn, skunk, and grass with a hint of it being feral. Pretty stinky, really. The taste is malt-corn-hops with a certain astringency to it and the mouth feel is almost like unsweetened ginger ale. Grainy aftertaste fading to a ginger ale-like note. The hops the brewer uses must be stale. It struggles to beat the one-star beers I’ve sampled. Nicht Scheisse but it is disappointing.
Another of the limited beer choices  from my youth. Wouldn’t go near this one today.

clear golden yellow, thin head.  smells like skunk big time.  Tastes light and watery with flavors of skunk grain and old hops.
Overall pretty sad.
12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear yellow color with a one finger white head.  The aroma and flavor were grainy.  A good bitter finish, but overall not a great beer.

bottle, pours an almost clear amber, large white head that leaves quickly. definite corn aromas, with some grain as well. actually has some body for such a lightly colored beer. might be refreshing on a hot day after a round of golf. pretty decent for a macro.

One of my first favorites when I first began drinking beer many years ago... this one is available everywhere and can be obtained for about $12.99 for a 12 pack in my area. I drink it as an every day beer when nothing else peeks my curiousity.. not he best German Plis, but not the worst either. Still a good solid beer to keep in the fridge!
On tap in Germany Lufthansa Bussiness Lounge Frankfurt Airport. My last beer for awhile since I will be in Kuwait for sometime. Not a bad lager by world standards and good for a Macro.

Bottle, Works do, London.  In the dim and distant past I had drunk a few of these, but was in no hurry to repeat the misfortune until this was thrust upon me. A classic ? You must be joking, this is surely the German Fosters/Carling ? Skunky aroma, down right nasty flavour. Shizer.
Draught at La Morse in Rehovot. Clear golden color. Grainy aroma with some veggies notes. Sweet grainy flavor. Light-bodied.

330 mL. Pours a pale yellow with a fizzy white cap that dwindles down to nothing. No lacing. Aromas of corn, sugar, dry hops, and grain. Taste is sweet corn, grain, and faint German hops. Watery on the palate. High carbonation. Better than average macro.
pale pour, subtle hops aroma. classic german pils.  a little bland. refreshing but not thrilling

Canette de 500 ml. Nos yeux observent une bière de couleur soleil et un col de mousse fugace. Au nez on respire des arômes de grain frais et sucré ainsi qu’une légère présence de houblon floral. En bouche le corps est moyen avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On goûte des saveurs de grain et de houblon sec. Une bière franche et sèche.
12oz bottle. light pale yellow, small white foamy head. bit of hops aroma. small bitter hop finish

Among the better drinks around at New Years - which doesnt say much for the selection.  Drinkable is about all you can say about it as it is nearly indistinguishable from most of the ilk other than there being less rice notes and maybe two more hop molecules floating around in the bottle than most macros.
Bottle. Didn’t bother to pour. Taste is crisp with a nice amount of hops on the finish. Body is malty and clean. Great with pizza. Average Lager.
330ml bottle. Nice white head when poured into glass, although it quickly disappears. Bitterness is okay and poured an amber colour. Aroma of hops.

Average looking pour with a metallic//grainy aroma. This is similar, but not identical to St. Paulie Girl. This is actually better as it has much more presence of hops and a nice bitter after-taste. Unfortunately it is over priced.
Typique allemande bon petit gout sec   Cette lager est presque transparente   Tres legere mais tres bonne

12oz bottle. A light golden beer with a soapy head. Smell is mostly hoppy.  
Taste is light and hoppy on a base of bready malt. A typical German pilsner.

It is golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, light straw and a light sweetness. The flavour has a light sweetness and a slightly dry bitterness, notes of malt, straw and the finish is dry. It has no flaws and no finesse.

[330ml bottle from the Brewery Tap, Reading] I remember disliking this when I had tried it in the past.  However, I was forced into having it when visiting a pub where shockingly there was nothing on the 3 handpumps and they had also run out of all their premium continental beers leaving just 6 macros, of which this was the only one I hadnt rated.  I was pleasantly surprised on tasting it - this is far better than I remembered; there is actually a decent amount of malt in there, and a bit of lime/citrus hoppy bite.  The carbonation is not too excessive, and yet it has still got a crisp, refreshing finish.  By macro lager standards this is very good, although by overall beer standards it is still nothing to write home about.  I am guessing that the Reinheitsgebot has done some good, given that Germanys biggest macro is still of significantly higher quality than most world macros that are foisted on us!

Becks always reminds me of that line from Beerfest: "...und...und...und...und Becks!!!" Classic cinema, does not get any better than that. Where were we? Oh yeah, Becks.  Third best beer in Germany?  Riiiiiight. "Becks" is probably German for "run of the mill." Not terrible for a macro, but still watery and a little skunky. Und...und...und NEXT.

clear yellow, tiny white head, modest lacing.  sweetish malt with hint of hops in nose.  the flavor follows the aroma.  how boring.  medium bodied, dry finish.  a pretty forgettable brew.  a 24oz pint bottle from liquor depot in monee.
solid lager...fruity, clean, smooth.  clear body, thin white head.  easy to drink, crisp and simple.
Pours a clear yellow body with thin white head. Sweet, kind of skunky. Eh, just okay to me.
Clear yellow with small white head. Good balance of malt and hops, with a bitter finish.
It had a solid tatse and good aroma.  This and Heineken were my first two import beers not from Mexico.  It has a much cleaner taste than the big three.

Bottle at friends house. Pale straw with a fluffy white head. I  hadnt tried this beer for quite a few years but it sure has gone down hill under the ownership of InBev. It now tastes like a cheap british lager, full of adjuncts rather than the sound but dull german pils that it used to be..
Bottle.  Just the Budweiser of Germany.  Very drinkable for a commercialized beer, and pretty good overall, but Im gonna stick to the craft brews and seasonals.

Cask or bottle, both are equally dull.  Usual lager colour, malty aroma, dull as dishwater taste with an unpleasant, unidentifiable tang in the finish.  Still one of the better ones widely available in the UK.  That says a depressingly large amount about the average UK drinker.

Pours gold, with a short-lived, but pleasant uneven airy white head.  The nose is very hoppy, but the taste is more mild.  Hop notes at the beginning don’t last long and fade to a slightly sweet clean finish.  Nice, simple beer.
Draught. Pours pale yellow, with white head and some lacing. Quite typical of the genre - hoppy and grassy aroma, and slightly bitter on the palate. Not bad for a macro.
Just enough balance of hoppy and bitter to be interesting. Bonus points for Bavarian hops. Some skunkiness in the aroma, maybe due to the green bottle? A decent, sessionable macro.
A very refreshing pale yellow lager. It has a slightly bitter flavor that is not watery. Can smell a bit skunky, but overall it is a favorite of mine.
The skunk aroma is unmistakable.  Pale yellow clear color.  A slightly bitter flavor . A dry thin texture with small white head.  This is the skunkiest beer.  Not my preferred style.
Pale yellow lager, light flavor but a skunky aftertaste which I personally enjoyed. A pretty quenching beer.
On Tap. Pale yellow beer. Slight grassy aroma. Thin plate, light in flavour and malt. Has a slightly stronger hop finish then others in this style (eg: Carlsberg). Quenching lager.
Pale yellow pour with diminishing frothy head.  Hoppy aroma and grainy start leading to skunky finish. Best of the rip off ’premium’ beers found in English pubs. Which says nothing.
on tap - yellow golden beer with white head. Very unpleasent skunk aroma. Dry hops aroma.

Glass, 20 ounces, draught, at Daniel O’Connell’s on August 15 2008; eye: golden, average effervescence, clear, tiny white head, nice lacing; nose: grainy malt, light hops, small unknown unpleasant odour; mouth: caramel malt, bitter hops, layer of caramel throughout the sip, unknown unpleasant taste that corresponds to the odour, finale in malt with caramel (that will eventually become cloying) and a bit of refreshing hops, medium body, lightly grainy texture, average carbonation, mildly sweet and bitter; overall: not as good as I recollect

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, 20 onces, en fût, bue chez Daniel O’Connell’s le 15 août 2008; oeil : dorée, effervescence moyenne, claire, petite mousse blanche, bonne dentelle; nez : malt granuleux, léger houblon, p’tite odeur inconnue désagréable; bouche : malt caramel, houblon amère, couche de caramel tout au long de la gorgée, saveur désagréable inconnue qui correspond à l’odeur, finale en malt avec caramel (qui deviendra éventuellement toquant) et une p’tite pointe de houblon rafraîchissant, corps moyen, texture légèrement granuleuse, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée et amère; en résumé : moins bonne que mes souvenirs
Golden color, aroma of skunk, skunky and grassy taste that finishes crisp.  Not terrible, but not particularly good either.

On tap at Yankee Stadium.  Given that Bud Light seemed to be the only other option in the whole park, this was a welcome sight.  Clear light golden pour with a decent bubbly/foamy white head.  Grainy cereal taste; a little sweet and a bit of slightly skunky floral hops.  Not bad, and refreshingly light.  Good for an afternoon ballgame in the sun.

Tasted 9/15/08.  12oz bottle.  Pale golden hue with white ring of head.  Cereal malt aromas.  Light to medium bodied and significantly bigger than its light counterpart.  Bready malts and crisp bitterness.  Leaves the mouth a little sticky.  Tingling effervescence and a mild malt character that actually stands out.  Still a green bottled beer.  Meh...

pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head that dissipates quickly, lively carbonation, not much lacing.

smell of grain, corn, malt.

taste is crisp, watery, malt, corn syrup, ends oily, with a funky aftertaste.
Used to be a bigger fan of this beer before I acquired a real taste.  I must say it is still crisp and refreshing, unique flavor and aroma, light pour, bitter end.
Golden ywllow color.  Aroma of grass and skunk.  Sweet taste with fruit and hops.  Not bad, but not special.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Golden sparkling Pilsener with an grassy start and an fine thirstquenching ending.
I expected worse. I had it sitting in my fridge for nearly a year, Nothing bad. Just not much of anything good.
Pale yellow with minimal head and lacing. Skunky smell and taste, with a bit of hops and a bit of malt. Surprisingly dry and crisp aftertaste. Not bad, just not a very interesting brew.

Taste 9/8 Pint Can(best by 5/9). Looks: Pale gold, thin white top. Medium carbonation movement. Aroma: Mild grain. Banana/ester. Taste: O.k.  brew for the amounts produced. Warsteiner with harder water and more bite. The taste is mild, the mouthfeel is more alive. O.k.
Golden color, sweet malty and citrus taste, nothing special but its not bad beer, its ok
Draught. Clear golden colour with a medium white head. Hoppy aroma. Flavour is hops and citrus. Slightly bitter and dry finish.

Standard lager.   The aroma is of malts, other adjuncts.  The color is a yellow, slighly reddish copper color.  The flavor is undistinguishable between this and a pale lager like Bud.  The palate vanishes quickly, and is devoid of hops, or anything interesting.  I’ddrink this if it was served at a BBQ or something, but that’s it.
Bottle. Golden pilsener, fresh hoppy taste, a bit sweet. Mostly dry and refreshing.
A little dull in all honesty and i’ve heard the green bottles can get quite skunked. I suppose there are worse lagers but not my first choice.
Light lager beer.  Nothing to set it apart from others.  Fizzy and watery.  Dry and lightly bitter finish.

Pours a nice golden hue with thin white head. Aroma is very skunky and unappealing. Tastes of grain and corn with very light hops and hints of citrus. Rather dry taste but quite drinkable. Personally not a fan of this beer: too much skunk flavor to it.

A 12 oz Bottle. Not thrilled with green bottles usually but was surprisingly not to bad. Was easy to drink and had a nice citrus flavor to it with a little bit of corny taste but not to awful. Definitely would have again.

HAd in a 0.5 L can. Pours a bright golden colour with a medium sized head. Aroma of corn and malts. Overall, the taste is like most premium lagers- cheap, and refreshing. I would try to drink this again, but it is not an outstanding beer.
Tap. Really light yellow color. Taste is corn and some sweet malt. Light....
Average mainstream lager, every time I drink it I get the hiccups. Enough to piss me off

Bitter and hoppy and citrusy , its a great beer and has a sharp bite to it , good stuff, great in bottles.  The Germany version is awesome. The Chinese and English versions are very poor tho. I must elaborate. Many years ago I enjoyed Beck’s in the UK and then one day I didn’t. I assumed my taste buds had developed in a new direction. Recently I went to Germany and drank a can of it and was reminded how much I loved it years back. Essentially the none German version is weak and poor and has no bite to it. So if you are going to buy it, check where it is made first.
Can. Pours a pale yellow, medium off white head. Aroma is malt and not much else. Flavor is again malt, grain and bread. A touch of bitterness at the end.

Descrição: Essa Premium Lager alemã apresenta em seu aroma lufadas de pão, fermento biológico e até mesmo um pouco de poeira - é o autêntico pão líquido, parecidíssima à Brahma Extra (3/10). A aparência inicial da espuma é pequena, com coloração branca e formação moderada de colarinho. Apresenta longevidade reduzida, corpo claro e ralo, de tonalidade amarelo-claro (2/5).
O sabor inicial é levemente amargo e ligeiramente salgado, sensação essa que se mantém até o final, de média duração (3/10). No paladar, um corpo leve e textura aguada, com carbonatação borbulhante e final metálico (2/5).
Golden pour with a fizzy head.  A bit of grain and citrus in the aroma and flavor, with a decent hop bite.  Well carbonated.  Not great, but refreshing.
macro mainstream lager. my only comment after tasting was boring, so no hints from this rater.
A nice mainstream lager. I was pleasently surprised by the marked bitterness and the fresh palate. Not groundbreaking in anyway, but a nice beer in warm weather.
A nice mainstream lager. I was pleasently surprised by the marked bitterness and the fresh palate. Not groundbreaking in anyway, but a nice beer in warm weather.
chiara schiuma media non molto persistente sentori di malto ed amaro piuttosto secca
Not a fan of this beer. It has a similar bite to it that heineken has but with much more flavor, but still not a good one.
Pale yellow beer, usual strawy lager aroma. No head whatsoever... Thin taste with a sharp finish. Simple and refreshing.

From a 12 fl. oz. bottle dated 05 2008 and coded L 14273u.   It pours an attractive golden tone with virtually no head.  Aroma primarily of malts. Medium mouth feel.  A tad more bitter than an American lager with a muted hint of hops.  I have never liked green bottles.  Everything from green bottles always taste off but this one holds its own better than some.  An adequate brew and easy to find if you’re looking for something just a bit better than B-M-C and can’t get your hands on a micro.

I don’t understand why beer still comes in green bottles. Do they not have wikipedia or sam adams comercials in germany? I expected this to be a skunk factory when I opened it, but only had notes of skunk. The beer was a pale yellow, and had a mild malt smell. The taste was very thin, in fact, I’m not sure there is anything to the taste. Finish is a bit metallic. Gets flat before you finish the bottle.
Bottle: Smells like straw that a family rabid skunks got into. Weak beer that is very skunky. BEER NEEDS LIGHT PROTECTION!
Typical lager aroma. Flavor has some extra note of citrus maybe, nice. Appropriate effervescence. Refreshing in the Texas heat, and a notch above many other lagers.

No 335

Rated:06.03.2008

Bottle green, 330 ml, 11.2P

Appearance: Pours pure and perfectly clear, light golden body colour, carbonation is visually medium to high, head is initially medium to high, head is initially small, than decreases to a minimal froth, white, foamy, its more like in body colour than previously tasted DAB Original.

Aroma: Very mild, neutral, rather boring, nothing being pronounced, average, balanced between hoppyness, very mild and not negative, but again nothing interesting.

Flavour: First impression is tangy, accidic and salty, some minerality, clean and clear, no sugar additives, thin, bitter on palate, some grainy base, definitely not sweet. All in all the taste is not pronounced, but nothing bad can be found about it. Finish duration is quite short.

Palate: Slightly grainy, slightly bitter, carbonation on palate is rather soft. Body is light, texture is wattery, carbonation on palate is soft, finish feel is lightly alcoholic, clean and a bit metalic.
Bottle.  An ok default lager.  More bitter than some other macros.  Finish disappointing.
Pours a piss-colored yellow, with a white head and slight skunky aroma.  Not bad, but I’d rather have a Hofbrau Original or St. Pauli Girl.

Can. Creamy white good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Light mlaty and hoppy aroma. Slightly grassy. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Soft carbonated nice watery palate. OK beer, but a little dull.

Pint can.  Pours a light gold with 2 finger fluffy snow white head that fades quickly but leaves some spotty lacing.  Nose is sweet grainy malts and light hops.  Taste is more sweet grain, a touch of yeast, light hops and a dry, slight lemon-like citrus finish.  Medium mouth feel.  Not that bad - refreshing and drinkable on a hot day..  Much better in a can than that skunky green bottle.

Very clear and pure golden color. Medium head is big bubbly and it quickly disappearing. Malty nad hoppy aroma got also some toffyness in it. Flavor is a bit dry, malty and refreshingly hoppy. Light-bodied and bitterly carbonated palate.

Beck’s, Beck’s Premier Light, and Beck’s N/A Horizontal rating.    12oz green bottle.  DATE 11.2008.  Pours golden, smallest white head of the three.  Aroma of bread and heavy skunk.  SKUNK.   Mouthfeel of bready malt.   Hoppy bitterness.  Finishes with skunk flavor.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with a medium white creamy head. Nice maly body with a nice hoppy finish.

This is one of my favorite macro lagers.  The taste is light and refreshing and something about it actually gave me the impression that this actually was a "premium" beer relative to its competitors.  Easy to drink all night without forcing it down.

Pale yellow beer with a thin white head.

The scent was very skunky, the taste was much the same. The hops seemed to have turned a bit fir the worse.

Low carbonation made the beer a bit flat.

I could certainly drink a few of these down, but I’d much rather pour something else.

Serving type: bottle
This beer is just plain bad! It looks yellow not golden and smelled skunked. I have tried it multiple times and everytime it smells skunked. Not my thing.

I have to imagine that this beer got a whole lot worse in the last 10 years, and like many of us, my taste buds and palate has also changed. This poured a piss yellow, with a small head. There was almost no aroma. the mouthful was fizzy and somewhat flavorless, with a malty somewhat dry finish.Maybe a nice fresh one from the brewery would be an improvement,but this was pretty bad.

33cl bottle.   The aroma was devoid of skunkage for the most part, but the hops seemed to give it a pissy quality that didn’t really agree with me.   Moderately thin malt body with just enough hop bitterness in the finish to let you know that you are not drinking an american macro.   Amazing what a little hops can do for a beer, though the malts don’t add much to the equation.   Light and refreshing anyway.   I would get this again if the other option was Heineken.(2.5)   Rerate: who knew I would get a second crack at this in a two day period?   Well, some more examination delivered a pretty bland and lifeless beer with a harsh mouthfeel.   Still a cut above most macro lager, but hardly worth worrying about.

I actually don’t mind a skunky lager. When I was younger, I loved this beer and thought it was one of the best lagers out there. But that`s just it...I was young and naive. Today I enjoy a more sophisticated taste and also have to say, that for a `Major Brand`beer it`s not too bad at all. I like it better than Heineken. However overall, it`s a fairly weak contender. There are definitely a lot better out there.
I’m usually fairly descriptive with my ratings but I can’t help it this time...this beer if crap.  Enough said.

Presentation: Poured from a 24oz green bottle into a tall flute glass. It pours a very pale yellow color with great clarity and a tall fizzy white head. The head faded fast and left behind no lace. The aroma had a light skunky aroma over light floral and grassy hop notes. There was a delicate grainy malt with some floral hops that finished on a skunky note. Its palate was thin with a watery texture and fizzy carbonation. Not sure if I got a bad bottle but it was consumed well before the freshness date on the label.
Since discovering craft beer, it’s hard to cut the macros a break, but Becks was always been delightful on tap until I knew better. It smells like beer, and is crisp and smooth.

This is an OK beer.  Much like other German Lagers it has a fresh hoppy small and taste.  It is light in appearance and light on the palate which makes it a good drinking beer but nothing special.  Much like a heinekein perhaps a little better.

I’ve heard from a few people that becks is ’The best beer from Germany’, but after tasting a 26er of it today I have to disagree. It was alright, nothing special, strong grassy taste, smelled like a wet barn on a hot summers day. I drank it out of the bottle so I don’t know the colour, or the strength of the head, but it was Ok.
skunky skunky. the watery character has a slightly bitter finish. there’s not much positive to this beer except it was free.

Bottle. Third beer of the "Not-Very-Good-Beers-Tasting" - Day 1. Pours a clear pale yellow-gold with an average size diminishing overly-white head. Aroma: Oh good, a green bottle, so of course there’s some mild skunkyness to go with the grain, corn, cardboard, light grassy hops, vegetal notes and some sugary sweetness. Watery flavour is sweet and corny with light grassy hops and a short, light bitter finish (short is good in this case). Light bodied. Not good -- there’s worse out there but that’s not saying much, I wouldn’t drink this again.

Spicy hop nose, subtle honey notes.  Light yellow gold color, good size head, did not last very long though.  Some honey/fruit sweetness, bitterness is very noticeable.  Decent carbonation, not a very clean finish.  Not bad, but definitely nothing remarkable about it.

Slightly better than Heine in my opinion.  Nice clean funk to it.  Big carbonation and a teensy bit of hop flavor on the finish.  I’d have to agree with WickerBrew and say save your pennies and buy cheaper bland beer.

Not much to say about this basic lager, it really does taste alot like Heineken to me.  Its got the crisp light apple taste.  Like most import lagers, save a few pennies and just go with Bud, or spend the same and get something good.
Pours light yellow with quickly fading white head. Bit of hops and malt in the aroma. Flavor is malt, bread,and a bit of honey. A little citrus and malt in the finish. Not great but very drinkable.

When I was younger, this was one of the few alternatives around besides mass produced brew around when you lived in Smalltown Iowa. But now with so much better brew around and so much more readily available-why bother?
Now it justs seems like mundane euro-lager.

Bottle 50 cl. [Courtesy of friends Heidi and Peter] Large fin foamed white head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Clear flat looking pale yellow color. Aroma of grass, cardboard, caramel, grain. Light bodied with an average carbonation and light dry and thin texture. Light bitter and sweet flavor. Light dry and bitter finish.
The top is quite uneven and ugly and the color is your average lager. Those three words pretty much describe the beer all around. Nothing special, but nothing specially wrong either.
33 cl bottle, Berlin. Slightly skunky aroma, balanced hop and malt, always better in Germany.
Bottle Pours a yellow pale with little white head.  Aroma is malty sweet and a little skunked.  Flavor is malty, sweet, grainy, and no real hop or etoh character.  lame.
Poured from a bottle a light gold with a small white head.  Mild hint of hops.  Crisp and refreshing.

en cuanto a cervezas popularmente distribuidas y disponibles esta es una de las mejorcitas.  hay que tomarla cuando no hay mejores opciones en los star mart y vamos de paseo.  pajita pajita pajita [insertar] mas pajita para cumplir el requisito
Not all that impressed here. Ok color with subpar flavor. Tastes a little better than Budweiser. After a few sips, I can’t taste it anymore.

Bottle.  Pours a clear pale gold a quickly fading white head.  Smell is terrible, this just wreaks of musty hallertau hops like many other "premium" european lagers but to a greater extent.  Despite all this, its still somewhat drinkable as the flavor is much less offensive.
Pours a hazey golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is typically skunky, griany and faint of fruit. Taste is relatively grainy as well, and tart in the finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a large mostly lasting white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of pilsner malt and light noble hops. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium mouthfeel with a mild amount of bitterness. Good.

12oz bottle: pours golden brown with decent white head, aroma SKUNKY! flavor slight bit of malt with some skunky after taste, by far the worst pop top i have ever had and could be the worst beer i have ever had. can say i will never buy again.
Une bière avec une forte odeur de moufette, mais pourtant très bonne au goût
A macro import lager.  Aroma of sweet grain.  No hop presence.  Taste is also lightly malted with plenty of grain.  Body is weak and carbonated.
Has a decent crispness about it. Virtually no taste other than a little bit of a hop precense. Unpleasent aftertaste.
a bit too bulky. I’d compare it with carlsberg heineken and other blaa blaa lagers. booooring
Good, dependable lager.  It’s got that skunky aftertaste, but I actually enjoy it.  Not bad by any means.
all wright beer huge hangover :)Smooth down going little skunky and malty .Never got a chance to pour it in the glass . Kinda harsh worm :)

This beer will always remain a sentimental favourite, I think. A German guy gave me a bottle as I was walking through a park in Oldenburg, about 30 minutes from Bremen, where Becks is brewed. It wasn’t cold but I liked it just the same. Definitely a good beer to reach for. I think I may do so once I return to the U.S. of A. as I believe it is probably more widely available there than most other German brews.

Pretty smooth, a tad bitter but definitely good-tasting.

Served via 12-oz bottle at Miller’s Tavern in downtown Chicago, Illinois. Pours a clear light golden brew with a thin white head that quickly dissipates clean. Aroma of sweet fruity and white bread malt, grassy hops and a touch of cardboard. Taste is light bodied, well-carbonated with flavors of white bread with some corn grits, grassy hops, some fruity pear character and a touch of dry herbs. Finish is crisp, clean cut with a light bitterness that quickly disappears. An average mass-produced lager beer.
Sweet corn aroma, hardly skunky at all. Light golden color, medium head. Artificial bitter and slightly sweet grass flavor. Not disgusting.
Sweet German lager aroma, unique style with a bitter taste. It’s a just above average beer that goes down smooth.
very distinctive german lager aroma decent for the style and little bitter goes down easy
Pours yellow-gold, with a thin foamy white head.  Distinctive german lager aroma.  Goes down easy, a little bitter, but with a smooth finish.  Decent for the style.
...a great classic.  Nice floral hop notes, with a great lingering finish.  Not overpowering, but present gives it a balanced, fresh lager flavor.

This is the kind of beer I liked the more I had it but it is very limited.  Some sweet malts, grassy and pretty crisp and refreshing.  Not bad.  However I have had my fair share of skunked bottles.  Re-rate 4/27/09.  Had a couple of these a week or so ago and it really isn’t bad at all.  A bit sweet with some cereal, grainy character there and a mild bitter edge to it that at times flirts with being skunky.  Overall not bad at all though, unless of course you get a skunked bottle, which has and will happen.

Can. Small, creamy, white diminishing head with fair lacing. Light yellow body. Average malt aroma and light dry hop aroma. The body is light and thin and hasa lively carbonation and a slightly bitter finish. The flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter.
I wouldn’t go out of my way to buy it, or drink it, but if its around, I wouldn’t mind it.
Beck’s is very unique.  Nice hoppy blend and a nice head.  Flavors are slightly bitter but not watery.
Compared to the other macros I’ve had its not as bad. Still not good. But with standable I guess.
Great for a macro-brew. Good full body beer, with good taste and no bitter aftertaste. I have to give this beer a good mass produced rating. If only Busch would learn to produce something like this.
Not half bad for a big macro brewed beer of this style.  Some fair malt aroma and flavor.  Hops barely noticeable on finish.  Drinkable if there is noting else avail...I guess.
A good German lager.  Clean and drinkable.  Nothing really stands out in its taste or nose.  Clean finish with the slightest hint of hops.
this stuff is absolute skunk piss no joke i could only take one sip. the expiration was 11/08 AWFUL
Nothing fancy here, but it was a nice pils to enjoy while watching the B-ball games last night.  A clean crisp beer with a little hops.

24 oz bottle.  Pours a clean yellow color with no head.  Aroma is of hops and malt.  Flavor is of malts and is a little sweet.  Overall, this is not a bad beer as it is smooth and clean tasting, but it is overpriced for what it is.
(GERMAN) Pale Yellow color with a SAm-White Head. It has a Grassy Aroma with clean but bland taste. This is an Average Pils but it would be nice to drink with friends in the Summer
Clear golden with medium white head. Comes out grassy and grainy with light caramel notes.

Drank from can. Aroma makes me think of two ’sodas’: Baking and club. Some slight sweetness and a bit of fondue detectable. A little vinegary. Burnt caramel and toast flavour. Feels like the beer was carbonated ’unnaturally’ at some point. Some yeast flavour. Reminds me a bit of a very toned down tripel. Medium bodied but seems watery. Leaves a tiny hop linger in the mouth. Reasonably enjoyable.
Nice golden color with a lite hoppy aroma. Very lite bitter flavor. I could definatly sit around drinking this.
this is the worste german beer there is it sould not even be as anything consider remotely related to beer
Typical German lager beer.  Clean and fresh, not a home run, but gets the job done.  EZ drinker, sessionable.

Nothing special to look at. Has a very nice (standard german pils) aroma of hop filled fields.   Palate has a nice honey and butter taste along with that familiar iron-tinged flavor of German-grown hops.   Overall tastes like a standard German pils (which happens to be a style I enjoy).
Pale galod body and white head. little malty aroma of grains. light medium body. little flavor and bitter in the finish. A medium lager.

Absolutely cliche!!!  If you grab one of these in glee, you probaly have never had a quality beer.  This bane has spawned loads of immitations.  It’s no longer relevant, and rightfully so.  It’s aroma is almost non-existent.  It’s appearance is suds in a bucket.  It’s flavor is Heineken, Moosehead, Tsingtao, and many, many more of the same rubbish.  Absolutlely will never be in my fridge.  It’s somewhat bitter, reminding me to cancel this from my memory.

Bottle. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt and straw. Medium/thin body. Flavor is again malt and straw and almost hints at some sweet caramel, but not quite. It’s not to bad, but there’s really not much going on here.
When I poured the beer it smelled skunky to me which turned me off but I ended up enjoying the taste.  I hope to like the Becks Dark better!

Pours very light pale yellow with a large white frothy head. Smell like grain and a tinge of old hops. Flavor is a balanced malt/hop mix, that’s surprisingly drinkable for a lager, not my favortie style of beer. Finish is a little bitter and has a slight fizz.  It’s a little watery. An ok lager.

I find Becks to be the more enjoyable of the popular european lagers.
They have dispensed to some degree with the cloying malty sweetness an ad just enough bitterness to stand it above the other contenders.

Egészen világos aranyszínű,közepesen tartós habbal rendelkező sör.Illata olyan intenzív "lageres".Ízében kicsit csípős,kesernyés.Utóíze egy átlag lagerhez képest keserűbb és kitartóbb.Semmi különös,egy igazi tömegcikk!!

The best of what Germans do best?  That’s a joke!  The quality was not much more than that of American macros, just not as watered down.  Not flavorful, and what’s there is pretty boring and a little skunky.  A disgrace to the great reputation of Deutchland’s beers.
Wer hopfiges Pils mag, wird Beck`s lieben. Knackig-hopfig im Antrunk, etwas dünn im Mittelteil und schön herb im Abgang. Kein Pils von Welt, aber doch recht ordentlich!
Tap. Pale yellow colour. A bit thin on the nose. Some malty notes. Flavour is a bit thin with some flowery hops.

bottle: a decent german lager, hoppy, golden color.

draft: a bit more fruity in flavor than from the bottle.
great smell. nice head, doesnt hold very long however. very hoppy and malty aroma, great.
Bottle: Pale yellow with no head.  Aromas of hops and malt.  Sweet up front, hoppy, but a little skunky.  Slight bitter finish...not great.

12 oz. A darker shade of pale gold with a small, lasting head. Aroma is of a skunk wearing  rubbers, walking in the tall grass and burping after eating a dinner of honey. Flavor is grain that’s a bit stale, some older hay, and watered down honey. Light-medium body is smooth, tingly and refreshing. Other than the smell and the taste, this is the perfect beer!

12 oz. bottle poured into lager glass- poured transparent golden yellow, white head formed then went away in a minute, medium carbonation, aroma of weak malt.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, malt is detectable and refreshing, a bit of hop and suger note on the finish.  Ok session brew, better than the majority of US macros.

I’d heard a lot of good things about this beer from my friends over the years, so imagine my dismay when I found out, by tasting, that this is actually Bavarian goat urine, or so I wish it was, as that would actually be quite refreshing in comparison. Not to mention more intoxicating. In other words, this skunky funk is not as good as the Studio 54 crowd would have you believe. Any hobo walking around Skid Row guzzling a gallon jug of Carlo Rossi could tell you that this stuff is disgusting; If only I’d listened and spent my 4 bucks on Night Train instead. :(
A solid German Lager. Rich taste that is a good every-day drinker. Very crisp with a good presence of hops.
Not bad for this kind of ubiquitous kind of lager. Easy to drink, and not too gassy.

Pale yellow pour with a smaller white sudsie head.  The aroma is of some hop, and as I usually dread from green bottle beers, skunk.  The flavor is not true to the skunk aroma.   The flavor is a fairly pleasant malt with some sweet/citrus overtones.  Over all much better then I had hoped....
This does remind me that I NEED to get to one of these countries that uses the green bottles and try this stuff fresh!
12 oz. bottle, a dry hoppy german lager with some floral notes but mostly just overpowering dryness and a thin finish
Not a bad German lager. Many better to be had though. Brewed under licence in Australia - I’m sure the original would be noticeably better.
Somehow this one was overlooked. Tastes like a pretty straight forward german lager. Nothing too special about it, but quite drinkable. More astringent bitterness than one would like, but oh well.

12oz bottle.
yellow and fizzy with the typical metallic german smell. not a whole lot going here, but a swiller.
On tap in Germany, this poured, looked and smelled like every other Pilsner I had there. Beck’s was a touch sweeter though, so it gets a bit higher score.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a pale golden with a small white head and an unpleasant skunky hoppy aroma. The flavor is very hoppy too, but it doesn’t have much else to offe, not really malty or so. Medium hoppy finish. Not good
It’s really time to rate that beer. The bottle looks very simple. The beer in the glass is okay, very zippy. Very hoppy aroma, flavor the same. Too dry, I don’t like it.

~Light sweet floral smell. Can detect a bit bit of glass odor.
~Big fluffy white head. Nearly 3 inches. Light golden colour.
Lots of carbonation.
~Flavor is sweet. Reminds me of honey.
~Medium palate, Sweet finish.
~Iv’e had a few "Old Rasputins" Before tasting this.
I’m sure my senses are off, but this beer seems very refreshing and
sweet at this time. Its sweet from beginning to end.
I remember before it had a skunky taste similar to Heinekin and St. Pauli’s.
Will definetly have to try again.

08/08/2011. Tried again,  Tatse like sour corny pils malt. Skunky. Difinetly way better fresh. Adjusting scores accordingly.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow, white head. Aroma is skunky hoppy & malty. Flavor is the same. Nothing special here.
yellow/gold pour with a thin white head that dissipated quickly. malty aroma that smelled better than the beer tasted. sharp and light but with a slightly off putting finish
Muito gostosa. Lúpulo no cheiro e no sabor. Boa drincabilidade. Amarga e com gosto de malte. Coloração amarelo ouro.
Golden color, little head. A little malty and hopy mouthfeel with a medium carbonation: A little bit sour&dry finish.

A Mes rate: Bottle that Morris insited I had on Christmas day.
Pale gold, no head. Malt, tobacco and corn aroma. Hmmm, liquid paper flavour. Malt finish, nasty sweetness. Terribly bad. The commercial description is so ridiculously far from the truth they should be hauled into court by trading standards.
light yellow color, some white foam that goes away quick.nose is grassy some stale hops. dry hops and some malt but not overly complex, somewhat watery
Small head,good carb yellow colour,aroma pungent,flavour,sour at first,has some bitter,cannot pick up any other flavours,slight floral sweetness perhaps.Not a good finish sour sweet.
Solid beer, easy to drink. Wouldn’t buy but wouldn’t turn one down if offered.

From a beers of the world mix pack, thoughtful xmas gift. Pours light gold, small white head. Very light hop character in the nose. Soft maltiness up front, light honey character. Mild crisp finish, balanced, a touch more hops then other european mainstream macro lagers.

This beer would have the Musicians Of Bremen spinning in their graves. Presumably a beer that knowledgable German’s don’t drink? Again, I’m blaming the English who drink a lot of it. Obviously popular due to the fact that Mark Fowler aka Tucker from Grange Hill used to drink it in the Queen Vic. I’m proud to be English for sure but at times I feel let down by our lack of sophistication. Anyway, German beer with a nasty dry aftertaste. Like licking exposed metal on the tube. Try that as an alternative to Becks, you might be pleasantly suprised.

I was just "So-So" on this beer. Poors a bright golden color, aroma and flavor hops evident. Light head with quick retention. One should get this from a store that takes care of their beer or you will be drinking a skunk.

Pours a crisp golden, light white head. Aroma is light, and slightly hoppy. Flavor is okay. Slightly sweet. Slightly dry. Crisp, and a tad bit hoppy. Slightly floral. Nothing special though. Decent? Yeah. The "best of what Germans do best"? No.

First off, Heineken comparisons are bad, Beck’s is much better and cleaner tasting. The beer I tasted came in a 1 pint can, poured into a Lager Glass. Aroma is pretty strong, moderate citrus hops, very very light malt.  Relatively generous size creamy white head when pouring. Color is a light yellow, and not particularly attractive. I must say that it left pretty decent lacing around my glass. Flavor is short in duration, and a bit watered down in taste, but still pleasant. The hops come throught the most, and I would guess that this would go quite well with food. By itself, like I said, it is a bit boring and watery. Texture is watery again and a bit on the dry side of things. Carbonation is soft and the finish is extremely clean, very nice. Pretty good overall, but not a super-premium lager.

I had to try this and while it is pretty good, I was not really impressed, especially for a prominent German beer.  It’s rather like a German Heineken to me, and is about on par, but actually seems more like a faintly skunky/sulphury, stronger tasting Schlitz.  It’s deep gold, with a small, dense white head that dissipates steadily to a small ring.  The aroma is grain, malt, and a hint of sulphur, being rather like a standard higher end basic maco-lager smell: a pleasant beer smell but not special.  The taste is similar: it’s more flavourful than many basic macro lagers, but along the same lines, and still fairly bland.  The flavour at least lasts and holds up to food fairly well, and it is drinkable, despite a faint unpleasantly sharp sulphur element.  For basic German lager, I’ll stick with something like Spaten, which has a much richer, fuller taste and body.
Flavorful, grainy lager with a quick and clean aftertaste that leaves no residue in the mouth. This clarity of finish makes it one of my favorites.
Pours a clear yellow with a small head and an unremarkable odour. Taste is thin, corny malt with a skunky hop taste. Thin body, good carb, I’d rather have Tsingtau any day.
I know they mentioned this in beerfest, but that doesn’t mean its a top german beer.  Still, good flavor and hoppy aroma.

Vivid yellow, moderately bubbly body with a short white head...looks crisp...metallic ping that is Beck’s...clearly a grain presence...aggressive start and quick finish...most directly a back-of-tongue effervescence...slightly acidic moments but a generally clean flavor, great for partying...a classic for me, not as a session beer but definitely a quality macro that packs a cutting, crisp pilsner taste...a slight step from Pilsner Urquell
A decent beer. Reminds me of Heineken, except better. Bit of a skunky aroma to it though. Good flavor. Finishes dry and crisp. Not bad.

Canette 500ml. De couleur jaune et claire. Nez de grains de malt pâle, léger de houblon herbeux (foin) ainsi que des traces de maïs sucré. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et croustillant ainsi qu’une texture légèrement aqueuse et aux faibles notes huileuses. Goût de grains de malt pâle légèrement croustillant lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi de notes sucrées de maïs puis en finale l’on retrouve un goût légèrement amer de houblon herbeux (foin, notes de gazon mouillé). Post-goût court-moyen aux notes sèches, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux.

Light-taste and wrotten-hop flavour in stylish green bottles. Now that Beck´s reduced the bitternes during the last decade it is getting less bad. People who get used to it do like it a lot. technically seen it is getting bad far too quick. From the tap it is a good Pilsner

Draught, deep yellow colour, a whiff of malty aroma,small head that dissapears quite quickly. some malty sweetness with a touch of white fruit, maybe peach. Quite strong hoppy bitterness that makes it good with food, with a sour and sweet finish  that is quite pleasant and to short, compared to other mass produced lagers.
The only positive thing I can say about this beer is that it is refreshing and easy to drink.  There is very little taste or complexity or anything that makes it interesting.

.5L bottle Germany-  Nice crisp pils; quite typical.  Yet, biggest dissatisfaction is the skunky taste from being in the green.  EVERYTIME, no matter how fresh, always had the skunky finish, yet good for parties.
I like this one for a good old session. No hangover. Certainly not the worst mass available pale lager around, and being German they know slightly more than other large producers. No crap added.

Hoppy smell, really light, dimishing head. Piss gold in color with alot of carbonation. Taste is hoppy, strange aftertaste. Body is light and watery. Not my favorite beer but its better than alot of american macros.
Zero schiuma, zero aroma, sapore anonimo e abbastanza amaro, corpo più pesante del necessario. Non invoglia a berne ancora.

This is one of my favorite beers. I notice a lot of people bashing this beer but, if you notice the higher rated beers on this and other sites they are all stouts. Do not try to compare this lighter beer to a stronger stout. That’s like trying to compare Jimmi Hendrix with Snoop Dogg. This beer has a really bitter/skunky taste to it- which I prefer. Some people find it revolting but, these people tend to drink Miller or Bud Light. But, out of all the beers I have yet to taste this is my favorite. Way better then Hieneken and a Million times better than Stella Artois which, in my opinion isn’t worth the price. However, Stella is marketed as a Malt Liquor? All in all this is a good drinking beer.

Pours out a pale yellow with a finger thick white head that dissapears quickly. Has a slight aroma of hops, saaz I suppose. A note of hay and wheat is also present in the nose of this one. Taste is again a bit of hops and hay thrown together. This is an easy drinker and not half bad if your looking for a simple easy drinking beer. This beats any American macro beer but still nothing that interesting.
Tastes strongly of hay with a light taste of hops.  A smooth finish makes this lager easily drinkable, but certainly not the best Germany has to offer.
almost a raisin taste on the aftertaste ..light flavor palate   aroma is ok .. looks good

This is my workaday beer. When I just want to get some beers in me after work and don’t want to think about this or that style, or experiment, or god forbid go with one of the big 3, I get a six of Becks. They go down so easily. I like the underlying taste, if slightly metallic, and it’s only real distinguishing feature might be a very slight sweetness. It’s nothing to write home about, but it’s a step up from an even more metallic and boring Heineken. I can’t remember if I’ve had it on tap. Surely I must have. Anyway it gets the job done. I call it a notch above average.
Pours a clear light yellow gold with a medium white head.  Aroma of barley, yeast and faint hops.   Taste is watery with a barley flavor.  A good drink with wings or bbq chicken.
Poured golden with a thin, white head that dissipates immediately. Decent aroma of hops, but the brew fails to deliver. Tastes more like carbonated water than beer.

Clean and boring mass-produced lager.  Decent smell of pale malts and a touch of hops.  Flavor slightly bitter, with again a decent hop flavor.  Dry, bitter finish.  Relatively decent, but nothing great.
12 ounce bottle available at around $1.25 Missed the tour at Bremen in 2006
(Bottle) Goood aroma of German hops and some mint. Flavor is a little light but by the end it gets more bitter. Strong hoppy aftertaste.
Bottle.  Very hoppy aroma, just the right carbonation, has a pleasant sweet taste and smooth finish.  Very good for a night out.
Blah.  Has the wonderful green bottle European aroma and taste (skunk beer).

Eurolager from start to finish.  Refreshingly watery, hoppy goodness.  I still hate InBev though!

Got my first bottle of the Made in USA version. Junk. Junk, junk, junk. InBev killed another.

Bottle. Pours a light gold with a small weak head. The taste is really underrated; a light sweet malt, some hops, and a nice citrus addition. I think that this beer gets a bad reputation because 1) its a ’macro’ 2) it doesn’t always keep well. But really this is a good, though fairly simple and smooth brew. I’ll drink it fresh anytime.

Pours transparent golden with medium white head. Aromas of hops, yeast and a little malt. Flavours of straw, hops, and light malt. Dry finish with lighter mouthfeel. Not a complex beer by any means, but refreshing and enjoyable. One of the better macro lagers in my opinion.

330ml bottle.
Pours a clear golden colour. Has a nice sized white head. Average lager smell. Corn, hay, a little malts and a little hops. Flavour is mainly hops with a sweet finish and bitter aftertaste. Nicely balanced but a little too plain and simple for me.

12 oz bottle....Very pale yellow with a bubbly white head (fades quickly)...fresh scent mixed with light sour yeast....way better out of the bottle, versus the glass...nice easy going body...nothing to write home about, but its a good option if your selections are limited to bud and coors etc...

This isn’t too bad. I’ve had it a million times before I rated beers so I was curious to see if I still felt the same way about it. Aroma of light hops. Pour was a light gold with a thin white ring for a head. Taste was of very light malt with just a presence of hops in the aftertaste. Almost pilsener like.
I grew up drinking this beer a lot, but after I started drinking real beers, I can see that its still not bad, but not that good.
thin  and strangely sweet. this beer has weak remnants of quality German brewskill. the beer sells here in the big city mostly due to advertising and reputation. and that reputation is overstated.

On-tap, served in a standard bar pint glass.

Clear pale yellowish golden appearance, tight foamy, bubbly topped white head, the head quickly fades leaving a ringed laced sticking at the top of the glass.

Aromas of sweet grainy malts and musty, moldy hops, traces of chalk, pretty basic for a euro lager.

Smooth medium body, crisp from the carbonation, pleasant feeling in the palate. Thin grainy cracker-like malts and a mild lemony fruitiness. The hops have an old, used up taste, a bland spiciness without much of a presence, doesn’t really cleanse the palate. Finishes semi-dry, thinly sweet and grainy.

Passable, safe choice in any bar with a limited selection, entirely predictable taste, no surprises here, you know exactly what you are getting. This is often on special in my area.
Nice colour and a good flavour.  Has a nice aroma for a lager.  Not bad for a mainstream German beer.
Bottle. Head was disappointing but the beer was good. Pour is golden. Body is light and is fizzy.

Even for German lager, big yawn on this one.  Too bad this represents "German beer" for so many Westerners.  Disappointing head, and fairly inconsistent altogether.  Do the world a favor and pass up this irresponsible use of a ship’s container.
