From bottle : Pours a clear yellow golden color with a small fizzy head.  A faint aroma of yeast.  Taste is chalky, with some yeast, no real bite.  Palate is water.  Not good.

24 oz bottle via corner store. Pours a clear golden blond with a n average head. man this is clear, i can actually READ the small print on my PC screen through the pint glass! I am big for unfiltered beer, but hey, if you are going to filter it, may as well go all the way like this! Nose is musty hops. Taste is musty hops, lager yeast. Body is light, carbonation is moderately high. A decent backyard lawn-mowing beer.
Smells like straw.  Looks like piss.  Tastes like straw and piss might taste, if augmented with fizz and alcohol.  Real nice, by which I mean completely crappy and disgusting.
Clear copper color. This beer has a much more ciderish flavor than your typical lager, bubbly and appley. It exhibited a very mild skunk, but mostly showed its fruitiness above all else.

I don’t know, this one was pretty unpleasant. It had this weird bitterness to it that didn’t seem to be from the hops, it just made it hard to drink. Then the bitterness is followed by alcohol. Pretty lousy beer in my opinion.
Bottle and tap.  My least favorite German bier.  Even more skunk and less flavor than typical mass produced Euro lagers.

Had this beer on 12/20/1997.  Aroma is thin and faint.  Color is a bright gold with good carbonation and head.  Body is light and it goes down fizzy and sharp.  Finish is all skunk.  This just isn’t a good beer.
500 ml can. pours yellow with a small white head. classic german hop nose. good hop structure. not complex but a good macro lager.

Pours a decent sized white head. A pale lager colour. Nose is of some hops and vanilla with an element of chalk. Taste is light, with some chalk again. Leaves a dry finish. Better than bud but that is not saying much.
A pretty basic Lager. Kind of a let down for a brew from Germany. Good hop nose. and harty taste.
A decent german lager. A little dry and mild. A decent bite and some character. Watery and cardboard flavors are present but not overwhelmingly so. Drinkable at best.
This was not a good beer at all. Very poorly made with minimal effort in taste and pleasure and more towards a mass produced beer. Not recommended.
0.33 l bottle. Golden color. Fairy good maltiness and herbal hops in the aroma . Malty, dryish and a bit salty flavor. Some bitterbess, fairly carbonated.

Bottle 0.25l. Fine look, golden colored with thick foam. Aroma is very strong, of regular malt for premium lagers, with maybe citrus hops. But that’s only good about the beer. Flavor, in my opinion the most important thing is weak, not light but really weak, watery, you cannot feel too much in it. Hint of bitter cardboard. Also, it has really short finish. Very low average beer, don’t get the pint with this one.

Update:Impaired rating

Bottle. Very slight aroma and an unremarkable appearance. Taste is clean and crisp, with a brief, dry aftertaste. Easy to drink. More lager than pilsner. Price is much too high for the average quality in my opinion.
Rich head with yeasty taste, fruity hints, minimal aftertaste.   This is a moderate beer that could be drunk in any situation, not the best, not the worst.
this brew often comes to America tasting metallic. It is a very watery brew made seemingly for Bud drinkers  in an adventurous mood

Bottle. Not too much difference between it and other Euro lagers. Maybe a little more exotic tasting than some. Smells of hops, flavour an okay balance of sweet and bitter. Nothing to complain about really.
Bottle. A standard Euro lager. PLeasant enough golden colour and white head. Aroma was slightly sweet with a whiff of hops. Flavour was also on the sweet side with a hint of a bitter finish. Bland.
12oz bottle.  Great beer, one of my favorite lagers.  Wonderful to chill on.  Carbonation is very nice.  Sits well in your stomach.

Ein Bier bitte. Nicht ein schlechtes Lager. Deutschland hat ein feines Lager im Kessel produziert. Nizza Karbonisationniveau und ein netter ausgereifter süsser Nachgeschmack. Ausgezeichnet.
One beer please. Not a bad lager. Germany has produced a fine lager in Beck. Nice carbonation level and a nice mellow sweet aftertaste. On tap this beer shows a  honey  flavour.  Excellent.
Bottle. Really not a bad lager. Clean citrus taste with a nice balance of all the elements. Nothing special, but a solid workhorse that ticks all the boxes.
Delicious.  One gets the sense that he/she is actually in the beautiful harbor of Bremen when drinking this beer.  Light taste with small head and a perfect bitter-sweet, euphoric aftertaste.
gold yellow coloured body with a small white head a hoppy aroma ahoppy taste and asweet hoppy finich
Nothing special.  Why spend a lot for this when there are so many good domestic craft brews for as much or less?

skunky. grassy. little in malt flavor. not that bad. never liked it in my youth- now i don’t mind it. good carbonation and crisp. little body. again, i wouldn’t spend big import $$ becasue there are much better
booooooooooooooooooooooooooooooring. Drank it from a game...slight bitterness in the end, but simple boring. Distinct,but boring.
From 33 cL can. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Slight fruity and sweet aroma. Almost citrus fruity flavour with a clear sweetness. Slight dusty note. Mild bitterness in the finish. Solid.

Becks rating 1000!! 16oz can at Wrigleyfield. pours hazy straw, white head. nose is cereal and wet grains. flavor is sorty spicy, musty, wet grains. i actually like this much better from the can. not light struck and better than BMC. crisp, clean, and refreshing.

Bottle, served at a party in Taipei of all places. Pours yellow with a large fluffy white head. Aroma and flavor are both weak malt with a bit of hops, and slightly metallic; pretty typical for a mass-market lager but on the better (and slightly hoppier) side of the spectrum. Neither particularly bad nor good.
Clear golden appearance. Frothy head. Hoppy lager with a citrus finish. Better than the stuff I get in UK.
Golden colour with white head hoppy fresh.German standard pils plain and hoppy o.k beer.

Classic german pilsener, with an above average bitter aftertaste. When drinking, one immediately experiences a nice amount of hop, followed by the bitterness that goes well with this simple, but tasty type of beer.

From the bottle.  Aroma is a sweet/sour, slightly grainy blend forward.  After being open for a while, some light caramel and hop flora is evident.  Appearance is a light clear straw with a medium retention white head.  Flavor is a balanced sweet and lightly bitter, slightly carbonic, with a very slight caramel note.  Not very dry for the style.  Mouthfeel is medium/low bodied with a medium/high carb texture and a clean finish.  Overall, a lot better than I recall, very easy drinking.

One of the best premium lagers I’ve had to date. A little skunk cabbage aroma when I pop the lid but that settles into a cleaner more enjoyable smell after it is poured. Clean fresh taste, no initial bitterness. Well behaved character. Easy to like for a premium lager, it is just as well behaved as a good pale lager.  Lots of manners. Good bubbly and tingly carbonation, it’s welcomed. Has a slight pilsner bitter attribute that constantly builds on the back of the throat. A mild metallic industrial bitterness hangs on the finish for a while. Overall a good decent well made beer.
Bottle... perhaps the Budweiser of German beers. I guess that fact turns me off more than anything. It’s not a terrible beer, but nothing makes this a must drink German beer.
bottle. This one went down too easily. It really didn’t have much taste to it, other than a sight hint of hops. It was only a little more flavorful than the American mass pale lagers.
Crisp, clean, hoppy taste, with a slight maltyness. Nothing too exciting but a good solid beer.

Bottle. Small white and quickly disappearing head. Clear golden body. Weak barley malt flavor. Pretty hoppy but otherwise watery low carbonated barley malt flavor with a short aftertaste. Strange what heavy marketing can do.

I had heard many many great things about Beck’s, so naturally I had to try one.  Unfortunately, I was not able to add any great comments.  This is just an alright beer.  The colour is a nice translucent golden colour, the aroma was neither appealing or repulsive with a slight malty smell.  The flavour was mild with some grassiness.  The mouthfeel was smooth and crisp with just the right amount of carbonation.
Ah, Beck! Makes me laugh when back in highschool this was HIGH CLASS fancy beer. Wow, how the mighty have fallen. Lord this is garbage. wattery, thin, corny. blech.

tra il peggio del peggio, c’è sempre spazio per peggio. Però questa si fatica a berla, sembra acqua sporca in cui abbiano messo a bagno le chiavi di casa. 
Bevuta innumerevoli (sigh) volte, soprattutto ai tempi delle scuole medie/ginnasio. Non ricordo di averla mai comprata in supermercato, per fortuna.
bottle.  mmm I swear this wasn’t always as bad.  Skunky hop like smell.  Better than heinekin still.

330 ml green bottle - Clear yellow in colour with a rapidly diminishing white head. Thin to medium bodied. Low carbonation. Sweet, malty with  grassy and slightly floral hop flavours. Only a light bitterness in the finish. Rather plain.

Came in a 330ml green glass bottle. A pale yellow liquid with a (rapidly dissipating to nothing) white head. Average carbonation. It has a slightly bitter taste. Refreshing to drink. And as watery lagers go it’s not too bad but it is rather bland.
Bottle. A clean beer, not the best but very drinkable. To dry for my palate.

Bottle. Drank in Berliim last winter. Pale color with a thin head, aroma with notes of hops and refreshing nothing else.

Cerveja clara com pouca espuma, aroma com notas de lúpulo e refrescante, nada mais.

Garrafa, 355 ml, em agosto/2008. Coloração dourada, creme denso e persistente. Após, ficou uma fina camada perene. Malte e lúpulo no aroma e no sabor. Há muito pouco amargor. Boa drinkability. Embora harmônica, é leve um pouco além da conta para o estilo.
It is an good alrounder beer. It is goes good with most meals. The taste is slightly bitter but not to much.
Beer 48 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/8/06 in my Hotel in Stuttgart, Free from the Free Minibar post World Cup Germany VS. Portugal.  Kinda crappy, not really good at all.

Bottle 0.33L
Clear yellow body with an average, frothy, white head, mostly diminishing with a fair lacing.
Moderate herbal hoppy aroma with (very) light malty and yeasty notes.
Moderate bitter flavour with a light sweet character.
Light-to-medium body with a dry texture (particularly apparent in the finish); soft carbonation; light metallic feeling in the finish.
Not very satisfactory, but not the worse light lager around.
clean, crisp, watery. nothing of note, certainly none of the ’distinctive full-bodied taste’ that is promised. ho hum.
Looks ok, just like a normal lager/pils. A very mild aroma of hop. Dry clean flavour, sweet aftertaste. A bit watery.
The import version has a malty backbone, with just the right amount of hops - a standard, standby lager.  However, it isnot usually worth the U.S. price - it’s the German €1 club special.
One of my least favourite beers. Very bitter, with a strong aftertaste. Alright when served cold, and in very small doses.

Bleh.  Not my favorite beer by far.  In fact it’s tied with Fosters for my least favorite beer.  Pretty dry.  I find it easier to drink straight whisky than this.  Beware!  Drank it straight from the bottle
Draft.  Smelled kind of like a cech beer.  The flavor was pretty good for a lager, nice fruitiness, refreshing, and good with food.

It had been a long time since I had last tasted this golden beer, which didn’t do anything special for me today. I used to think this was the best thing on tap at Peter Luger’s in NY. Yes, you can smell the hops in the mix as it always has the crisp bitter taste. It’ s definitely a step up on BMC.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a geenish hue to it, small, but mainly staying white head. Hay-like aroma with a scent of hops. Flavour is mild, sweet and malty at first, finishing with a good dose of hops that are mostly peppery. Not the worst example of a mainstream beer.
[Tasted at the german Autobahn with Kraftwerk on the tune.] Autobahnbier, not bad, but only one otherwise I’ll drink Piesporter.
One of my favorite lagers around.  Good taste with a medium body.  Easy drinking!  Much better than Heineken.  More hop character for sure
It was a hot day and this was a cold beer. Drinkable. Nothing outstanding. Very light tasting, some malts, a hint of citrus.

A simple straw pilsner brewed the way the Reinheitsgebot want it to be brewed. That does not mean it so darn good though. Neutral flavour with a weak malty aroma to it. An easy to drink and refreshing world lager. Nothing special what so ever.

Bottle, a pale golden colour, plenty of carbonation with a filmy head. A ’swampy’ malt aroma. Again, ’swampy’ in the mouth, a grainy malt flavour with a hoppy finish. Not much to rate on this - there is certainly better German lagers than this.

Green bottle. Pours an extremely light yellow with a strange greenish hue and a soapy, fast-going white head. The aroma is skunk, corn syrup, and a seriously sweet note. The flavor is lemon peel, sugar, and a faint dryness toward the finish. The aftertaste is a bit starchy. Not as awful as I was expecting, but certainly not very good.

Skunk a doddle doo. Pours a light gold with a small white head. Initial aroma of a skunks piss sack but that mellows out after a while. Aroma turns into a light wheat, grain and citrus. Flavor is pretty crisp. Mild lemon, malts, and corn. A slight bitter finish.

Bottled: Pours a very pale golden with a vanishing white head. Aroma is skunked, with a subtle hint of doughy pale malt. Very thin body. Has a papery, slightly sweet pale malt background. Lots of metallic hints & a salty light bitter finish. Bland and boring. I love how the description has "hoppy" in quotations, seems fitting. The aroma is anything but that. However, at a generic American bar that serves this, as well as Heineken and Budweiser, I would choose this over those.

Rated 2/5/06:  This is a fairly solid european style lager. Pours a light gold into my glass with a frothy head and decent lacing. Good carbonation and an overall pleasant look. The aroma is typical of this style with a touch of bitterness and hoppy accents. Clean mouthfeel that finishes with ease. The flavor is very good, I enjoy these types of lagers much more than their American cousins. Overall a nice average beer that always tastes good to me.
Decent for a macro brew. maintains the earthy, grass taste thats not too unpleasant. mild carbonation. unimpressive yellow tint in apperance. maybe my least favortie german brew.
This lager has the best aroma that i ever smelled in a beer , perhaps the palate its fucking terrrible, taste like its been frozen.and to descrompressed.

I’ve had bottles many times, and just tried a can for the first time; bottles are definitely better.  The aroma is distinctly German, with grassy and earthy hops, and just a touch of yeast and malt.  The appearance is unimpressive, a typical medium gold color with a small, foamy white head.  The taste has a sour start with a mildly bitter finish.  Texture is wet and smooth with a mild fizzyness and medium to low carbonation.  It’s decent for a mass-produced beer and maintains the usual German beer characteristics.
very skunky, carbonated and makes the mouth tingle, not exactly in a good way.  However, I’d rather drink this than Keystone or Miller any day.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a white head. A light aroma of hops with a similar light hoppy flavour. Average body & carbonation. Ok beer when thirsty.

500ml can. Small head that dosent last. A wonderful lively hoppy aroma almost with mint notes. A blond colored body with a bold but impresive taste. Stonger in body then a North American but is on the same drinkable level.
Bottle ( 33 cl) from Systembolaget. Pale golden, medium brief head. Clean and fresh, but weak malt aroma, with some faint herbal hops. medium bodied with decent mouthfeel. Dry with medium bitterness.

24 oz green bottle. Nice slightly bitter lager although it tastes more like Pilsner. Nice malt and hoppy aroma. Slightly bitter taste. Too much carbonation.  Overall not that bad but after having better beers, couldn’t finish this one.
Can.Pale yellow.The aroma is a light corn with very slight hops.Flavor is metallic and somewhat bitter.Not very good.

Bottle, from Duvel tulip, at cellar temp. Best by end of Nov ’07. A bit better color than the typical pale lager, but not good enough for a 2. White head fades away. No lacing. Skunky as the devil when poured, but the funk fades to tolerable levels after sitting a while. Why do people insist on these outdated green bottles? The data is in, folks: green/clear bad; brown good. Get with the program. Anyway...I still couldn’t detect the so-called "fresh hoppy bouquet." After forcing myself to look past the lingering cat-spray aroma, all I get is a mild sort of breadiness, like soda-crackers. Again, here we have a light, thin, pale lager calling itself "full-bodied"...who are they talking to? Flavor is nearly all sweet malt, but there’s a very slight bitterness in the finish. It’s basically on par with Heineken, overall.
A clear, golden brew with a long holding white head. A strong malt flavor was followed by the hops and then more hops. A tad overbalanced by the hops, leaving a bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Footed Lager Glass. Pours a light and beautifully effervescent gold beer with a quickly receding white head. Aroma is faint, but notes of noble hops and dough can be detected. While pretty to look at, the lively carbonation makes tasting notes slightly difficult in the beginning. Given some time, the lager is discernibly bitter noble hops in the front with dough and lemon flavors in the finish before drying out. Very simple and straight-forward German-pilsner.Lively mouthfeel makes for difficult drinking, I find. Okay beer.
nothing special i seem to notice green bottles are not that great always smell like skunk and a odd taste.
Nothing special, inoffensive, unimaginative, fine once cold, fine for BBQs etc
becks is good. i good 24. oz of becks is a wise choice at your local l store.
It’s brewed to appeal to a world wide market and to affend noone, and I’d say they have managed to do that. One of the most boring lagers of the world.
12 oz bottle at the Bull Run Inn. This beer has the skunked aroma. The taste is nothing great. A premium lager?? I would much rather have a HITE or LIONSHEAD...

24 oz bottle . . pours gold with a weak white head . . aroma is skunky and metallic , , taste is watery, bland and bitter . . better then heiniken, but id rather spend my money on something better . . overpriced and crappy . .

I can only imagine how much better this would be if I were to get it in Germany. Obviously skunked from the green bottle, but you can still get a nice breadiness from the malt and a very crisp backbone. I have always liked Becks. There are better, but I feel that you cant go wrong with this one.

(bottle - 12 oz) Pale yellow color with a fizzy white head. Aroma is dry and grassy with some hops and malts. Well-balanced. Flavor is very well-balanced as well. Not great, not terrible, but a very decent lager that you can drink over and over again.
Good. Nothing overly special or bad about it. Slightly bitter as most german beers are, but in a better way than some.
Pours a gentle yellow with little to no head.  Some flavor but little complexity.  Slightly above most mass produced lagers.
pale lager with some good flavor, easy to drink, easy to find, easy to pay for...cant complain.
Pale yellow lager.  Green bottle.  Aroma is translucent.  The slightest hints of grass and hops.  A decent hop bite, crisp, and malty corn sweetness.  Easily drinkable.  Good anytime BBQ beer.

500ml can at home eating pizza. Traditional European yellow lager. White, fast fading foam. Fresh aroma with a fragile hoppy touch. Grassy hops in taste added some malty sweetness. Crispy and watery. Medium carbonated (31.03.2007)
Une bière moyenne. Elle se boit bien mais elle n’a vraiment rien de spécial

(in can, 33 cl.).
Pale yellow color, something thick. Very carbonic, very rapid head and without color. The aroma is hoppy, but not very intensely. The flavor is the bitter typical of the beer Europa’s average, but not so intensely. Beer only regular.
Clear yellow green appearance with a large white head.  Flavor of hops with a bit of corn and rice in the front.  Not a bad beer, easily drinkable; I guess that’s why it’s so popular here in the US.
Pleasant enough, clean tasting German lager. Fresh and dry if not especially exciting. Solid enough beer if can’t find anything I like.
22 oz. Bottle, bought in Bodega.  Not bad.  A lager with a little more than a typical macro brew.

12 oz bottle.  My dad bought a case fresh at price club with a best before date of october 07, so this is at least real fresh, and has been kept away from any light.  Pours a light gold with decent carbonation, and an initial fluffy white head, but it fades eventually to nothing.  Aroma is bready doughy crackery, light on the hops- some spiciness and light earth.  Light flavor, ligth pils malt, some biscuity fresh malts, and lgiht hop bitterness.  This was ok since it was fresh but I have had other bottles that have been lightly skunked.
Skunked and faint hopped nose. Sharp malt and grassy hop flavors. Skunk carries into the taste which is kinda gross. Ah who cares!
Smooth and crisp flavor. Pretty average in terms of malt and hops, with a nice bitter finish. One of the better beers that are readily available in the grocery store.

A golden beer. Canned 500ml. Not very high carbonation. Bland beer. Bready, fairly sweet. Some bitterness. Not a bad lager, just very boring. Some nut-like notes. Fairly decent finish that is rather bitter.
Golden/yellow pour with a small head.  Smells of bitterness.  Taste didn’t do too much for me.  Not a beer that I would make a habit of drinking.  Very over rated in my opinion.

12 oz bottle.  Aroma reminded me of wet weeds and grass.  Not really appealing at all.  Suprised this beer has generally moderate reviews.  The taste was extremely skunky and very offensive.  Reminded me of St. Pauli’s Girl NA.  I will never drink one of these again.

One of my favorite beers. Never afraid to pick up a 12 pack of Becks. Very nice hoppy aroma and appearance. The flavor and mouthfeel leave a little to be desired, but one of the best grocery store beers you can find.
Crisp, Skunky, grassy, yet very distinct.  Not great but interesting...................
Light amber color. Nose is slightly hoppy, with some grassy, wheat, and malt aromas. Pretty average all around. Nice crisp, clean beer with a smooth finish.
not bad stuff, the ones i have drank have all been expired so that may be a factor but they tasted decent

It’s amongst the best beers I say. The taste can be a little bit much bitter for some who are not into these types of beers. Nice price, dazzlingly perfect smell, and of course, charming aroma. Recommended ;)

Poured a light yellow, water color with a white substance that had some semblance of a head (unfortunately, it seemed to be auditioning for Gone in 60 Seconds).  Smelled skunky and grassy.  Not always bad, but not good in this case.  Taste was also grassy and skunky with a slight bite.  Not to enjoyable and as much as I’d like to get on the "drink what’s popular" train, I’m afraid I’ll have to leave this one at the station.
Light golden color with a foamy white head. Nice hoppy smell with a more subtle taste. Nothing special really, very dry aftertaste.
I had this once in Rome and somehow it was much better then it is here in the United States.  Why?

This beer is rather delightful in its taste, whilst seeming overpowering at the smell.  With tastes sometimes even coming close to the rich flavor of Guiness, and a crisp taste that I can easilly relate to Budweiser Select, this is a classic, wonderful beer.
Can, poured a faint gold with some white bubbles that faded quickly, litle grass fragrance,  light pilsner malt, little hop bitterness, faint malt taste, light off flavor I find in European beers.

Bottle - January 2007. Pale straw color with a small to medium white head that rappidly diminishes. Aroma is strong horse piss, and some herbal hops. Tastes bland, watery, some malt and a oxidized (which is fine, since it breaks the swill monotony). Soft bitter aftertaste and a watery MF. 

Green bottled light struck directly from Bremen!!

Can. Pale yellow. Snowy white head, mostly diminishing. Skunky aroma. Rather sweet malt/grain flavors. Less hopbitterness than expected for a German lager. Clean and light palate. Some bitterness in the finish. Not bad, but neutral and a bit boring.

I pour a very light yellow colored beer with absolutely no head into my glass. I am not impressed. I am not amused. I am not anticipating goodness coming my way. I detect a very light beery aroma. I take the first sip. I am pleasantly surprised.

Hey this isn’t bad. A bit of sweet maltiness, followed by some well-rounded hops. No off flavors. No corn. No skunk. No adjunct. No sulpher. This stuff is pretty good. Not quite medium bodied, but still it has some substance. Light, but flavorful and refreshing.

Very drinkable lager. Always available, good pricing, far better than any American lager (and many other US beers), and a better choice over Bavaria, Hollandia or Heineken. A good drink for the lads... Not out of this world, but more than decent.

Easy drinkng lager, great for hot nights.  Needs more malt and hops.

Quite cheap in Aust now, so good value for money

Aroma of light hop, and some sort of vegy/grassy component. Very clean smell. Pale gold color with decent white head. Starts a bit corny sweet, medium mouthfeel, a light bitter finish. The finish is not super dry.

Light pilsner malt aroma is present and it carries over into the taste. Decent malt character with little hop presence to speak of. Its not bad if nothing else is available. Certainly beats most American macro poop.

Can and 5,0% on the can!
Clear yellow colour, with a flat head. Aroma of Hops , malt and some yeast.
Flavor is the same. Smouth thin finish, and thin body. This was almost Water with some yeast and hops, that´s all.
Bottle Kind of a typical premium lager. Nothing special, but nothing bad. I guess same level as a Heineken, maybe a bit better.

Not really much to say about Beck’s. I agree with a previous posting that compared Becks to Heineken. I never thought of it like that before, but now that the comparison was made I would say that is very true. The color is crap, it doesn’t come close to a golden brown. The taste has an unpleasant bitterness to it. A very thin and watery taste. Lacking body and thickness.

Here in Sacramento, we have a furniture place by the name of Becks.  It sells furniture that is not quite up to the quality or standard of a La-Z-Boy or Drexel Heritage.  To me,  that is what drinking a Becks is like.  Beer that is not quite up to the standards of other beers that actually have a taste.  CRAP!  Somewhat skunky, I actually found it to be very similar to that of a Heineken. Mouthfeel is scarily thin, taste is disappointingly nasty, and overall just a nasty experience.  Becks is probably good for a 21 y/o looking to get drunk off a nothing tasting beer, but for someone with a discriminating palate just another beer in a long line of drain pours.  Thanx, Becks.  Won’t be shopping there, won’t be drinking there either.

As usual, holiday parties don’t have much to offer (& people often take offense to those who bring their own) so I’m stuck with this one.  I hadn’t had the original becks in quite awhile and I have to say this one isn’t too bad.  Typical macro-lager look, with a slightly maltier taste & aroma.  Finishes OK.
Light gold colour, very distinctive taste, an enjoyable beer for such a mass marketed beer.  I find the draft better tasting.

German and European Brewery’s run into a problem with the ’traditional green’ bottle.  It becomes skunked! way too fast.  Anyway, this one is best enjoyed from a keg... similar to Bavaria, Hollandia, and Jever... for those who didn’t get skunked bottles.  Very drinkable and will have you fast after 12,15,18,21,24, etc.... (and, yes, only in 3’s)

I cant possibly immagine a worse tasting liquid.  Smells and tastes similar to an unwashed skunks a$$.  With a slight taste of water or possibly raw sewage!?  How this company sold enough of this beer to make a commercial to play it up as one of the greatest things to come out of germany since ...... well nothing good has really come from germany........ Heinekin beats this by far .... overall I would prefer a steel reserve over this anyday!

I had Becks on draft and in the bottle/can, and the draft aroma is much more complete and grows on you.   Smooth tasting, just a touch of bitterness.  Compared to other mass brewed beers its one of the better ones.
Bottle cold lager glass. Plenty of skunk aroma, very watery taste, lots of carbonation. Not very good at all.

Light gold color, with an unimpressive white head (didn’t last long enough). Yeasty, skunky aroma. Pretty good balance of both malts and hops, but there was an overriding "plastic" flavor that ruined the whole experience for me. The freshness date on the bottle indicates it should be good for almost 8 more months, so I’m wondering if my bottle was mishandled at some point. Or, if this is the way Beck’s is supposed to taste, then I feel sorry for all of you that gave it a much higher score.

Another premium beer (according to my dad’s standards) in the fridge over Thanksgiving. It’s great because I do not have to pay to rate this. Pours pale golden with a fizzy white head, soda like carbonation. Very faint hop and skunky aroma. Flavor of your typical european macro lager. Light, sweet, pilsneresque maltiness with a small amount of hops to balance it out. Better the than american macro lagers. This reminds me of heineken, and also slightly better.

From the bottle it pours a golden color with small, thin white head. Light hop aroma and a mild skunkiness. Sweet malty flavor lightly balanced with hops, with a crisp finish. Good German lager, reminds me of days spent drinking many beers in the hot sun.
Very light and tastes like the hops went bad but they used them anyway.  Fizzy head, lots of carbonation.  Aroma of slight hops and another unidentifiable skunky smell.

While certainly a step or two above American Budwiser, It’s still a pretty nasty beer. Too light, too hoppy, no real taste. If you want to say you drink German beer without straying beyond your every day pedestrian lager, then choose Becks. If you want a good beer, go elsewhere
Not a bad beer if you’re looking for something with a lighter taste along the lines of Heineken
Bottle.  Yellow pour, white head that faded after 2nd or 3rd sip.  Depending on how you pour, slightly skunky aroma.  Taste is crisp and clean, though not too strong.
Pours clear yellow, vanishing white head. Light aroma of hops/corn/alcohol. Utterly lifeless in the mouth, slightly salty, metallic finish. Poor.

Good old Becks!  Always a safe option by the bottle in a pub that serves shit beers on tap!  It’s a typical German really: a bit boring; no sense of humour, but very efficient.  Pale amber, a touch of hope on the palate - not too bad!

Pours golden amber, no head, no distintive aroma, tastes like a cheap bear... not up to par with some of the other german lagers. However, while this is not a great beer and just about average... it pwns bud, miller, et. al.
Pale yellow product with bright white head.  Aroma is supergrassy, and a tad sweet. Taste is weak, and I cannot emphasize this point enough.  Carbonation is inadequate.
I would say one of the crispest german pilseneres I’ve tried. You can get it from basically everywhere. Not my number one choice, too dry and crispy hoppy.
Bottle. I think this beer ranks up there with heniken. Flavor is a bit too...how do you say...underpar and missing something. Too bitter of a taste than what I would prefer for the style.
Way underrated beer in my opinion. I really like the freshness and the flavor. It’s nothing special, just good and decent I think.
Bottle. Pretty inoffensive. Sweet and carbonated. There are worse pale lagers out there, not that this is by any means good though..
Not bad overall, but not the best out of Deutschland! Rich flavour, a little too dry.

Extremely standard beer. I always wondered why they always export the most mediocre beers of one nation to every other nation (well typically, Czech Republic is one counter-example). Colour is an ok golden colour. Not too hoppy, but kind of refreshing to drink. Goes down pretty easy overall. It is drinkable, but not worth looking for (as if you would need to). If a restaurant has this and Budweiser, I think that the choice is pretty clear.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small head. Aroma is malty and hoppys as well as flavour.
On tap not a bad beer just like alot of european beers lack oomph.But very nice and ill drink it again.

Apperance was a light yellow, sparkling brew with a white creamy head.  Light maltiness of straw and bread.  Hints of dough.  Saaz Hops, and slight skunk.  For some reason I got an aftertaste of cherries.  Bittersweet, and salty flavor.  Light to meduim body. Dry watery texture.  This was a good beer.  A lot like Heineken, Amstel, or Grolsch.

Bottle. Pale yellow color with a decent head. A bit dry tasting. When I think of lagers I think of Germany. However, this is not their best effort. Still better than the so-called premium American mass-produce lagers.
Very enjoyable beer, precision German engineering resulting in a great achievement for all humanity, well done to everyone at Becks ! God bless you all.
Good beer, though not outrageous. Little wishy-washy but tasty if light aromas preferred... Great appearance!
Pours a blonde yellow with some hoppy notes, Bitter hoppy taste with a fairly dry finish. Alright, far from anything special though.

Not bad, not bad.  I would like it if this were slightly darker in color.  It’s great to drink on Oktoberfest or any month of the year.  

It’s tasty and pleasing to the palate.
An excellent lager, tough the taste might be too bitter for some.  It is very hoppy, though not as much as an IPA, and has a great golden color to it.

Aroma of corn, malted barley, hops and slightly skunky.  Pours out a clean golden yellow with hardly any head that quickly dissipates.  Flavor is what keeps me coming back to this one...  Very pronounced hops, malted barley for a bitter, well balanced and simple taste.  Slightly carbonated, thick, clean and refreshing.
Blonde, with some hop notes in the nose. It seems to me that the flavors are not very good balanced. High bitterness to be a macrobrew
16oz can-A light golden with a decent white head and an aroma of light malt but pretty much nothing there. Taste of hops with a dry finish. Not bad but I remember in a bottle it was quite skunky.

So why do I even bother with lagers anymore? Especially macrobrews? A mildly malty nose with some citrus notes, and that’s about what you get in the flavor. Malt over citrus, with a bit of hops in the finish. Overall, though, the dominant "flavor," if you want to call it that, is water. This isn’t really a terrible beer--you have to go Mexican of American macrobrew for that--but it’s a damnably underwhelming one.
Pours clear watery looking. Bland flavor with mild skunky aroma. This in every way.
Strawlike color with a frothy short lasting white head. The aroma is hoplike but somewhat off. Bitter beer with some light spicey notes on the finish.
More hops than many lagers. Mouth feel a bit thin. Gold color. A definite step up from BMC.
On draught in Frankfurt - straw colour with a creamy white head. Flavour of citrus and hops, dry with a clean finish.
Has that common hoppy taste of most German beers. An okay "green" beer. I usually pick it if I don’t have money for another kind.
Becks has a medium head, nice light aroma, very drinkable and refreshing taste, aftertaste is something forgetable. For refreshment is ok.
Pretty all right stuff here. Yellow with foamy head. Light hoppy aroma. A bit fizzy. Light bodied Not a great beer but definitely not bad. A little hoppy, bitter, tad of sweetness.

This beer is pleasant and refreshing although it does leave a strong aftertaste once swallowed. Has a decent head with a light hoppy flavour. Cant really say its a bad beer, althought i wouldnt go out of my way to drink it.
Can. First ever rating. Not bad, fairly thirst quenching. Clean tasting. Not much else though. Boring

24 oz bottle.  Pours one of the most extremly pale lagers I’ve seen in awhile.  White substantial head with large bubbles that fade, leaving trace lacing. The smell is both skunky and sweet  and malty.  Almost sour as well.  The taste is very weak and just barely malty or skunky, in stark contrast to the aroma.  Somewhat boring after having so many wholesome and complex beers.  Very bubbly and thin and slightly astringent to the palate.

From 12oz Bottle.  Pour of light golden straw, topped with a bubbly layer of white head.  Light aroma of grassy hops and a touch of sweet malt.  Light bodied, overly carbonated mouthfeel.  A touch of skunkiness in there, but not bad relative to others I’ve had.  Mostly just thin flavors of grain and grassy hops with a pleasantly dry finish.
120z Bottle.Pours light golden with a light fizzy head.Aromas of malt and hops.A crisp ,bitter and not very hoppy beer.Served ice cold you can drink this but I think I won’t given a choice.
This is ok but not great.  I prefer ales to lagers, so maybe I dont appreciate this. But judging by other ratings, I must have got it right.
tastes a lot better when you add diet pepsi... no kidding.... yellowish color with no head
Can 0,5l. Yellowish colour. A creamy but completely disappearing head. A metallic hoppy aroma. Soft mouthfeel. A lasting bitter aftertaste with some swetness. A watery impression.
Nose was grainy; flavor grainy malts with only the tiniest hop presence; gold with no head.

Distictive full-bodied taste, fresh "hoppy" bouquet, golden color and full rich head. slightly fruity but firm crispness ans dry, clean finish. Super watery though I beeter go with something stronger than this.
Tastes smooth and crisp with a skunky finish. However, the aftertaste is minor and somewhat enjoyable.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma of malts - little sweetness. Thin texture. Slight hoppy finish.
A nasty weak lager with skunky flavor.  Not enjoyable, try something else.  Skunky with a little bit of hops.
Just like Heine, St. Pauli, and Pils-Urquell...somewhere in between Heneken and P-U.
Bottle. Like most macro beers, is best drank  cold so the flavors are hidden.  Light yellow, and no head.  Very watery. What nose there is is hops.  Dry with a decent finish.
this is probably the most widely seen german beer that i know of. Its very average, nothing bad/special about it  really, has a very light appearance, little on the watery side.
[From Aug 15, 2006] Bottle in Vodice, Croatia. Solid lager. Always liked this one. Not too much head, bit of a finish. Okay for a mass market beer.

Enticing waft of ganja-like hops from several feet away. Clean and crisp with a clipped bitter hop finish. Admirable. 

UPDATE Incredibly clean popcorn and vanilla from malt; digested grass/shrubby hop+honey aroma, green bottle, finish sagging with glued-together bits of pastry, yet still hopped and lean. Definite Chinese vegetable note- water chestnut. Had a bottle back-to-back with Cantillon Vigneronne and Mikkeller Amarillo, and enjoyed it. My macro swill of choice, and I refuse to downrate it.
A crisp beer that can act as your goto when your at your in a macro situation...

Same ol same old thing. Tipical macro beer almost undistinguishable from the rest, it does have a tad more hoppyness and a bit less skunkyness than the others. If i HAVE to choose a comercial macro id probably go for this one. But give it to me ice cold.

Bottle.  Cold.  Not much else really to be said about this beer.  Clear, golden color.  Some bit of head.  Aroma is slightly skuny, with a little malt and hops.  Flavor is basically the same.  Relatively crisp, somewhat refreshing sitting pool-side in 90 degree weather.

citrus, clear, aminimal head, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, light body, lively.  This beer has a nice crisp taste that has a citrusy finish.  A remarkingly refreshing brew.  Perfect for a 1 beer night and can double for a good drinking time.
Nice hoppy aroma, a little thin, but pours OK. Not being a big fan of most German beers (blasphemy, I know) I would say this is one of my favourites.
My standard beer. It is very tasty and you can drink it between your college class ;)
Good enough. Probably be better if they switched to brown bottles, but hey.

This is solid lager.  A bit skunky, but it is balanced by a nice sweetness and a solid finish.  Although it is pricey for a lager, it is a good deal when it goes on sale.   I’m also a sucker for a beer with an expiration date ... especially an import.
Golden with white head. Aroma of malts - little sweetness. Thin texture. Slight hoppy finish. Pleasant - though an average lager!

(12 oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA; Best Before End: Jan, 2007) Here’s the good thing about this bottle of Beck’s: it doesn’t taste or smell skunky.  It’s lightly sweet, a bit grainy, a hint of corn, and displaying that typical gentle hoppiness of the mass-produced European lagers.  Light in body, but not really what I’d consider watery, but then again, I’m comparing this to Beck’s Light, which is the epitome of watery.  Aromas of sweet corn and grain, but very little hops, if any at all.  Just about the same straw color as Beck’s Light, but with less clarity.  Small, white head dissolves very quickly leaving no lacing on the glass.  I’ve definitely had worse European lagers as this one is relatively harmless an inoffensive.  Just not something I can imagine ever buying.
nice smooth and inoffensive. probably my favorite warm weather/afternoon beer. it’s crisp and light. as a strange aside, an old scuzzy becks starts to taste like a heineken.
12 oz bottle served cold. Golden color with minimal white foamy head.  Aroma is of malt with a hint of citrus and hops.  Smooth.  Medium body.  Moderate aftertaste of slight bitterness.
Can. Golden colour with  a white head. Fruity malt aroma. Flavour is fruity malt.

Nice bitterness to becks, easy drinking, there’s a big difference to me in the becks we get in the US and in Germany, bottles in Germany have a much better flavor, we’re getting skunked bottles in the us. My rating is for fresh 1/2 litre bottle in Germany.
light hop aroma.pale, clear, sparkling, aminimal head, white foam, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,

bottle 24 oz. fizzy yellow with nice frothy rather dense white head that lasted fairly well. the aroma & taste is of somewhat stale light malt with a touch of rubber hose and the skunky in the bottle euro hops. A bit less sweet than the Heiniken which I thought was slightly better. It actually got better as it lost it’s chill, but not by much.

pours the stock standard lager yellow. short lasting head.  the smell is the best part, sweet fresh malts... mmmmm. tastes a little bitter, but really no strong flavours - then again, a beer like this is only made for ’drinking’ not ’tasting’.. and that works - it does go down easy

had it today at noon
head white,but not very big
pale yellow color
rather carbonated
smells hoppy,and a bit malty-sweetish, but hoppyier than other beers of that style
tasts bitter-sweetish,hoppy, malty
aftertaste hoppy bitterness
less sweetish than other lagers,refreshingly hoppy
Can brought to Sweden from Germany by a friend of mine. Clear light yellow color, white head. Fresh malty scent. MAlty a bit sour taste. Low bitterness.

500 mL can:  Is there a worse lager out there? Why is this so widely available? Thin, grainy, bitter, skunky (almost sour) with no body to speak of.  Drink any premium to average lager, then take a sip of this crap & enough is said.  I’m not sure what anybody sees in this lager, it has nothing going for it that a lager should!
A very average to below average beer from Germany. Appearance was golden and the body average, but there was a skunky/grassy underlying aftertaste that didn’t impress me.
Bottle. Pours golden with a decent white head. Aroma of grassy hops, sweet malts, and grain. Flavor is bitter, grainy, but better than most american macro brews. Thin body, but drinkable.

Bottle
Aroma:Slightly skunky, alcohol, not much in the way of hops or malt
Appearance:Pale yellow straw in color with carbonation of large white bubbles.
Flavor:Somewhat bitter alcohol taste
Palate:Fairly mild
Overall:Not terrible for your average beer but better than many commons.
Reminds me of Heineken with that skunky taste, but I would pick this over Heineken. Not good but not terrible.

On tap at Berlin-Tegel Flughafen. Clear light golden colour with almost no head. Slightly malty aroma. Flavours starting malty sweet, but develops some spicy hoppiness towards the finish. Fizzy, rather light body.

Good God!! I can’t believe I’ve not rated Becks. Not that I drink it regularly you understand, OH NO! on the contrary, it’s just that it’s available everywhere. Any how, it’s rubbish..no change there then! Can’t say I’ve ever liked it! Oh well! I must stop buying beers I know are crap just to get a rating. I must stop buying beers I know are crap just to get a rating. I must stop buying....(repeat 100 times)

Balanced amount of hops with a sweet maltiness.  Flavor is mild to medium in intensity, very suitable to the intended market for this beer.  Somewhat of a crisp and refreshing aftertaste is what makes this beer better than a Heineken or Amstel.

Interesting when you come across a mainstream beer like this and you realize you’ve drank 666 beers without rating it yet. Well, here goes. Picked up this 330ml can at Lider Mart in Arica, Chile.  Pours a very pale yellow and head is thick with very fine white bubbles...extraordinary foam here. Aroma reminds me of pizza, some cheese and dough, yeast, banaids. A little weak, but what I expected. Nice flavor, a little spicy from the german hops and has a  fresh, sweet taste following. Definitely some esters working here. Aftertaste is drying hops. Decenr brew, and I enjoy it more than Heiniken.

Tried it straight from the bottle. It had a bitter, satisfying aftertaste and it wasn’t as light and thin as I expected, plus it wasn’t too expensive. Still, I’m not sold on it, but it’s better than, say, a Warsteiner, which I feel is  as generic as toilet paper. A pretty decent lager, overall.

1 pint green can with the Beck’s red, white and black label.   Pour into a pint glass this was a crystal clear straw color.  It is highly carbonated and puts up about a ½ inch head that last a bit.  It has a very earthy aroma with a taste to match.  Slightly sweet and has a pleasant aftertaste.  Very refreshing brew that I could drink a lot of.
In general, rich man’s Bud Light.  Slight aroma of hops.  A little bitter. Presentable look.  Not a bad beer.
Tap.  Above average macro beer.  Pours golden with slight head.  Barely noticable hops taste.

Right out of the bottle. Not a Becks fan but had it once in Gothenburg on a club. Allthough a Premium Lager I can’t say I find it much different from, say Heineken (aka the most boring beer in the world). Some hops in the aroma and flavor, not much sweetness, neither fresh nor heavy. Perhaps a bit lemony. Overall grade: Naaaah...

Crisp, refreshing, but not many flavors going on.  Smell is sugar coated skunk road kill.  Watery with skunky hops.  I know a Bulgarian that likes this stuff, but I don’t trust Bulgarians cuz they are often the bad guy on MacGyver.  nuff said.

Gee, I dunno... I have always liked Becks.  Their dark and regular have always been a favorite, even after experiencing so much more these days.  I just can’t call myself a hypocrite and turn my back on it now.  I think it’s a fine fine brew.  It’s a good beer to have in stock in the fridge for your "anytime/anyplace" beer (if you have such a thing!).
A bit smoother and less skunky than Heineken and Grolsch, which it has a lot in common with, but it’s still not my favorte kind of beer.  It’s not bad when you’re thirsty, though.

Smells a bit sour.  Yellow translucent body with little head to speak of out of the bottle.  Not sure what I think of it.  Tastes a bit bitter at first but relatively well-balanced finish.  I’m not much of a lager guy anyway..  Definitely not even close to my favorite, but not something I wouldn’t get again I guess.

(0.33 L Bottle) Slight hoppy aroma and  light taste. All in all, very easy to drink. Golden color with a small, yet persistant head. My German friend called it ’the Bud Light of Germany’ (tastes much better though).

So I bought this because I needed a bottle for my homebrew.  I used to drink this beer before my Awakening.  Now I just need the bottle (24oz).  I figured its a shame to let any beer go to waste so I will taste this, rate this, and then flush the rest down.  The smell is pungent, that nasty green bottle beer smell, you know the type.  The color is just a shade darker than American piss beer.  The taste not as bad as I remembered.  Less disgusting than the other green beers.  Almost no palate  or aftertaste to speak of.  It is refreshing however and less off-putting than expected.  Oh, here is the funniest part, I can’t even cap the bottle.  WHAT A WASTE!!!
bottle:  poors sparklilng golden color with moderate head.  slight malty/ hoppy aroma with light body and very light taste

I dunno why I didn’t already have a rating for this. I haven’t had this beer in months, but I managed to find my tasting notes. The fact that I forgot this is not surprising. It is a very forgetable beer.
Can. Pale, clear, sparkling golden beer with a nice, white lasting head. Grassy and hoppy aroma. The flavor is hoppy, malty and slightly grassy. Long bitter finish, but a little too thin. (060326)
Pour is clear yellow with a nice white head...smell is a little grassy and hoppy at first...then sort of corny...taste is the same...

From a bottle.  Decent aroma with strong malts, and a bitter finish. I like this beer, and it seems to be very under-rated.  You should rate to style, and this is fairly good.  Much better than the crap we get here in Panama on a regular basis.

Bottle. No offensive scent. Malty, had adequate carbonation, and had an astringent, yet refreshing finish. Beck’s a good lager, but since it is from Germany, there are surely better German beers out there.

Hoppy resonance to the nose... Pours golden straw into the glass with fizzy head.  Blend of malt to hop proportions nicely.  I actually pick up some porter/stout coffee notes midway through the palate.  Does have a clean-ish finish, and is better than others in its "class", but remember, what are most others in its "class"?  Expensive beers in the grocery store?  I’ve found that the grocery store is quite rarely the place to find decent brews.... at least in my neck of the woods.

Bottle. Very slight aroma and an unremarkable appearance. Taste is clean and crisp, with a brief, dry aftertaste. Easy to drink. More lager than pilsner. Price is much too high for the average quality in my opinion.
Bottle  Pours a clear yellow with a white fizzy head.  Aroma is of decnt hops.  Has a high carbonation and a crisp plain lager taste.  Not a bad beer.  It is a little over priced though.
this brew reminds me of tasting the metal bottom part of a yellow hot wheels car.

1. On Tap at the Beer House, Manchester 17/03/2002
Straw golden coloured crisp on the palate and very hoppy.
2. Bottle at the Laughing Kookaburra, Northwich 30/08/2002
Golden coloured and crisp on the palate with a malt and hop finish.
3. On Tap at the Kulturbrauerei, Berlin 11/07/2004
Golden coloured and hoppy with some sour fruit aroma. Slightly dry crisp malt finish.
4. Bottle at the Kulturbrauerei, Berlin 11/07/2004
Golden coloured crisp on the palate and hoppy. Slightly dry malt finish.
clear yellow with a white fizzy head.  Has a bit of a malty smell with a slight fruity flavor.  This is not a bad beer, but for the price i probably wouldnt put this into my regular rotation.
Pale yellow color, very fizzy. Has the typical green bottle skunk aroma. Fortunalty does not taste skunky. Very mellow constrained flavor with sour after-taste. Good hot summer day beer.
Pours a pale clear yellow. Malty and slightly grassy (hops). Dry finish. Boring.
"the most popular german beer in the world" Ide rather have "the most popular world beer in germany".  still its better than heiny, but i wouldnt really ever buy it.

A very taste, clean lager with a little bit of a bite.  Pours pale yellow with minimal white head, high carbonation.  A very basic lager, but very crisp, and the palate score makes this otherwise average brew much more.

24 oz. bottle. Pours a crystal clear yellow gold with a thin white head that completely vaporized after two sips and left no lace.  Aroma of husky malt grain, lager yeast and a bit of Saaz.  The flavor is again husky malt grain, lager yeast and a bit of spicy Saaz hops.  The finish is mildly bitter and does not linger at all.

Bottle.  Pours to a pale golden body with a white head.  The aroma is grass hops and light grains.  The flavor is grass hops, light grains.  Decent brew...  The palate is lightly dry and easy to drink.

Another beer ruined by Inbev.Still
beats the clydesdaleurine.Tastes
like old becks mixed with 50%H20.
Sour and Bitter,  reminds me of some artificial aroma, that resembles the scent of hemp.

Pale yellow (some may say "golden") wiht light streams of carbonation and a white, filmy head. Aromas of skunk, grass, iron and minerals. Flavor reminds me of a popular green-bottled beer from the Netherlands. Sharp yeasts move to quick, herbal bitters with a finish like a vise on my brain. Any beer that has an adverse physiological effect on me is an instant drain pour.



6-pack from Cub Foods, Tinley Park, IL 60477

Once touted as "Germany’s Best Selling Beer", Becks has a long history. As with most beers this one tastes far different in America than it does in Germany. I suppose the shipping of beer products leaves something to be desired now-a-days.  It pours with a bit more body than Corona, but not much. It has a thin head. Tastes a bit of fruit but then that ’skunk’ taste sneaks in. It does finish a bit dry.  If one can obtain it fresh it is wonderful, otherwise too expensive to waste money on.

710 ml Bottle, 5% a/v
Appearance is pretty standard fare, gold color with a dense white head. Smells skunky and bitter. Fruity and hoppy on the tongue. Very tight finish with a clean aftertaste.
pas mauvaise comme biere. belle robe, bon petit gout relevé. bonne petite biere importée d’allemagne mais reste pas moins que l’on peut trouvé mieux

This beer pours a light yellow color with a small white head. Smells very sour and bitter like the beer has gone bad. The taste is not as bitter or bad as the smell.  Kinda dry with hoppy flavor and fairly drinkable.  Again, this beer is way better than the bmc’s but the is so much better out there!  Cheers!
Another beer that’s difficult to come by unskunked. Sour, soapy flavor usually is joined by a skunky flavor and aroma...why do they continue to green bottle this stuff?
Houleux, le gout recherché n’en est pas moins mystérieux.  L’origine est trompeuse et peu facilement être onéreuse
Smell is slightly skunky, taste is okay but the finish is not very good, sour and not good tasting.  Would not buy.  Better than mass produced American Beer but that’s about it
What is it with these German macro beers in green bottles?  There is nothing premium about this lager, other than the price.  Think of it as disappointment in a bottle.
Ça goûte comme un peu la Bud et comme je n’aime pas la Bud, deviner comment je l’aime? De plus à ce prix là, mieux boire moin cher au même goût.
easily accessible German beer, on the hoppy side, with a light body and golden in colour.  very drinkable, not very bitter

I used to like this beer - what do I know?  After sampling some of the microbrews, Becks is no longer even close.  Preserved properly it’s OK, but some of these bottles must have come over in the bilge of the ship and I still smell like a skunk when I belch the next day. I love  hops but Becks stinks.

Jan. 8, 2006; 12 oz. botte.



Not bad at all for what it is:  a mass-produced lager with delusions of grandeur.  The light-body, low alcohol (4.8% ABV) and slightly-bitter but otherwise non-descript & inoffensive  taste make this a perfect "lawn-mower" beer.
Pours crystal clear gold from the bottle.  Hoppy aroma indeed.  Refreshing flavor and finish.  Not quite as German as it might be, but not bad.

Clear and brilliant golden lager with a white, small and very fast dissapearing head. Aroma of grains and some grass, hoppy. Sweet start, bittersweet finish. Typical lively carbonation. Not a very special lager.

Poured from a bottle.  Medium head which dissipated.  Smell of hops only.  Taste of hops and maybe some wheat (but I have been drinking so I can’t give an accurate taste).  Slightly more bitter than the average American beer.  This is probably a poor German, but I am not sure.  I prefer to try the dark beers and ales.  Despite what I just said, I would buy this for a party or outdoor event as it is very refreshing....definitely a summer brew.
Pours a golden yellow.  Strong aroma of hops muddled with some malt.  Crisp taste with a strong hop flavor.  Weaker body that what you’d expect.
Pours a nice light golden yellow.  Aromas of hops, grass, and maybe malt.  Taste is crisp with a nice mellow hop flavor.
Bottle.  Smells bad.  It might have been a bad bottle.  A very clean golden pour with a lot of white head.  Watery taste and a slight hoppy finish.  There are much better German beers

bottle - pale, a bit fizzy, mild aroma.  There’s really nothing distinctive about this beer.  It’s a typical Euro hopped brew, which is better than the average American pale lager and an okay session beer, but nothing to get excited about.  Along the same lines I prefer a Heineken or a Grolsch though.
A good german beer, very drinkable. No outstanding qualities in any one area, but the beer as a whole is pretty good.  I found it to be much better than Lowenbrau and other german beers.

Great beer, when you drink it outside of South Africa or Namibia. The recycled water of Windhoek in Namibia where it get’s brewed under licence is giving it a skunky smell when you open the bottle. The beer in Germany is probably the best tasting mass-produced beer I’ve ever tasted.
Crisp and refreshing. Nice white head, smooth taste. Pretty good for mass produced

Bright yellow color, with a rocky white head, a skunky aroma came out right away from the green bottle, than the floral hops, pale malt came after in second, with a citrusy note in the nose, follows through on a light-bodied crisp pale malt palate, with in a dry bittering hops and grassy finish.

Re-rate, after 1600 other ratings: Green-glassed bottle.  Slightly skunked grainy nose.  Pale yellow body with a large soapy white head.  Taste is near-cloyingly sweet with the senses reminded of over-splashed cologne and greasy nights at sweaty, metallic clubs.  Touch of grain and alcoholic fumes, but nothing strong.  Light body and just a notch above watery.  One of the sweeter macros, but not particularly adjuncty, and is chuggable candy, which suits its target audience well.  Also relatively clean - I dare say spritely.  Drinkable, not too offensive.

bottle for bodega, not tood good or bad
tolerable macro lager. very light in flava and body better with its german friend Jager
pours light with a euro smell.  tastes slightly grassy but not much flavor.  not my thing.
There are very few beers I find disgusting... but this one is completely undrinkable. Astringent, acrid, rank, however you want to describe it, this stuff is awful.

I cannot stand this beer. Sure it’s easy to shrug off the acrid taste with the fact that they brew about 90 trilion bottles of this swill; but I believe it’s far more accurate to say that becks simply doesn’t give a damn that their beer tastes AWFUL. I say this because in the 12 years I’ve tried this beer off and on, it has never once failed to remind me why I stopped drinking it.

500 ml can. Very light yellow colour withe a small white head which quickly disappears. The flavor and aroma is not unpleasant however the beer is too watered down. Not a bad beer if you and your buddies are planning to spend the night drinking.

Sampled several times, both tap and bottled.  Aroma and taste similar, both bland, yet flavorful for a mass lager.  Somewhat metallic taste, like biting on an electrical cord, copper.  Don’t like it too much, but better than a few others out there.

I may have just been unlucky, but I got a skunky bottle of this. The smell and flavor were both skunky. THe appearance was too light I thought, and the hops left a coppery taste on my tongue. Not terrible, but not good.

Tapped from one of those big, self-tapping cans (What are those, 64 oz.?).  Amber yellow with a medium frothy head.  Heavy grain and light hops aroma. Taste dominated by the grain and a bit of hops.  Not bad really, just nothing terribly distinct about it.
Very mediocre.  I can stomach Beck’s Dark, but regular Becks is almost as bad a Rolling Rock/Heieneken.  Yech!

(750 ml bottle) Knowing that I started developing a liking for  craft beers about six months ago my brother-in-law offered me this beer. As soon as the beer was poured in a glass my wife and sister-in-law (both never drink beers) said  “ what’s that smell  !!!!!!!”. End of the story.

33 cl bottle. No yeast in bottom. Golden clear colour with a great white head. A lot of hops in the aroma, nice tasteful flavour that ends up bitter and dry, very clean and fresh but overall very common .
A snow white head caps this grainy smelling lager. The taste lives up to the smell with plenty of grain and corn-syrup in a watery body.
Light yellow color with a white head. Grainy aroma and a grainier taste. A little too fizzy and the taste isnt one that i’d drink.
Herber feiner Geschmack aber kein Frischeprodukt wie es ein Bier sein sollte. Seine Haltbarkeit geht bei weitem über ein Jahr hinaus!!

Clear pale gold pour with a thin white head. Aroma of grainy malt with something metallic. Ahh, now the flavor ... eesh the flavor ... it feels very cheap, grainy malt, metallic cheap hops. The body is light and watery with moderate carbonation. Boring, completely without interest.

In Germany this is one of the most popular beers out there.  And if Germans don’t  know beer who does.  Some Germans say that Becks is the best of what germans do best.  I think that I am kind influenced by the Germans, but this is still a good beer to the trained taster.  Definately not the best I have ever tasted, but is far better than anything ever created in masses by the Americans.
A bit skunky, but not a bad beer overall. Goes down easy. Pours a yellowish colour.
why the poor ratings - this is a decent beer, worth drinking and worth the price.  Easy going down and  alittle ’skunky’ but -- hey better than bud

Great everyday beer that has slight bitter qualities that finish very crisp and wanting another, good solid beer that is good at a bbq, or with a good cigar, it could have a little more flavour though...but i’ll take it

I really do not like this beer.  A lot.  There’s really nothing that makes this beer a good thing.  It’s tasteless except for skunk; it smells bad; it tries hard; and it’s goddamned everywhere in milan.
Bottle working on becoming skunked, but we’ll get around that. Pours out a yellow gold very fizzy.  Some grass in the aroma, some skunk, some light hop.  Goes down easy, better then bmc.
Bottle. Clear amber color with small frothy white head that was mostly diminsihing. Average sweet hoppy aroma. Light body with thin texture. Light sweet hoppy flavor with short finish.
Can. Alright easy to drink lager, pale yellow, some bitterness. Not much more than that really.
interchangable with heineken to me, slightly less sweet though. both are great as refreshment.

Heavy skunk aroma.  I opted to drink it straight from the bottle so I wouldn’t have to smell so much skunk drinking it from a glass.  Flavor was pretty good, a little fruity, clean and hoppy.  Medium body and mouthfeel.  Would be good if you could get it fresh and not skunked.
Pours a pale yellow color. Aroma has wheat    and some straw. Flavor is a bland, slightly bitter and there is a slight taste of wheat. Tastes like a typical lager.

An excellent choice when out on the town. I seen a bunch of germans drink these like a water. One guy drank awhole slab in just under an hour. Can have bad after taste though and your breath will stink
Has a light bitter taste, hell of alot better than most commercial beers! Very smooth taste and light smell, you can tell this sixer i got was very fresh! I was very impressed !

Clear straw color, small white head. Light floral hop aroma. Clean tasting, light malt character with faint hop flavor . Clean, refreshing bitter finish. I’ve had Beck’s  in restaurants that either didn’t sell  much, or din’t rotate stock. If it lies around too long, it can turn skunky..
One of my favourite beers, it has flavour, unlike most commercial beers. Nice to have an ice cold bottle on a hot summers day at a bbq, or in a bar. mmmm

As with most of the european premium lagers, Becks has a skunky/grassy hop character that is missing from most North American equivalents. For this reason alone I rate this beer higher than say Molson, Miller, etc as a "standard" macro-brewed pale lager.

my mothers boyfriend wont drink any other beer, he says its the best there is. i had to try one for myself last time i was over for dinner.  much better than any cheap/moderate commercial beer (bud,mgd,pbr etc) but definately not outstanding in many ways. pretty bitter. definately will continue to drink becks while at visiting family (as long as they are handing it out! haha. )

Bottle. Golden colour, unstable white head. The flavour is a little bitter, and it has a subtle malt and hoppiness. Quite well-balanced. Good mouthfeel, has the feel of minerals without the flavour of them.

Bottle, at home.
Yellow with large white head, modtly disappearing, nice lacings. Aroma moderate malty (hay), heavy hoppy (flowers). Flavor light/moderate sweet, moderate/heavy bitter, long duration. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.

12 oz bottle consumed at Key West grill in Myrtle Beach, SC.  Pours golden with a light white head.  Aroma is floral with a bit of grain.  Flavor is floral as well.  Some malts come through before a bitter hop finish.  Crisp and clean on the palate.  Not too bad but nothing I’m going to seek out in the future.

Can.  Light gold in colour with a thin oily looking white head.  Nice stream of bubbles coming from the bottom of the glass.  The aroma was slightly sweet with some light floral hops and perfume.  The flavour was herbal, some floral hop bite, grassy.  Crisp mouthfeel, medium/light body, medium carbonation.  Finishes with a lingering bitterness.  This was actually refreshing.
claer yellow colour, average white haed. Lots of hops in the aroma, taste begins whith those hops, finishing in a dry bitterness.
One of my favorite widely issued beers....a boring look with an interesting smell.  The taste is what I would call crisp and refreshing.  Bitey if you will but not in an unpleasant manner.
Nice Golden color, medium not lasting head, compleet german one, one of the best in thise kind.

Clear, drinkable, it deprives of body, little acid, bitter taste.
Like Many.
NIce beer, it was a little bitter, but the backtaste is great, the colour is a little green, but still being yellow clear.
A step above the BMC stuff, but otherwise a boring slightly bitter beer with some light spicey notes on the finish.
Not that great overall.  Bitter taste.  A slight skunky smell.  Sour taste by the end.

Beck’s has a light strawlike color with a frothy short lasting white head.  The aroma is hoplike but somewhat off.  There is a bitterness to the beer but no malt balance.  The finish is clean and leaves little on the palate.
Bottle and tap. Just an average beer. Not bad, slightly metallic taste and a little skunk on the smell. Overall an alright beer.

This is Great Monster Brewery import beer...

What you expect from good German bier!My only complaint is the bitter finish!
But, is one of my favorites!
Pretty nice smell, medium lasting head, light yellow colour. Rather bitter, slight alcohol traces. Bitter aftertaste. Pretty decent for a mass lager. As one fellow reviewer wrote, good everyday beer.
I have always liked Becks.  One of my favorite summer time beers to put back while lounging around.  Not expensive and not too heavy for my taste.
Definitely not a good beer. What I dislike most is the palatability, its sour on the end. smells skunky. Definitely overhyped. tastes skunky too

Nice easy beer to drink.  Golden colour with a white head that holds up quite well.  Not a has a pleasant grassy hoped smell.
Haven’t had a lot of the good German beers but this one isn’t to bad

275ml bottle, pale gold, dull hop nose, very cardboardy bit of citric dryness on end but dull and boring. 1.3
66cl bottle from Co-op Folkestone and drunk on train on way home and at home with a second bottle, some lemon hop, not horrible, a little metallic, but it’s fine.  Inoffensive pale lager.

I couldn’t believe I hadn’t rate this - glad someone else bought it for me. Heady, yellow in appearance. Certainly bottom of the barrel as German beers go and little premium about it. Too pale and icky.
Better on tap. Not into lagers but this is one of the better mass brewed macro lagers. Crisp and somewhat dry.
This beer is too skunky in the smell and taste.  I can’t get into it.  It is very thin, and has almost no head.  There are much better German Lagers out there.

There are a multitude of German lagers that are better than this one.  However, this is the one that seems to make it into the bars in the US.  Skunky smell and taste.  Golden color with a medium head.
little to no white head that leaves quickly. bitter and burnt aftertastes. hoppy. crisp and smooth on the palate.  good everyday beer.

Becks is one of the easiest imported German beers to get hold of (at least here in Britain). So I always chose it (over what I considered to be poorer/weaker beers like Carling and Fosters. I developed a flavour for it and consequently really like it, its got a lot of flavour and is a great beer to drink when you come in from work!
excellent beer! good taste, a man’s beer not for girly girls! does a good job to get you there, drunk, fast!

Quaffable, watery lager, crisp and dry palate. Disappointing in reality, I drank this as an accompaniment to salted Baltic Sea herrings, fried rootwurst and sauerkraut and it was clearly overpowered by the tasty edible offerings. A good seafood beer I guess.

From my first impression a few weeks ago this stuff was awful.
But I had it a second time and loved it, ok its got a little kick at the end of it like burnt wood.
But its hoppy and very aromatic.

Personally, I think Becks gets a bad rep. I like the aroma of flowers and hops and that metallic light hoppy skunky flavor it has going on. Its well crafted for a commercial beer as much as the MBC BS are but nothing extroadinary. Its better balanced than competitor Heineken with a quarter less skunk. I would say Becks is crisp but a bit unbalanced and flavor-less to make it above average.

The bottle poured a pale yellow liquid with a small fizzy white head that didn’t last long and left no lacing. There was the distinct skunky aroma characteristic of the style but not to my liking. The body is light with lively carbonation and thin, dry texture. The flavor begins complex with some malt but more bitter hops. The bitterness fades in the middle and the finish is crisp, dry and medium in length.

Bottled.
Yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of malts and grain.
Flavour of malts and grain with hoppy notes.

Peculiarly popular over-sweet macro German lager. Looks fine: pale gold, moderate lasting head. However, the aroma has skunky notes, a splash of cat piss, green vegetables and some cardboardy malt. Palate is the best thing about it - smooth, moderately carbonated, with a very rounded mouthfeel. Very quaffable. Flavour is a let-down - it’s all sweet malt and very little bitterness. (Bottle, Wagamamamas, Sydney)

it seems that interbrew is good at mass producing beers just a notch above US macros.  i found this to be drinkable without the usual skunk of the typical import premium or pale lager, probaby because i enjoyed it on tap.
this beer always whooped my ass the next morning. I always liked it, but never knew why. bitter beer, bad aroma too. Still yet i’d buy it again.

Can (500ml) - pours like every other german lager - pale yellow, clear - decent white head.  Thin sweet and mildly malty, banana & filings in the nose, some tobacco.  Jesus, no flavour at all, some wheat bitterness in the finish.  Mouthfeel of bottled water.  Waste of time.  (when a youth, I thought this was cool???)
Average German lager.  Crisp taste, dry finish.  But, this beer packs a serious hangover.  Don’t plan on doing anything the next day after a night of Beck’s.

Pale golden color. You can manhandle a head out of it, but it fades fast. Becks does have a kind of assertive crispness that piggybacks on very mild hops to give it a more beery taste than many similar beers. It’s still pretty pedestrian, but a lot less sweet than many of the crappy beers I have been drinking in a shameful scramble to pad my rating numbers.
Proper stuff aside, this is what i’d pick up over others ( Carling etc ) Above average.
i really like becks.  Its has a kinda unigue lager taste.  i does have a slight skunky element but its taste is pretty good.  Also very smooth and drinkable.  for a mass produced beer its good
A little above average skunky green bottle beer.  What else can I say about this...Ummmm.  It’s got alcohol in it.  Pale yellow color and clear.  Drinkable though won’t go out of my way to get it.
Hate it in a bottle but quite enjoy it on draught so i will ate it on a draught scale

I liken this beer to that skanky girl all your friends are bangin’ and everyone is raving about her because she’s "better than the other girls." So after fighting your urges for what feels like forever you give in, pick her up, put her to your mouth and... YUCK, just as nasty as all those other easy to get girls. Your friends can’t tell the difference though, so you just sit there and laugh at them for a distance, never admitting to yourself that you are jealous they can find enjoyment in such low-grade trash. Becks: a higher grade of crap.

I was told this was good on a session because u didnt get a hangover from it and its 275ml bottles so u dont get to burst. Ok so u put it to th etest and first the smeel, which is unusual compaired with a few other lagers, but just continental lager really. Taste seems dry and sor of nothingness, although more than the normal lager has to say. 
However to talk about the session, because its 275ml bottles u find yourself finishing them really fast, and end up drinkin 2 for every beer your mates have, which = death and a serious bad ass hangover in the morning. Maybe just bad advise i suppose.
Not a bad lager. Citric flavor with a touch of bitterness. Golden color. Rather weak finish.
not too bad, not anything special. I had it on tap. I would probably drink it again if they just had that and Yuengling on tap.
Aroma is the biggest drawback to this one... skunky, cabbagey?  Everything else is fine, but that aroma is definitely singular.  Other than that it is a pretty thin lager that is nice in the summer.

I really liek this lager. A little thin tasting, but good bouquet of hops and leaves your mouth with a sweet, fruity aftertaste. Nice and fizzy feel makes up for thin taste. A good standard six-pack and great on tap if available.

(Bottled, 5.0% ABV) Pale yellow color with a small, not very lacy head. Toffee-malty, nutty-hoppy, slightly stuffy aroma. Reasonably malty, toffeeish, lemony-hoppy flavor with a short, quite bitter, buttery and slightly astringent finish. Quite light-bodied, but not at all watery palate with soft, foamy carbonation. A quite balanced and well-made, smooth and toffeeish lager - although it’s bulk and by no means interesting. The 4.6% version got exactly the same score, but had a seemingly crispier hopping.
bottle.  moderate hoppiness.  thin mouthfeel.  nothing to get excited over, but a nice one to enjoy on the patio.
A pretty standard mass-market import lager. Very sweet malt with a little bit of apple. Thin mouthfeel. Finish is a little earthy, but doesn’t really change the bland profile.
Big, loose, pillowey white head on a clear straw colored beer. Not much malt aroma. Watery. Restrained malt flavor with a little bitterness. A lesser German lager.
This went down really smooth and with no bad aftertaste or bitterness, not a favorite but next time I go to the gas station at 1:30am for a beer I’ll pick up another 16oz of this.
(bottle) Poured golden yellow. Nice initial head and hoppy aroma.  Finished weak.  Good thirst quencher, but nothing special.

(Bottle 33 cl) One of the very few German pilseners available on the Danish market. Very classical North-German pilsener. Lots of hops leaving both aroma and bitterness. Pale golden, medium head. Decent - and that’s about it. 200100

From a bottle at a bar, not served cold enough, so it probably seemed better than it would have otherwise done to my English taste. Usual Euro-aroma. Golden colour, thin head and no lacing. Effervescent. An indifferent, flaccid taste and thin, watery mouthfeel. But the bitterness lingered agreeably.

Tap at the FOX sports bar in the Palasades Mall. No skunk! Clear pale yellow, very thin white head. Aroma has a slight hop note to it, otherwise clean. Flavor has a dominant hop flavor, and a very dry malt character. One dimensional. Tell you what, Stella has way more of everything, including head retention. To me, Becks is rather pointless after last night...

Bouteille verte de 330 ml. Arôme: Forte odeur de moufette avec une légère touche florale. Apparence: Couleur blonde pâle. Mince col blanc. Faible densité des bulles. Fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de moufette et de citron. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Corps et texture mince. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère amertume en arrière goût. (Rating #163)
didnt like the after taste, average beer, nothing special at all about this one.drinkable.
pours a white head, not creamy, short retention.  Taste is light, clean, crisp.  But-don’t care for the aftertaste, which is slightly bitter.

Pale yellow, no head retention. Hop aroma is present but no distinctive aftertastes.  Tastes too mild, a weak flavor persists that is undesirable.  Common and easy to drink, but lacking any character.
