Pours light golden with decent white head.  Aroma of slight hops and a little skunk.  Flavor and palate are on the thin side.  I used to like this one, but I guess my horizons have broadened.

Bottle: Poured a pale yellow color lager with no head and very limited carbonation. Light floral malt aroma is detectable. Taste is extremely light and boring. Aftertaste is non-existent. Overall, this beer totally lacks any inspiration.

I think that most American macro-drinkers thinks that this the best beer that Germany has to offer, when it fact it pretty low on the scale.  
This beer has no character, it got reasonable malt and hops, but it tastes unpleasant to me.  This is not what a german beer should be.
Aviod if you can, drink only if its the best thing avaible
Fairly standard premium larger style.  Reasonable body, seems malt driven with a nice fizz level.  Ok, not great, but dependable enough for the genre.
obviously im not a big fan.  the sourish flavor just doesnt do it for me.  definitely lacking in depth.

Bottle (bought in Germany).  Had to compare a bottle from Germany to the US version.  Initially skunky aroma but then a nice blend of hops and malt.  Medium yellow color with small head.  Sweetish malt flavor with a biiter hops finish.  Can’t say there is much of a difference from US version (except for less chance of it being infected) unlike Heineken that to me seems to taste much better in the Netherlands than the states.  Have to agree with other raters that this is better than most US macros - It’s also one of the better German lagers as well.  A decent beer, just don’t pay too much for it and in the US, make sure you buy it from a good store that doesn’t let it sit around for years.

German Macro.  Better than any american macro by leaps and bounds.  Can be skunky, especially in six pack or single bottle form.  Cans are a completely different taste.  I’ve drank more becks than water in my lifetime.  There’s better beer out there, but this is a good solid staple.
Pours a light golden color.  With to much head.  No favor on the palate for this beer.  Neve again! If you see this beer, pass on it.
Pours a nice color, with a fairly strong hop aroma, but an abscence of malt. Crisp, not outstanding, with a bit of a sour aftertaste.
common skunky smell lots of carbination with a hopy taste... not to bad not to good

nearly clear lt yellow quickly dissapating head w/ some carb bubbles  Scent is light malt w/ a touch of vinager.  Good carb in the palate w/ a light mellow body.  Flavor is unoffensive touch of wheat a very light floral and some stale hops.  Not bad but not good either.
nothing to get too excited about.  Looks like beer in the glass, but the flavor is laking, and the aftertaste is unwelcome.

Smell is super skunky, and the taste is stale and dusty.  Doesn’t bode well with the light body and moderate floral taste.  A little too carbonated.  Although, perhaps I’m being too hard on this beer, despite all these negatives, it is at least an "ok" beer.
Bottled. Golden colour, mediumsized white bubbly head. Malty notes with strong hoppiness in the aroma. Hoppy bitter taste. Rich carbonation.
High carbonation, but a good beer with some nice bite.  It is better than the big 3, but is a little overpriced for a standard lager.
Beck´s is a real average beer. The taste is not bad, but also not (very) good. If you only drink one or two it´s ok, but if you drink more the taste becomes bad.
Mini keg: blah. Another watery lager. Not much to enjoy here, but they at least avoid the other bad beer traits like mass corn, metallic, etc..
very good smooth beer. goes down pretty good. only problem is it tends to be on the expensive side for a six pack or twelve pack but nonetheless a pretty good german beer
Your basic pilsner.  Nice and crisp when it first hits your palate but turns watery and dull on the finish.  Not a bad everyday beer.
Golden colour with medium white head. A hoppy nose is followed by a light malty  and bittterhopped taste, a little bit slimy. Light to medium bodied decent Pilsener.
Had hoped for a Dark but the restaurant was out.  Disappointed with this one.  Aroma of citrus and that was evident in the flavor as well.  Maybe next time they will have the Dark in stock.

Aroma - pretty interesting. Smells of hops, but nothing really complex. Smells slightly stale and fairly bitter. Sadly the aroma is as good as this beer gets. Appearance is ok I guess. Neither a disappointment nor remarkable. Golden, with a head that disappears quickly. Initial taste is disappointing. What I thought might be some hop bitterness ended up being some stale bitter flavors that were rather shallow. Nothing to back it up. Fortunately not much of an aftertaste.

I’ve enjoyed Beck’s once in a while for over ten years now. I don’t drink it often, and it isn’t my favorite beer, but I always enjoy it. Kind of boring for a German beer, meaning not so flavorful or too hoppy, but kind of refreshing.

I just found an amazing deal at a local retailer (sample cases, 12 2-packs, each one Beck’s and one Beck’s light, or 24 pretty good beers for $10) so I’m drinking one as I write this. I’ve never found it to be skunky, unlike Heiniken (most over-reated beer ever) so I’m not sure what other people are talking about.
watery, skunky nose.  yellow in color with a very fizzy, champagne like head, that diminishes quickly.  slightly bitter, skunky flavor.  goes down crisp with a lively carbonation.

the most popular german beer in america....  bastard, almost got me fooled.  not a bad premium lager by all means, but that’s not saying much given my dislike toward premium lagers. definitely not one of the better german beers.

Pours  a very pale yellow with wimpy white head.  Has a skunky smell and tastes, but after the 3rd sip it disipates and is very refreshing.  Has a  clean crisp tastes that quenches any thirst.  Also lively carbonated.  Overall a nice pale lager which you can drink very easily.

Golden pour, white head, some carbonation.  Hops and skunk in the aroma.  Could be that this beer wasn’t taken care of, though its consistent with every bottle of Becks I have had.  Could it be the green bottle?  Don’t know.  Not much flavor, slight hop finish.
Consistantly decent pils.  Pours golden, white head, dry mouth with a bitter finsih.

I expected better then what I got, A disappointment in the beers I’ve tried from 
westren europe.

Bottled. Skunky, grassy, slightly flowery aroma. Crisp, skunky taste, ending hop-bitter. I can imagine that this, fresh from the tanks, might be an average pilsner, but I´ve drunken it quite often, and never came across an unskunked example. Not good.
Pretty underwhelming beer.  Herbal hops.  Yellow color with small head.  Not very flavorful.
Bottle. Light yellow-golden colour. White head. Sharp, hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavour with a dry finish.
It smelled kind of skunky when I opened it. It poured a nice rich golden color with a nice creamy head. It was a little bitter but the taste grew on me.
From A Bottle.Quite hoppy and dry,good for a session,another past favourite.

Clear golden beer, initial heavy pearling, to fine white head with confluent bubbles. Very grassy nose, drying hay wetted again. Taste balances between sweet pale malts and more neutral grain, with a mild break to a bitterish, slightly metallic finish. Empty palate, bit restsugars, bit metallic rest, slight slickness. As far as megabrew Pilseners go, this one is more than decent. Because of the region it hails from?

Pours clear and golden in color, thick white head with decent retention. Slightly skunky in the nose it seemed to dissipate revealing the hops and the smell of grass.The taste is average, a little bready, nothing jumps out at you. Finishes clean and dry. Not a bad beer. Beats most domestic swill.
Bah, I don’t even really like German lagers anyways. But this is alright on tap, if not terribly inspiring. Bland and boring.
Better that Miller Lite or MGD (and those are usually my choices in the dive bars I come-to in) In fact this is considered a limp-wrist beer in my neighborhood hellholes.
This one slipped through the cracks partially because i think its crap. Very pale with no head. Grab a Heinieken.

Good yellow color with proper carbonation but very little head that disappeared right away. The shy aroma was not as skunky as I thought it would be. Unfortunately the taste was. In fact, a blend of metallic palate, skunkiness and low crisp bitterness.

The finish was brutally dry with very little after taste. This wasn’t a pleasing experience.

Bottled. 
This used to be a favourite - when I was a kid. It does not seem all that bad. Pale golden. Clean, grassy, almost herbal aroma. Flavour is grassy and a little fruity, all in all very clean. Hardly no bitterness at all, maybe a late one. As pleasant as it gets in a range with a 2,7-rating.
Not what I thought it would be it was a little too bitter for my likings but i did like the way it looked when i poured it.
Average, not particularly interesting, but it is at least very consistant. Light coloured, watery mouthfeel, blandish flavour.

This is the beer I think of when I think of German macro-brew lagers. A sort of Budweiser of Germany if you will.(except of course this beer is better) And like many of their kind they over do the hop bitterness in an attempt to make it full bodied. If you like a crisp dry beer you will like this one. The worst think about this beer is that it is a little bit watery, The best thing about this beer is the toasted bread taste.

Golden glass, very clear with a diminishing head.  Aromas are crackers, wheat.  This beer has a full, but slightly sour resonance.  The flavors of toast and malt are a little suprising here, but not out of place.  Still, there is the actual taste of water to contend with... and not enough of the flavors that make this beer mildly interesting.
tap. yellow straw color. fat pocked head. skunky aroma. bitter acidic flavor that has a sourness that is unpleasant, finish is much of the same. no bueno.
Very solid day to day beer.  Medium head with golden appearance.  Sweet after taste reminding me of fresh mangoes.

I’ve had several of these, and this review is based on a non-skunked version... Pours yellow with a fairly nice white head.  Nose is crisp and has hints of fresh hops.  The flavor is complex for a lager, with more hops and sour malts. Dry.  Tangy, metallic aftertaste.  Neh.  If I want bad lager I’ll buy Budweiser.
So becks. Not all that great, it is a lager and it does have that lager funk to it but this one rubs me the wrong way entirely. I just dont get it.
I swore this tasted different in Germany. Wasn’t as bad as I had it here. But, I do still prefer it over the norm. In the end, its tolerable. Just another lager, living in the woods.

Yellow body, with a thick foamy white head. Aroma is skunky, with some hops, and some citrus alcoholish aromas? Strange. Taste is hoppy bitterness, sour maltyness. Not that great. Had it a million times and never rated, but here it is now!
To ligth golden color. Middle white head. Bad aroma!! Powerfull  malty taste. Not that good......
cant beleve I havent rated this before!! medium lager, nothing much to say, very easy going and mainstream

Bottle. "Eh".  That was my son’s comment when I asked him what he thought of it.  I agree.  Inoffensive and drinkable as heck- but nothing special especially for a German beer.  The label doesn’t mention it, but I’d swear I taste corn. The piss yellow color is a turnoff to me - I prefer my lagers amber.

Again as the magestic Chokehold points out a true williams party lager, piss easy to drink, with little flavour.  It doesn’t have any body, or much flavour or aroma.  It does lack however the chemical sesspool flavours that many mass produced lagers tend to have these days.

This is truly a "party beer"  golden in color, good aroma and easy to drink.  If you are looking for a beer that you can drink a lot of and not get tired of the taste, then look no further!!!

rich body, watery at the end.
After reading and tasteing and rating, I must agree. Poured orange, smelled kind of skunky. This is not good for a german brew. Mass produced  same old.
The German Coors.  A German Coors is far superior to the US Coors though.  Crisp, dry and devoid of flavor.
Not good for a German beer.  Kind of a similar taste to Heineken but not as good.  Not very impressive at all.

This is a beer that seems to find a loop hole in the German purity law. Although still made to this strict standard (god bless Germany), it seems to have slowly evolved into the safety net of typical, mass produced, inoffensive, highly advertised, macro-brewed slosh that you could sell anywhere in the world with ease. Grassy, subtle and boring ultra- light, this is another conundrum, generally called Lager!

Bottle poured  yellow with a light head.
Sweet aroma and a light hoppy taste with a bit of a metalic finish.
Not bad.. so so.
Firm and clear in the color. Bitter moderated with escaping and fine foam...

Bottle. Aroma is hoppy and sweet. Pours a very pale yellow, with a thin head. Carbonation is mild to mild-medium. Flavor is your standard European macrobrew. Hoppy with notes of malt. Nothing special, but pretty good for a European macrobrew. Not much to say about this.

It is what it is - a run of the mill German lager, and that’s not necessarily a bad thing; it’s just not spectacular.  While the first wiff of Becks smells like a skunk, the aroma turns into bitter, hoppy combo when it hits the palate.  This brew is moderately acidic and bitter.  It’s got bite and a lingering aftertaste.

This beer is so ugly looking i can’t believe ima drink it after seeing it in a glass.  It has some skunk and sourgrass flavors that are boring but i noticed it goes pretty good with pizza.  As a youngster these kinda beers were the good ones compared to everything else.
this beer was a great beer but today i think they masproduce it ading cemicals in it to produce it quikly it dosent tast the same anymore
710ml green bottle. Skunk aroma apparent, also mild grassy hops and light malt. Very light in colour - pale yellow. Small creamy white head. Malty body, light bitterness.

A basic lager.  Pours a nice golden hue with fine bubbles.  Aromas of malt and not much else. Taste is slightly bitter but fairly balanced.  A very light style of beer from Germany.  A mediocre lager.

Thin and poor tastes like a sophisticated more expensive pabst blue ribbon, deffinately not impressed for the price. I guess the purity law didn’t apply to this german beer.  Becks light is a better beer.
Pale yellow, thin & fizzy white head.  Slightest of hops and malt in the aroma.  It is a bit dry in the aftertaste, I guess.  Overall unoffensive but still not something you drink to taste.
bottle. drunk on this when i ran out to riot cuz the BOSTON RED SOX WON THE WORLD SERIES. i love boston.
Pours a pale yellow witha thin bubbly head. Hops and malt aroma with the hop aroma being predominant. Surprisingly high carbonation. malt taste with a moderate hop bitterness. Refreshing
Quite pale amber in colour. Low on aroma. Sharp hoppiness. I even found it slightly dry in the aftertaste. Probably not greatly balanced - could do with a bit more malt influence.

Pours the colour of water with a drop of yellow food dye in it. Mild skunkiness (surprisingly ) hops? The taste is watery, astringent and dry. I paid over 6$ for a bottle of this at my restaurant. Crappy.

Can. Very pale yellow, small white bubbly head, that diminished rapidly and left a little lacing.  Lightly sweet malty aroma, a slight metallic mineral smell too, and a touch of dough.

Taste-wise, light malt again, transforming into mild honey in the finish, which is overpowered by a decent bitterness.  A wee bit bready. Maybe weak candy too.
 
A medium body, a bit of a sharp tongue feel, with crisp carbonation. 

Hardly a jawdroppingly good beer, but for something so mass produced, it is not exactly what I would call bad.  It is, infact, alright.  All in all I would give it 11 or 12 out of 20.  Tonight, it is a 12.

The colour is very pale yellow and the liquid is clear. The white, small, thick foam dissolves into a minimal, almost invisible coat.

The smell is mild with a flavour of pilsner malt; there are also some discreet notes of rye bread and yeast. 

The carbonation is quite low, but the small bubbles create a pleasant, refreshing mouthfeel.

The first taste that hits my mouth is a little sweetness, then some bitterness emergers with notes of white bread. There is some sweetness and light tones of citrus and maybe marzipan in the aftertaste.

This is yet another German pilsner, uncomplicated and predictable.
It wasn’t so bad. I thought it was good, but I’d already been drinking a little bit before I had it, so I’m not too sure. I gave it straight average marks across the board.
A very light aroma.  Not too much taste either.  Just a hint of hops.  A pretty light feeling beer.  Nothing special.
09.28.04  12oz can.  Appearance: see Natural Ice.  Aroma is lightly hopped and a touch peppery.  Very bland.  Very.  I think this is the first time I’ve ever tried this beer and hopefully the last.
Very pale yellow color with a little head.  Kinda like Heineken.  Better than other domestic beers (Bud, Coors, Miller, etc.).  Not bad, but I had better.

Well... this wasn’t bad. Had a suprisingly fine smell for a lager (wasn’t skunky at all), had a nice big white head, that got smaller relatively slowly, but the taste was unremarkable. Had worse, had better.
A classis that must be had.  Not much of a head.  Hoppy bitterness that goes great with pizza.

tsarman reminded me of Becks, something else I drank in the early summer but never cared to rate, and I can put the green bottle theory into this:
rolling rock < peroni < becks < heineken
Heineken being a dutch budweiser anyway...

A disappointment in a German lager.  This is obviously brewed to appeal to the American mass-market pale lager drinkers.  A yellow coloring with a thin/thinner/thinnest head, the aroma is of mild malts with little hopping.  It does have a clean finish.

Super skunky!  Pours yellow with a white head.  The aroma is skunk and I can smell it before I even lift it to my nose.  Mine is so skunky I get no flavor other than skunk.  Save your money on this one.
This was a remarkably skunky beer.  How this is the highest exported beer or whatever they claim is beyond me.  It was your run of the mill, if not worse, macro brew.
Man, do all beers in green bottles suck.  Oh yes they do suck.  This, Rolling Rock, Heineken, etc.  All are bad.

Light straw in color, grassy noze, long lasting, lacy head. Great mouthfeel for a "light" beer [he said tongue planted firmly in cheek.

I first tasted this beer on tap in an old-fashioned German restaurant in Philadelphia iwhen I was in college in........let’s just say, Gerald Ford was our new President. I’ve been in love with it since!

(on bottle) served at a noisy bar way too cold or is it just that all the macros prefer thier beer store at 3 degrees celcius? Carlsberg recomended it to me, as I was opening up my place and asked them where thermostat where. And Becks too?
This is my dumbass buddy’s favorite everyday brew and I like it a lot too. Great German beer that isn’t too heavy and has a refreshing, crisp taste.
Bold and bubbly, slightly dark.  Nothing special.  Not too innovative on the taste here.

Beck’s in the big bottle used to be one of my favorite college beers. It’s been a while since I last had one - I’m a hardcore Unibroue fan - and I’m now left wondering how I even drank it in the first place. Thin head dissipates in a matter of seconds. Very little carbonation visible yet, the sting is still there. Grassy and hoppy, though shallow and tasetless.Certainly not the best example of a german lager.
An average German pils with nice hoppy character. There’s nothing interesting behind the hops: the beer is pale and thin, but it’s a must-try for every beer lover.
Pours pale yellow in color. A little sweet and skunky aromas. Not really flavorful. It is pretty smooth and easy to drink. Just a basic beer to kick back and drink, nothing special.
Skunky, skunky, skunk won’t go away.  Has a sour taste, takes some getting used to.  Prefer other germans.
Can , bottle or tap easily find in Turkey.Hopy taste,Bit bitterness,but not so good.Normal lager german beer.They have much better ones.

Bottle.  Typical German beer.  Pours with a
white head, very carbonated, pale, golden, 
see through color.  Has a very rubbery smell
that I think the brewer describes as a "hoppy
bouquet."  This beer reminds me very much
of Germany--thin, tasteless, and boring.
Bottle. Some sharp malt and herbal hop aromas. Moderately dry with leafy bitterness and a slight metallic flavour.

Bottle. Pale yellow body with a tiny white head. Aroma is nearly non existent with just a touch of hops peaking through. Funky hoppy bitterness, not skunk but... blah. Worse than I remember. Palate is pretty light even for the style.

Bottled. Pale yellow colour. A fair bit hoppier than most lagers that are easily available in this country. Is it perhaps a pilsener?
Not great but better than most mass produced lagers people seem to drink.
I thought it was a pretty good beer, didn’t notice the negatives I heard about it, probably due to the Pizza. Good bonus to with the 5 Air Miles
The first time i had this beer i hated it. The second time i had it, i liked it. I found the tatse to be a little bitter and skunky, but still enjoyable, worth a buy every now and then.
A nice beer to enjoy everyday.  It tasted pretty good and went down real smooth.
Can.  I found this only slightly more tolerable than Heineken.  I guess it came down to not being as skunky tasting.  What is here is pale yellow, quite thin, with a watery, corny taste.  Yum.
Very light yellow color. Slightly fruity and malty aroma. Medium bodied lager. Grassy flavor, some bittering hops found in the end. Lacks some carbonation, still good for premium lager.
Not being a lager fan I’m probably less than a totally objective rater.  Better than Heineken, but that’s not saying much.
Golden color, light weak aroma and watery taste, light body, light watery finish.

This beer is tolerable.  Especially when you put it up against non-beers like Schlitz and Wild Cat malt liquor.  The aftertaste is a bit bitter, while the taste is hoppy and slightly wheaty.  Honestly, I was a bit let down.  It seems like the younger step-brother of Tennent’s of Scotland.
Beck’s really suprised me when i first had it...it is incredibly smooth compared to beers i’ve had and does leave you with a stomach full of carbon dioxide...which limits the burping.
golden hue, drank this straight out the bottle, like the hoppy taste,  but tastes almost exactly like a heineken to me...and ok brew.

Upgrade from St Pauli Girl. Comparable to Heineken. Nothing to brag about, nothing too "horrible". If you need to be sober, go for a the avaliable alcohol free Becks beer Haake Beck instead. Other then that, avoid Beck’s when there is soooo many other better German Beers that are just as available.

Bottled (BB 03/2005)

Lager color. Very small head. Grassy saaz-aroma. Crisp, grassy hops with bitter aftertaste. Like a little brother of Pilsner Urquell. (7/2/7/4/14 3.4)

Re-rated, bottle (BB 02/2005, funny to find one month older bottle in March05 from FInland, than one in Croatia in July04)

Pale yellow, small white head. Mild Saaz-like nose. Medium-bodied, malty, slightly sweet. Hints of hops somewhere. (6/2/4/2/9 2.3)

Light gold and surprisingly bubble free.  Aromas are metallic hops, butter and some yeast.  Flavours are soft, buttery malts with some citrus twang.  Quite oily on the palate.  This has a soda water finish that lacks dryness or bitterness.  Not bad for a "cheap" lager.

On draft at Jet Rock in the Phila Airport.  Drank this prior to a Heineken, and the Becks was a stronger tasting beer:  more malt, more hops.  But, all of these lagers seem not to differ by much to my palate.
A decent tasting light bodied lager.  Good taste with barely and aftertaste.  Comparable to a Heinaken

Clear, golden color with a small white head. Must aroma. Light malt flavor with a hint of hops. Kind of skunky like a
Heineken.

Not bad, but not great, i expected it to be better, but i wouldnt call it a dissapointment, the hoppy flavor wasn’t to strong, and the head wasn’t to impressive, kind of a pale color that reminded me of so many domestic beers.
not too much to this one.  A decent euro brew but nothing too special.  Alot better than the macro swill you get stateside, but i’ve moved on to bigger and better beers.
Canned. Golden lager with no head. Nice german hops aroma. Good balance of grassy malts and sharp german hops. Classicly german in style. Well, it is a classic.

its a lager, a german style, but I’m not impressed, maybe its me American bias but I do love a lot of German beers but Beck doesn’t kow how to pull off a lager. Pours piss yellow, smells like heiniken, taste a little better. no a favorite by any means, but still better than some.

Not great, but not all that bad.  Yep, that’s it.  The commercial description says "...fresh hoppy bouquet...", well I beg to differ.  On tap at least there’s a hint of something like hops.  Out of the bottle is a whole different story.  Not skunky, but not too tasty.  It’s definitely not fruity, and is in NO WAY complex.  Complex?....it’s almost laughable.  If all you’re after is a decent lager then look no further.

A Standard-bearer in my experience. I have had "off" bottles of Becks that beat any US Macro Brew hands down, hard to skunk it with the green glass, I suppose. A crisp flavor and a small bite, I imagine that this is a Typical US import German beer, better in country.

DRINKING BECKS.  MAKE’S THE GIRLS WET.  ALL I THINK ABOUT IS SEX!.. hAHA  Well pretty good imported beer.  Nice shiny light gold, beautiful white head.  Pretty clean and crisp flavour to it.  It possess a nice herbal, malty with a nice cool mellow hop finish to it, like all German beers.  Little tartness and little hints of citrus to it.  This beer is araight in my books.  1 1/2 Old Monk thumbs up.
It’s Imported! Says so right there on the label. Gold, nice white head. Slightly salty, bready aroma - surprisingly not skunked. Frainy, malty with a mellow hop finish.

Pours a clear yellow-gold with a thin white head. Aroma is slightly skunky, hops and a trace of malt. Flavor is sweet and malty, but nothing special. Substitute "average" for "classic" in the commercial description, and you’re a lot closer to the true nature of this beer.

Had this on tap at an event I attended at the Labatt/Interbrew headquarters in Toronto. Very pale yellow colour. Aroma is herbal and hoppy, much better than the skunkfest you usually get from the bottled version. Body is crisp and refreshing. Flavour is quite sweet with a dry hoppy finish. Not a world-beater, but a decent patio quaff.
Not the best German offering, but not the worst.  Good beer for sittin’ around with friends.
not my beer of choice but good nontheless. had a good clean taste. pretty good beer
Bubbly when fresh. Yeasty flavor that I enjoyed, quite refreshing. Had a skunky smell, but not noticed when tasted.
A very natural but somewhat blandish taste.  Very good though.  Clean and crisp.

710 ml green bottle. Imported. I got this to accompany some chillie and decided to rate it. Poured a clear pale straw with lots of bubbles clinging to the side of the glass. Thin white head. No lacing.Apple juice nose with some hops. Crisp and fruity flavour. OK mouthfeel. Cider finish.
Not a very good beer at all.  Its refreshing and drinkable when cold but thats about it. Light with a faint hoppiness, the only admirable quality of this beer.

Probably the best of the German mega brewed pils. I’ve had this bottled, on tap, and now canned. I HAD to try the can because I am amazed at the consistancy of this beer in cans. Not disappointed....canned the same familiar taste as bottled without the worry of the odd light struck "skunked" bottle. Tastes the same everywhere because they are a single source exporter. I love the aroma... floral hops...very pungent. Crack a Beck’s in a closed room and they can smell it across the way. 

It poured the familiar light gold. Small snow white head that vanishes quickly to a lace (as a good Pilsner would). The mouthfeel is much like a  pilsner ...tart, slight hint of citrus to start but a more light bodied lager malty taste mixed with that Beck’s tart tang (this can was relatively fresh tasting), then finishes desert dry with the signature metallic aftertaste. The only downfall of Becks is that it is not a very drinkable beer when its not fresh....very acidic...skunky nose to it.

Another green bottle beer that is very good when fresh and un-skunked. Nice toasty malty flavor. Great balancing bitterness and very clean tasting beer. Nothing to crave, but excellent to sit around and drink multiple bottles.
Pale Gold In Color.  Had it as a Beck’s Bomber 22oz...  Took a while to Choke This one Down.
Pretty awfull, had it in a can. poured pale and fizzy. A little hops but tasted like theyd been sitting in someones gym shoes before going in the boil. Skunky paper factory aroma.. yuck.

Tap: This was very fresh. Very pale gold with a small lasting head with good lacing. Aroma of pilnser/lager malt and very strong bread yeast (like a loaf rising). Flavour was a bit watery but refreshing nonetheless. Palate had some bitterness but nothing distinctive. Good for a summers day.
Light yellow, fizzy head. Pils malts. Lightly light stricken flavor and aroma. Musky hops. Thin and weak with a slight sour finish.

Good old Becks in the green bottle. Has a subtle malt aroma. Follows through with light hop flavor, medium bodied. Average not very tasty. A bland finish, but an easy drinking beer.  Not the best that Germany has to offer, but if you can find one thats fresh drink up.

Bottled - Golden amber in color with a decent whitish head.  Not much for aroma, perhaps some skunk (green bottle??).  In spite of its popularity it is not a very distinctive beer.  Drinkable, buit not something to seek out.
This is a good beer.  Pours gold with a stonrg hoppy flavor.  Again, is a good beer but becks dark is the way to go.

In the bottle. Gold fizzy big bubble pour. Dissipating white head. Strong hop flavor that dominates this pilsener. Hallertauer, perhaps? Surprisingly, this is not usually skunky for a beer bottled in green glass. My favorite thing is the fancy foil around the neck and cap. I prefer Becks dark.
Cerveza rubia normal o sea q sigue la ley de pureza alemana. Aroma fuerte y sabor un poco decepcionante.

Okay, I decided to finally review Beck’s when I finally happened upon a bottle here in Toronto that wasn’t skunked. In fact, the whole case wasn’t skunked. That’s a first for me. Usually, it’s all skunk.

So, pours nice golden yellow with insignificant head. Just what I’d expect from a pils.

Mouthfeel is crisp, with nice carbonation.

Taste is especially characterized by a honey-sweet that I had never detected in Beck’s because it was also skunked when I had it. The honey comes on quite strong at first, then subsides for the hops and bitter finish.

Overall, non-skunked Beck’s is what I would expect from a big brewery, but is still above the usual fare.
One of the ugliest beers i have ever seen, pale yellow. Stewed fruit, slightly floral hop aroma. flavour consists of a little malt, perfumy hops next to no bitterness, with zero aftertaste. horrible
Good beer to just drink out of the bottle, don’t get much more from the pour.  Does have a slight skunkiness, but that’s not always bad....always better than a Heineken.
In danish:"Gaaaaaaab!" Nothing special at all. Not anything worth writing about. Thin, a little sweetness, and perhaps a little bitterness. Light-yellow.
tasteless and no aroma. Light yellow with almost no head. To little carbon dioxide. How could I think that I«we ever liked this beer?!

Canned - 500ml. Highly carbonated pale yellow body with a thick but light-speed fading head. Average euro-lager hoppy nose. Taste is refreshing and definitely hoppy with some bready hints. Its bitter final is quite fair. Ordinary, and far below the average for a german beer. Nonetheless, I prefer this to Heineken.
Fresh crisp taste, slight skunk oder that I do not mind. Does not pour well in glass-head disappears.
Pale colour, crisp taste, one of those to be trusted out of a bottle almost wherever you go. The touch of malt makes it for me.

bottled: had this at a barbeque this past weekend. ofcourse all of us have had becks several times when there is nothing but swill and 'they' are calling this the 'premium'. most the time i have that skunky feel when drinking this, dont know if its suppose to be this way or it skunked. light gold with white bubbly head. thin macro with slight malt feel. non descript water...was good ice cold to quench.
You know what this isn't half bad. Nice flavor, bitter presense to remind you what this is. Never had a becks beer before. Its actually pretty good.
Skunky watery taste very much resembling a Carlsberg or Heineken.  Nice smooth taste, sweet aroma.  Not much body or dominant flavors.

Proof that Germany can brew beer as crappy as any American Macro. +++Sampled from a 12 oz green bottle this beer pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Typical German macro aroma and flavor. A little sharp and bitter. No complexity and no aftertaste.

Thin, metallic, skunked, and watery.  Pours a typical pils color, light carbonation, thin head that disappears quickly.  Smells very skunky, flavor is metallic and weak.  I'm just repeating the intro here, so I'm quitting.
The smell can be foul.  I guess it built its reputation among those who could get it fresh.  Then again, maybe not.  It definitely has a bit of body and a slightly stale aftertaste.
I gave this an aroma of 8 because when you open the bottle it will hit you. Smells terrible and doesnt taste all that great

Smells like it is St Pauli Girl's yeast infected cousin.  Skunk in a bottle.  I would rather screw the bearded lady at the circus on a hangover than be forced to drink this shit for the rest of my life.  Sorry but Germans don't make the best beer.
Pours deep golden, with a decent head.  Hints of citrus and hops in the taste.  Finishes assertive, smooth, and crisp.  Decent.

Pale straw with a small head that dies. Strong metallic hops aroma. Palate is smooth enough and quite full. Quite a bit of malt and certainly balanced with the hops. Does seem to have a slightly funny aftertaste. An okay pils and certainly good to have around to educate australian "pilsener" drinkers to the idea of some malt upfront in your pils but not worth the standard price (same as urquell ~$60 a case which I also think is a little overpriced), I got this for $40 and am happy enough at that price point for it.
Looks like apple juice in the glass. Malty and clean with a sweetness though a bit light. Not the best pilsener I have had. A bit too bland.
Fuzzy lager - it's bud sans wood and brewed somewhere else.  Some malt nose.  dry, carbonated taste.
Light straw in color with small white lacing around the edges. Aroma of a fresh honey glazed doughtnut, sweet,malty,bready,buttery. Flavor is hoppy,sweetmalt and a dry finish.

0.5 L aluminium can. Aroma was fresh with a bit of yeast in it, and the beer it self a pale yellow colour. The very dry flavour was initially bitter but had a long aftertaste with more malt. An OK beer.
Light gold with a white head that diminishes quickly.  Sour, hoppy aroma.  Taste is initially buttery then metallicy.  Light and creamy palate.

From a can. Aroma is mild skunk really, IMO. Appearance is a watery golden and the fair head dissapears almost totally - quickly.

Flavour is grassy and actually quite OK. Nothing special, but a decent lager that lacks more sparkle. Better than a lot of "international" macros.
really not that impressive. Dont know what to say to make this beer interesting.

Pale golden colour, with a surprisingly long-lasting and creamy head.  Good aromatic Saaz hop smell, grapefruit, flowers and such.  Taste is average for the type, nice and refreshing.  Body is a bit thin.  Some nice light malt, and a crisp finish.  Slightly bitter.

A refreshing classic. All-natural, Beck's is an alternative to Alfalfa for those on a health kick.
Spanner.
The worst beer I've ever had...definentely hate beck's and have no desire to drink this shitty german pilsner ever again.

Aroma slightly metallic with a hint of wheat. Appearance is pale yellow and pasturised clear. Flavour has a small amount of fruitiness and saaz spicy hop flavour but leaves no aftertaste. Easy to drink but little mouthfeel. Only had this on draught and probably wouldn't worry about it again.

Ugh - draft tasted like chilled liquid metal. Downright nasty. Didn't really have any "beer" flavor, just chemicals. If you want to keep your taste buds intact, avoid this bottled/fermented formaldahyde at all costs.
Better than Heineken, but not by much. A little skunky and metalic tasting.

out of the bottle at bar: aroma is a little skunked, but that's ok with me..Can actually taste some hops at the finish, body is a little thin.Hops are noticeable but not overpowering.Much better than Heineken and any German beer is good with me.I really admire their Purity Law, if only we had one. I think this blows any domestic macro right out of the water.Certainly not the best German beer, but this is my import of choice until I find a better one.
Nasty commercial beer. It stinks, it tastes bad and it's not particularily cheap.
Typical German macro-pilsener. Quite refreshing and easy to drink but nothing really special.

Bottled.  This is nasty.  Extremely sweet lager which just bites at your throat.  I hope never to drink this again, and only finished the bottle in order to rate it fairly here.  Obviously lagers do not have to be bad, so why does this sell so well?   Score 0.6
Subsequent rating scored 1.9. Average becomes 1.2

I was suprised. Extremely pale gold, short sudsy head. Wee bit of hoppy aroma with some roast. Flavour was good. Some bitters and cereals with fruity florals. I could taste a mild smokiness. I don't know if that is normal but it wasn't bad. Rounder than Heineken and Stella combined. Still wouldn't pay $45+ for a case. Not bad for macro.

I wonder what the marketing budget is for this? If I drink it will it increase my desirability? With women that have sculpted breasts and designer smiles? Will it give me that je ne sais quoi I have yearned for so long?  If the marketing budget were increased could I get a pair of slacks to go with it? This is so good. So good. (aside, thanks for the cash) I want more. I NEED more. so good, so good. UhHuH
Very average beer for the beer drinker who doesn't like to experiment with anything new... because you'll find nothing new here.
Wheat-coloured German pils that pours with a fluffy white head and good carbonation.  Straw and hops bouquet with a stonger hops flavor.  Crisp and refreshing.  (500ml can)
This is just a pretty average beer, but a decent enough German lager.  It is yellow, not complex, and not very fruity (like the ad says).  It is a bit more dry and sweet than comparable brews.
Straw in colour, without much of a head. Hoppy, with a nice crisp finish. It's a fairly basic beer... a step up from the major North American beers.
Smelled kind of skunked when I first opened it. Poured a nice head but was a little bitter for my tastes. If it wasn't so damn expensive i would drink it more often.
As you can tell by my name this is my staple.  I feel like this is the basement of german beers, but i keep coming back because of the hoppy goodness.  Some guys go for budweiser, i go for Becks.
I don't like pilseners and I don't know why I keep coming back.  If I could only remember the terrible aftertaste.
I do not recommend Beck's. It simply cannot compare with German beers like Warsteiner. I would even prefer St. Pauli Girl to this one.
This is one of the best beers in the world. Easy to drink, great taste. The only problem is it is far to expensive in Australia.

a good beer but since i've had a chance to sample so many other specially crafted beer, this one does not stack up.  i used to think that the skunky taste was part of a stronger beer....well, not anymore.  this beer is a bit skunky.
Very small head.  Drinkable beer, not something I would have all to often, good amount of carbination.

Bottle, from the Hogshead, Birmingham. I only really rated this one to get it out of the way, but I must say, it's not as bad as I remembered, certainly considering how popular it is with the masses! Fairly pale, small fluffy head. Classic German bitterness, with light saaz throughout. Balanced, refreshing, crisp. Slightly bland, but qualitat. Would be, and indeed is a very popular session lager.

Bottled, pasteurised. Pale yellow, fizzy. Has the benefit of a tangy crispness, but a forced hop flavour to overcome the incredible carbonation. Opening one of these must damage more of the ozone layer, do the world a favour and yourself, leave it in the bottle.
Nothing special; kinda bland, but no adjucts is nice.  Pale, short lasting white head, but smooth crisp taste.  finish was a little odd; starts of skunkiness probably.
Golden amber color.  Light taste.  Much less favorable than the dark version.  Stonger hops flavor.
Becks made me puke.  It wasn't the AMOUNT of beer that I had, but rather the lack of quality thereof.  (It may have been the quantity).

subdued, musty aroma. very light straw colour, almost clear with a tinge of gold really. unimpressive flavour with no highlights, some malt and hop character. thin on the palate. i'll only get this again if there's nothing better going.

I have to admit I'm quite the fan of Becks. Oh, there are other lagers out there that are better, I'm sure, but in my personal opinion, Becks is liquid gold! It's a little heavier than some lagers, but doesn't fill you up if you're drinking a lot of it!

More hops and, therefore, more character than most euro-lagers.  Slightly flowery aroma and relatively clean and dry on the finish. Not much in between though. Bland, but a reasonable standby if stranded in a bar that has nothing more interesting, which this was (as we waited foro the Eurostar train to take us to Brussels). Bottle, Bonaparte's, Waterloo Station, London, September 2003.

TheDM and Hotstuff vacation brew 54.    This brew poured a medium sized head of finely sized white colored mostly lasting bubbles that left behind a straw yello colored uncarbonated body.  The aroma was almost non-existant with only a few mmild hop notes present.  The mouthfeel was tingly from the hops.  It had a thin hop flavor.  I still think this is an insult to good German beers!

Crystal-clear and lightly active with a thin hazy head.  Powerfully malty flavor but with the uniquely Bavarian hop roundness at the finish.  Bit of the import skunk; better in Germany.  The STL version is junk.

This is an American Standard beer in Pilsener clothing. Its not a bad beer, but it pales in comparison to Pilsner Urquell. Most of the samples that I've had were skunky (probably the green bottles). Might be the best beer served at your local college hangout.
I guess I haven't rated this yet. A very drinkable and smooth Pilsener with an apple-juice roundedness to it.  The hops appear to be Saaz, like Pilsner Urquell's.

Pours a golden brown beer, almost no head. Very little aroma, as it warmed up a fair amount of hops and breadiness were present. Lightly hopped in flavour, though nothing offensive. Wasn't skunky at least. Bottle.

Beer poured with not much head that faded fast. Not much hop aroma and a little less flavor than I would expect from a german pilsner. I would like to see more hop flavor and aroma in this beer. An okay beer that is better than most BMC types of beer. One nice thing was that the case I bought was sealed so that no light could get to the green bottles. At least the beers were not skunky.

This inexpensive and accessible import drinks like a decent beer.  I like it better than Heinekin actually.  Musty aroma and opaque, headless body.  Taste isn't too shabby.  Nutty.  Smooth. Definite presence of hops.  Not much in the way of a palate and a dry, very soapy finish.  Nothing special but one you can certainly do worse than this green-bottled import.
Poured a pale golden color with a very small bubbly white head.  Skunky lager aroma.  Rather bland, slightly skunky, metallic, some hops, and phenols noted as well.
Mild malt and skunk aroma that pours clear with lots of carbonation and medium head.  Not a bad beer just average.
Huh. Not great, not bad. Beautifully clear pale gold color. Small white head. Otherwise, pleasantly mediocre pilsner. Slightly skunky in 24oz bottle.
light golden color, little head. little hops, sometimes skunky. better than heineken.
Not a good lager. Has little flavor and little hops to keep the carbonation from getting overpowering.
Not one of the better German lagers, quite below of what you would expect,just plain.

Pretty nice looking but average light golden coloured beer with a tiny white head ..some lace.
Compared to the bottled version the aroma is quite refined and nice..nice floral hops and some malts..delicate.
Again in the can the taste is light but trasty,,its a very delicate balance between the hops and the small malt..I think this is lost in the bottle due to the green glass
Nice smooth mouthfeel.
Very drinkable light pils in the can..delightful and worth a try even if you've been burned by the green bottles.

Mild grain nose and some skunkiness. Crystal clear pale straw colour with thin white bubbly head. Very few bubbles in the body of beer. Bland flavour with bitterness in the finish. Very light body. Bottle (green).
The few times that I have had this beer it's been skunky.  May have to do with the green bottle more than anything else.  Nice color but will not buy again.
It's better than Bud and Heinekin.  From a can this still tastes kind of skunky, but has some hop flavor.
A fairly tasty european beer, beautiful clear colour and easy drinking taste.  Nothing too special but still quite tasty.
Good carbonation, good lacing.  That is all I really have good to say about this beer.  Truly skunky and only slightly better than Heineken.  Pretty average Euro brew.
Looks very nice, fair aroma for a pilsener, medium flavour, pour palate, a fine beer overall a fine beer with a stale and short aftertaste.
Better than Heineken, especially when drafts are compared.  Still a green bottle skunker though.
Always tasty, never blows you away, and has a nice aftertaste perfect for casual sipping and a heavy night at the bar
Ahh A good German lager.This would be on my list for an everyday beer not anything too special but than average.It goes down smooth with a nice clean finish
Lacking a lot.  It makes up for it however with its large quantities of boring flavor.
Its a simple pilsener, although it is a bit dry.  Doesnt have a nice appearance though.  Pretty average. cheers
seemed like the german equivalent of budwiezer. very weak, weaK SMELL, urine colored. slighly better than bud or coors.

Once upon a time, this was all you could get of German pils in Scandinavia, and in those days this was really an experiencw. But now I´m not that amused by this "standardpils" there are many better in Germany.
The coloring is not what I look for in a beer. It had a little bit of a bite that could make your stomach turn after a night of heavy pounding. All in all, I still will buy it in its 22oz bottle.
Had it on tap and wasnt impressed. urine coloured and tasted weak, watery and slighty off. Not a good tasting beer.
This is not a good German beer at all. Skunky, socks, ass? Not nice. Sorry about the donkey reference. Likesd it when I was nineteen.

Clear yellow with moderate carbonation.  Funky hop aroma plus malt and corn smell. Flavor is stale (like cardboard) and skunky. Cloying to boot. Palate like a diet soda. Offensive and considerably worse than expected based on previous experiences with this beer.
Definitely better on tap than in the bottles (which have a tendency to be skunky). Not a bad pilsner (on tap) with good hops and minimal malt. A notch above Heineken.

(On tap) This beer is a bit of a two-face. I must admit I have enjoyed it in the past when faced with the alternative of Tooheys. Drinking it today it had a very nice, typical German Pils aroma - tight malt with spicy hop. Very pale colour with very little head retention. Tasted thin, fizzy and even slightly cidery with a solid bitter finish. Average.
small head that dissipates quickly.   golden color.  a hint of bitterness at the finish but overall, a rather bland beer

First off, the aroma is completely revolting. Other than that it's not too bad of a beer, especially for a macrobrew. The flavor is alright. It seems like lots of people have gotten skunked bottles, that's a big problem for this brew... luckily mine was fresh. Anyway, it's not great, but it's certainly better than heineken.
pale yellow.  grainy malt and very faint grassy aroma.  nice flavour combo of cereally malt and cardboard in the flavour.

Becks is a decent lager, assuming you don't get a skunky one.  One step (a small one) better than Heineken, one large step below better German lagers.  The best thing about Beck's is that you can find it anyplace.  In a couple of the bars I hang shooting pool, this is the best beer available (yeah, I know, I need to find better hangouts).
A below average German pilsner, but better than your typical American pilsner.

I consumed this in a respectable manner, a 24oz bottle for some pre-game partying last night. This Pilsner has a watery palate, some malt, but mostly a non-fragrant hoppy bitterness, kind of skunky tasting, with a fizzy white head to be expected. Not that great a beer.

This was my first legal beer, had on my 21st birthday.  I wish I'd had something different.  Green bottle - minus points.  Chilled glass, too, probably did something to the flavor.  Unappealing yellow color.  Struggled to choke the last of it down.  Better than Budweiser, I guess, but not by much.
The hops on the nose and the pale colour didn’t turn me on but still I pushed on with tasting this beer, now that I have I wish that I didn’t. Pretty bland tasting beer.
Light golden in colour with little aroma. Dryness brings out nice hoppiness. over rated.

Light, clear, golden color with a thin head that dissipates rapidly. The aroma is skunky at first, but eventually reveals some sweet malt notes and a bit of hops. It has a light body and mild carbonation with a somewhat smooth mouthfeel. The flavor is malty up front with a decent hop flavor in the crisp, refreshing finish. Not the best German pilsener, but not bad at all. Very refreshing on a hot day.
Beware the green bottle. Better on tap but still a pretty bland macro pils. Mildly-hopped, pretty watery. Blah
A very crisp, slightly hopped wanna-be pilsner. A bit more flavor when drank on tap in Bremen. Quality varies in the USA.
normal boring macro pilsner. better than colt 45. green bottle skunky though.

Medium gold color, minimal head and no lacing. Mild hoppy aroma. Possibly a little fruity, dryish and slightly bitter finish. I suspect that this Beck's has been stretched since I last had it. It's not stale or skunky, but has the personality of a doorknob.

Ever wonder where this crap originally came from?
Well way back in 1874 in Germany, there was this old hobo-like bumb named Klaus Von Beck. He had a long lost uncle named Ludwick Von Beck who died and left good ol Klaus with an old abandoned brewery he had gotten from his grandfather. After months of searching the authorities found Klaus and told him the "good news"  Well Klaus was beside himself. Imagine a brewery just for him. So he rounded up several of his friends from the "Skid Row" of Bremen and commenced to have a big party on cheap wine, Sour Kraut, And Brauts, with some Occassional Oatmeal for Breakfast. This went on for days and days. When time came for Klaus' friends to relieve themselves, and not knowing the layout of his new inheritance, he just told them to go ahead and "do it" in the Big Vat in the brewhouse. Well after several weeks and "the party was over" Klaus noticed that the odors in the brewhouse were none too pleasant. He didn't know exactly what to do, and didn't want the authorities to come and fine him or put him in jail; and he didn't know where to dump this liquid emulsion in the vat. He then saw hundreds of empty bottles and decided he'd put this bodily excrement into them. It took a while, but he managed. Being a man with a good sense of humor, Klaus thought to himself... Geez if I cap these bottles off and sell them, I'd have a good joke going, and maybe make a few bucks too. Then I can leave the country with some money in my pocket. And So He Did, and that boys and girls is how Becks Beer was born.....

This Crap Tastes Exactly like an NA. Poured straw yellow with a bright white head that evaporated almost immediately, and had no lacing at all. Aroma was cereal-like and tasted just as bad as it smells. This stuff is just awful. Pass it Up!
After travelling through Europe I found I loved this beer the best. What the Germans lack in a sense of humour, they surely make up for in this Uber fantastic beer. Well Done Mr. Becks.

I don't know how I've managed to avoid rating this one, but now that I have I don't feel any sense of accomplishment.  This didn't have that signature rotten barley flavor something like Bush has, but had an extremely prominent metallic flavor that is nearly as bad. Leaves you feeling like you've been licking a sheet of stainless steel for the past half hour or so.
Very pale straw yellow with thin fizzy white head and sweet corn nose.  Medium to light body with more malt flavors than the American macros.  A very pleasant easy drinking beer.
Nothing exceptional about this one...just a classic pils. Still, it is somehow above the avarage mass produced pils.
Mediocre Euro-macro in the Heineken mold. Not enough hops to be a proper pilsner, almost pretending to be lager. Not terrible, not good either.

Golden color, mild hops in the aroma with skunk accents. Flavor starts with a little hop bitterness and then gets a bit sweet. Better than I expected, though still not so good, but definitely not the worst beer appearing in a green bottle.
Much better than Heineken, in the same boat with St. Pauli Girl, but otherwise nothing special.
Gold hue and typical skunky taste found in imports not handled with care.  Drinkable.

Bottled. Don't know why I should have expected anything of a macro sold in a bomber bottle for under $2 at Osco, but there you are. Smells like a Miller Lite. Pale yellow color under a fluffy head that dwindles quickly. Light malt taste leaves a touch of hops at the end. Some adjunct taste? Gassy. What you get in college to "impress" a first date. Eh.

Not bad for a macro. Straw yellow, average head, fastly diminishing. Grassy aroma and a clean and lightly bitter taste. A bit watery, but, actually, you CAN taste some hops in this beer, which is not true for many competitors' brews...
A shiny golden color on this german beer, bit it does not have the best of heads. A quite pleasant beer with a nice touch of bitterness.
Typical pils color with a small head. Some malts in aroma. Tastes a little to watery with some malt and some acidity. Finishes quick with some metallic notes.
Not too shitty. It may knock the untamed nose off its ass a bit but kind of grows on you after a while.  Is very similar to St. Pauli Heineken and Grolsch(but of course you all knew that already.)

I like the glass with the 0,5l mark (I bought it actually). As for the beer, it smells hops and cereals. No skunk presence in nose. Pilsner bitterness is not disappointing and separates this beer from most very commercial products. Lack of characteristic though, a little boring.
Not a bad brew,good color ,small head with the taste being in the usual macro range with a pretty good bitterness that gives it that little diffrence to put it slightly above a macro.
Typical green bottle beer grass smell. Slightly crisp and bitter tasting with a little metallic ting going on. Decent beer but not worth that import price tag.
this beer is much better known than it should be. it isn´t really that good.
a good beer, good tasting, good smelling.  not as good as bitburger but very good.  the germans know how to make cars, beer,  etc...  typical pilsner pour
Skunky, of course. Light on malt but has pretty decent hop presence. Dry, bitter finish. Crisp. This is a simple, mass produced German pilsener, and is kind of boring.
A very bad one. Smell bad, metallic taste .... and fallowed by a metallic after taste.
I'm surprised to see the lower rating on this one; I thought this was a very nice pils, if a bit plain.  A decent party offering, though I prefer the Becks Dark.

Had this in a can while on a rafting trip. Malty aroma with a subtle hint of hops. Slightly complex flavors without the skunky taste you get in the bottles, but with the metallic mouthfeel. Great beer for a hot day on the raft!
slightly skunked nose. taste is malty; very little bitterness; annoying metallic aftertaste.
Nothing like a German beer to brighten your day, clean, crisp, goes down easy.
Like St. Pauli , Heineken, and Bitburger, another frat boy special.."I look classy with this mass produced import", just very bland, very boring.

I'll second what Ingevara said. Everyone has tried this terrible brew. Why people pay so much for a "lightstruck, green bottled, skunked-out beer" is beyond my comprehension. Frankly, I don't care. This beer pretty much blows!
A thin tasteless soup without any traces of aroma or bitterness. An all through disappointing brew. Why does anyone pay for this?
From a can. Pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is a little skunky. Flavor is bready and  metalic. Some bitterness in the finish.
The flavor turned me off right away.  Not much of a head and not much for the smell either.  I was disappointed.

Very good for a mass produced pils. I personally can't get over the garden pea nose. Often skunked if bought off the shelf. Decent crisp taste but has a dodgey malt balance. Nice head, nice colour. OK for americans but we can do better here.
The more I drink Beck's, the more I don't like it. I guess that isn't good for Beck's, but oh well.

The aroma is a bit skunky, and hoppy.  The appearance is a clear light gold, with a thin bubbly white head.  The flavor is hoppy, and has a bitter aftertaste.  The beer is crisp and easy to drink.  Overall not bad.

Has a golden color with a good bit of carbonation and a lightly malted smell.  Taste is also lightly malted/skunked and finished a bit skunked.  Overall another green bottle euro-skunk beer, I am glad I tried it at a taste testing.
why is this beer so popular?  There is nothing special about this beer, let me tell you!

Uh oh, I can feel a flow of vitriol coming on. To all you Europeans, stop whingeing if this doesn't come up to your marque. You are spoilt for taste. To the plethora of American colleagues, geez you guys seem to have so much on offer from the local micros there that you can afford to be picky. Comments like JK's aren't that helpful for an Aussie when I am sure you can only get St Pauli Girl in only one or two places, and that would be in either of the twin cities! For a mass produced pils this is fine. I like the clean taste of the fresh ones we get here and find that the grassy nose is well complemented by the good hint of bitterness and mouthfeel. When Arnie said 'stop whining' he actually meant drink more beer. If I have to drink this I won't wine.

12 oz. bottle. I picked up a single the other day, just to try it side by side with it's light counterpart. I remember this as being much better years ago. Still, it wasn't the worst beer I've ever had, not by a long shot. Poured out a golden, more clear than yellow color. It has some malt aromas, and a faint background of hops, but not much more happening here folks. Tasted alright, but it had a metallic finish to it. Nothing to go out of your way for, however.
Very rich taste and also very appealing.  A great beer to have with a nice dinner.
Not what german beer really is. A woody hop taste with hardly any smell. fairly smooth to drink but I would stay away.

This beer used to be one of my favorites 15 years ago and I can tell you I like it more from this attractive 12 oz. can. This is the first time I have had a can of Becks. Pours with a graciuos head and nice pale ale like carbination. The smell is slight grain and and light floral citrus hop. No detection of unpleasant odors. The flavor is light malt and grains with a light hop flavor and bitterness. The best mouthfeel Ive found in a lager yet. Nice carbonation tingle. I suppose with my new found taste for IPA's, Imperial Stouts, and Barley Wines, I would have to call this a fine lighter beer.
Once again I payed a euro for a bottle of dishing water.  It didn't tasted bad, no, it justed didn't tasted at all.  Quite stupid, not?

A yellow beer with no head. The aroma is malty sweet - a nice aroma. The flavor is sweet, nicely malted, thin in the middle, and dying out in the end. The bitterness is slight but good. An OK beer - but somewhat boring.
Not necessary "the best of what Germans do best" as their slogan implies.  But still, not a bad lager.

I tried the "Bomber" variant of this beer.  I got bombed.  This beer has a light flavor that made it go down fast, hence the drunken stupor.  There was a slight fruitiness to it.  Worth trying again but nothing remarkable.
Sharp bitter hop aroma that transfers to the palate. Not bad to look at in the glass, but the brand has been done to death.

Oh my gosh I can't believe I drank this beer. Did I say "beer"? This was rot gut! It poured a medium head and had very little lacing to it. It had a fruity, citrusy aroma to it. It had a bitter taste and the aftertaste lingered and lingered. It was pale gold in color. There was no carbonation. It had a light body to it. Obviously, I was anything but impressed by this beer.  I am glad I have this rating out of the way!
1/4 draught: Very small head, clear urine colour. Little to no aroma apart from a hint of woody hops. Tastes rather bland + thin. Slight sweetness, slight bitterness. Too watery for me.
I didn't really like this one.  It came off as skunky and very bitter, and almost no finish except for more bitterness.

Pale gold colour with lots of fluffy white head. Very carbonated, almost looks like champagne. Very perfumy aroma, a bit skunky, too. The first few sips coated my mouth with a lingering very bitter and perfumy taste. Sweetened as it warmed to a very mild malty taste with a slight bitter finish.
Middle of the road pilsner.  Good on hot summer days.  I have other beers as my favorite though.
This is what I drink with my dad. I don't know why he likes it so much.  It has a pungent odor to it and a bland watery body with a bit of a bitter finish. Bad but not horrible.
This is a pretty decent beer. It's harsh when you first taste it, but it has a nice aftertaste. Takes some getting used to.

Body is light and golden with lots of bubbles.  Little head that quickly disappears.  Aroma is skunky and slightly hoppy.  Taste is hoppy and refreshing.  Finish is dry and slightly bitter.  A decent beer after a having some real beer first.  Better than most American/Canadian macros.

more of a europeanized "american standard" than a "pilsener".- perhaps a "european standard" category is called for.
a slight malt taste and some hops in the finish.

Certainly more "American Standard" than "Pilsener".  Skunked out, too.  Harsh is a word that fits this selection also.  I didn't wanted to finish the bottle.  File under: Heineken, Bitburger, Warsteiner.
Golden. White head.  Can have a skunky smell if lightstruck.  Flavor of hops and some sour taste.  Serve cold.  St. Pauli Girl is a better alternative
Pale golden body, carbonation looks fake to me.  Hints of subdued earthy hops and floral tones.  Sweet and malty in character.  tastes well, not good.  Dry corn and a wierd emptiness left in mouth.
It's OK, decent flavor, but nothing special.  Slightly acidic palate. Drink Beck's Dark instead.
Sharp taste, best served very cold. Thin head and can seem watered down at times.
As Incarpathia says, I prefer Beck's over Heineken as well.  Had on tap, nice bitter flavor.  Fairly smooth drinking.

I much prefer Beck's over the more popular Heine here in the US.  It is a bit above average as a pils but there are better beers out there.  Another "go to" beer when the selection is minimal on the list or at the store.
A very odd tasting beer with its distinct "skunky" aroma and flavor. I don't mind the taste although i prefer to drink it after a meal. Not much head to speak of.

Ok, but nothing special. If every aspect of this beer were increased by 50% (meaning half against as much aroma, color, and taste especially) then it could be very nice.  The flavors are good...but weak.
Bright yellow in color yet maintains a good lager flavor. Not a real noticable aroma. Not as sweet as most American brews.
The best of the mainstream lagers which are widely avaiable. Quite expensive though.

Bottled: This is not at all a bad beer. Has a nice bitterness, but I find it a little too watery. The appearance is very bright yellow with not much head. Not much to smell, and the flavour is a little vague. Decent avarage pilsener.
Another beer in the Euro-macro vein.  Better than North American macros but other than the stronger hops flavour pretty indistinguishable.
Good solid beer..They actually sell this at Lions games in Detroit..Makes the team seem better.

Almost exactly the same as Heineken. This pours golden brown and is hoppily bitter as well. Though it seems less bitter than Heineken, they are essentially the same. Nothing worth seeking out but worth trying.
I can't remember the last time I actually sought out a Beck's to drink. It's hoppy but I don't think they do it in a very good way.
Ew.  A beer than manages to be worse than Heineken somehow..................
standard international lager. Use of noble hops is evident.  It is crisp and clean and uninteresting
What? I never rated this? I end up drinking it often enough... This is more or less a textbook lager, losing many points for its very inoffensiveness.
not a personal favorite. doesn't have the best take but i like stouts. .
i have pretty memoris of this one, drinking the cans on a studytrip to England! One of he better(or least worst) common-taste beers in the supermarket

Not bad. Had a better flavor and mouth-feel than many of the 6.99 a six pack microbrews I've had. (This was 9.99 for 12 cold bottles) Slightly bitter finish/aftertaste but it had a richer character than a lot of other beers I've had. I'd like to try this on draft sometime
This is a very good euro beer much better then heineken.  A little bitter but that gives it character.
The Bud of Germany.  Has a skunky smell and slightly bitter taste. Reminds you of the mass marketed Canadian beers.
Pale yellow with a light body and moderate bitterness. High carbonation with floral hop and pale malt flavors. Refreshing, but not impressive. Kinda like the Budweiser of Germany.
Golden colour, decent head. Light hoppy aroma. the flavour is hoppy and dry. A standard low-price German pilsener.
No better than many cheep American beers and it really isn't much different in style. Sort of a slightly richer Coors

drinkable but nothing special. hoppier than i expected. the commercial description is full of lies. there is no bouquet, there's not a full rich head, and most importantly there is *no* complexity at all to this beer.

This one kind of reminds me of Grolsch, even though it's a pilsner.  Something about the skunky taste/smell just makes it rather unenjoyable.  I've had it a couple times where it wasn't too bad, but overall, this isn't worth recommending.
An overpowering beer. It is full of german hop flavor. It's an interesting beer, but I found it difficult to drink.
Another hohum pilsener from Germany. They all taste, look, and smell the same.
Slightly better than the girl, imo, but the same unclean edge to it.........

Meh, I guess it is OK if you are into golden fizzy pilsners. Costs too much for what you are getting.  Seems to be nothing special about this beer, other than it doesn''t taste too skunky.  I''m an ale fan and I''m always reminded why when I try stuff like this.
Floral hops, malt, pepper and clove, bitter metal aftertaste.  Drinkable....

Drinkable beer, not too bad.  I keep it around for the ''all purpose'' beer.  It''s not the best German Pilsner at all, but it''s not terrible either.  Not the best aroma, but nothing lingers to make you wretch.  Smell this one before you drink it.  If it''s skunky, just dump it.

Not the greatest aftertaste, but a drinkable beer.  I bought it in a 5L mini-keg, so it did provide for some good times, and had the automatic distilling system in it so I''ll give it props for that....
Um... I guess it is drinkable if very bland. Fits squarely in the easy-drinking, inoffensive category which probably makes it such a world-wide hit. Strictly for heterosexual urban professionals.
A decent common pils. Not a whole lot to this beer, but it's very drinkable compared to some very domestic brews that are also available. So..

I believe that there is no such thing as a bad German beer only an average one, and this is it. Watery appearance with a slight malty taste hinting at what might have been.Its very easy to go down the ''if its mass produced it must be dull''approach but this does tend to reinforce that comment.Not bad just dissapointing but far more exciting than a lot of beers available in your average English bar.
your average import,skunky smell,clean slight saaz hop flavour,nothing worth buying but if you are at a party and they are giving it away...drink it.
Bland except for skunky aroma---green bottleitis?  Germany''s Bud but more flavor than our domestic s*@t
Skunky aroma, little head, hops present. ...................................
Credit is given for being one of the first exotic "impoted" beers I ever saw or tried.
a light bodied beer with a fair amount of hops..............................
Standart lager , call it pilsener . Not to complex , easy to drink , simple brew .  Low on taste , some biterness in aftertaste .
Bottled(330ml). -Just refreshing beer,golen colored, fruty, dry finish .....
It was the imported beer, thar I drank. The truth is, that it was nothing special. Recently I again tasted Becks. And again it dissapointed me.
This is what I drink when I can''t find anything else on the menu. not great, but it''s a step above the norm.
Weak color. Light, watery and fizzy. Had a pleasantly dry finish, though. ..
very uncomplicated beer, smooth taste makes it an anytime-drinker... generic beer plus one...
I wasent to pleased with this one, although i was already more than half Blitzed at the time. Drink Up .Cheers
Got a bottle for helping a buddy at work.  Weak looking (I prefer darks).  Cat pee was a suprise...Becks is up for sale, I''m going to pass.
Not bad. Not good. NOthing i would have on an everyday basis. Well actually it sux. Tasted like marijuana and cat pee.
watery but goes down pretty smooth..........................................

I don''t have too many complaints with this one--last sample not skunked.  Came across as a more bitter version of Heineken, with some evident hop aroma.  Rather middle of the road on the whole.  Not bad.
If I had to choose between Becks (the real stuff in Germany) and any beer from Andhowsyour-Bush, it might win.

Imagine my disappointment to step onto a Lufthansa plane and this was all the German beer they had.  Still, in contast to the skunky Becks you get in North America, in the Snoor you can get a decent pint of fresh, if a little bit heavy, hop-accented Becks, with unclean malt notes and a little too much "cat's piss" aroma for my liking.

Skunky aroma/flavor. The funk of the skunk pervades this beer. I should have known better, buying it in a 24 oz. bottle, without the protection afforded by cardboard on a six pack. Seems more watery than water somehow. Very fizzy and might be the palest beer I've ever seen. Bad, even for a "european" (green bottle) lager. I didn't taste any hops, sorry; this is an american standard all the way. Pilseners have hops.
This is by far NOT "the best of what German''s do best!"  average pilsner at best

Becks is one of my staple beers that I usually have around.  It''s easy to drink and doesn''t really take much to enjoy ... as long as you like green beers.  It''s not a great beer, but sometimes it''s nice to relax and just enjoy.
With the many alternatives in the pilsner market I would keep going after spotting Becks in the supermarket aisle. Nothing special but not worth ripping apart.

They said I have to improve my ratings. Ok. The aroma of this beer is good. The appearance of this beer is good. The flavor of this beer is good. The palate of this beer is good. My overall impression is a positive one.

So there.
not a particularly memorable beer. but it does taste okay...................

had some of this a couple of weeks back during the honkytonk festival in leipzig. it actually had a pleasant hoppy aroma and tasted very fresh. so i had ro revise my thoughts a bit. maybe it´s not too bad

Comparable to Heinekin only not quite as skunky. Mild bready flavor. Some hops and bitterness in the finish. 24 oz bottle good as an alternative to a 40 when  your broke and looking for a brew and don''t really want to get trashed on malt liquor. Don''t bother otherwise.
I never pay for Beck''s but wind up drinking it at least once a year.   ....
Bland and finishes badly, worse than Bud..................................

Drinkable but unremarkable.  Noticable hopy bitterness but there are much better beers for to purchase.  I drank this one and the becks dark at a lounge in the deep woods of tennessee.  Given my other choices (use your imagination) I was not too dissapointed.
not my kind of thing.  pretty skunky and gross.  not worth the money at all.
Typical and best north(!) german pilsener. Pretty hoppy, dry with its particular freshness. Formally shining with nice head and hoppy aroma. Not really much body. Germany''s most exported beer.
Great expensive beer, have a little cash? get Becks, for special occasions..

My rating is not only because of this beer is brewn 5 minutes from my flat but it might be because as a born Bremen citizen you almost grow up with Beck''s as your "master taste" to compare other beers to...
Light gold, with a small head.  Taste and flavor were both mild.  Seems to be hit or miss with this one.
Yellow with a noticable skunk flavor.  It''s like a thousand needles picking my mouth.  Light and watery.  A little bitter, but nothing to get excited about.
Light yellow color, looks almost like sparkling apple juice.  The aroma has a slight hoppiness to it, however the taste does not back it up.  Not bad for a pilsner, however, I don''t like pilsners.
A rather boring beer, and not very hoppy as the description claims. Everyone one of these I''ve ever had has been skunky.
Straw gold. Flowing head. Smells hoppy. Not my favorite. THe same to the dry bitter end.
This is not German beer. It is to American to be a good German brew!........

Consistently good, but for the price there are a lot of better brands.  Not the best German pilsner either.  Very drinkable - because there isn''t much flavor.  A beer - flavored calistoga?  At least you know what you''re getting.
Very crisp and clean taste. No distinct flavors, but that''s not all bad....
Not a bad beer, but there are better imports out there. It's a shame that this is the beer American's think of when they talk about a German Pilsner.

Has a funky aftertaste but this is just about as good as a German lager gets.  Expensive for a comparable lager.  I would say it's not worth it but it is pretty good.  No head, rich golden color, sharp dry taste.

Rerate Revisited again after 11 years. Overall not a bad German lager - much better in can as I had today. Lacks the skunkiness usually found.  Tastes have change after 11 years.  Original 3.0  Kind of like McDonalds - you know what you are going to get going in.  Good reliable standby when nothing local is available.  Smooth, crisp, not too skunky of a aroma. One of the best of the ’Macro-imports’.

St Pauli, Heineken, Becks All taste the same to me, Well except for the little things. You know the little things! Would rather have a St Pauli Girl, damn that bitch is hot. This one time finished a St Pauli Girl and when no one was looking I put my peins in the bottle and proceeded to have my way with it. Hahahaha, that’s a joke, but im sure there is a sad enough soul out there that has probably done that. My prayers go out to you buddy. Aside from sticking my dick in the Becks bottle, I felt it to be average to better than average beer.
Not the greatest, but not the worst.  It's drinkable........................

$1 a beer isn't a bad deal but I wouldn't say Becks is really worth a dollar. The casino in Vegas I bought this from must have had too many in stock cuz they were sure pushing the Becks. Slightly resembles beer, although maybe it should be classified as a sparkling water. Maybe they gave me a non-alcoholic by mistake:(
Surprisingly, Beck's.  It's not bad if you're already buzzed................
not too bad. not too good either. it's drinkable, but not if it's overpriced.
Not too bad but there are much better choices out there for less money......
mwould try it on tap at a bar, not bad, not great, a little overpriced IMO.
average pilsener. Aroma stinks. Soft bitter taste...........................
Lt gold color, medium head. Mildly hopped lager. Taste and flavor are mild. Finish is clean and mild. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
The added hops to this export style pilsner make it quite pleasant. It is not as appalingly bland as most people seem to claim, though it is by no means a beer of distinction.
Poppy seeds and cereal bathing in hostile skunk bitterness..................
Nice Pils, light on taste, crisp and clean finish. .........................

i havnt had alot of beers but i havehad  some that rated better than this.... i dont know how they got the ratings because this isthe bestbeer i ever had.haha someone compared this to michelob? what an idiot michelob is crap to this.

Becks tag line should be "The worst of what Germans do best".  An insipid brew from the land of fine beer.  The malt has no distinct character, and neither do the hops, apart from a slightly metallic aftertaste (am I still smelling the cap?).  In the states a Michelob is just as good at a much lower cost if you want a boring beer.

Mild aroma of metallic, piney hops. Straw color with minimal head. Mildly astringent clean, watery taste. Properly carbonated. Nice clean and dry, hoppy finish. Classic weak, commercial German pilsener.

I only drank this because, A: It was on tap B: I hadn't tried it before C: (most important) I wasn't paying. And neither should you, as it is not an experience worth paying for. Very pale, thin, yet not crisp, just another non-descript weak lager.
