Not great stuff, but it gets the job done when your looking to get tanked. Thats about the only reason I'd drink one of those beers. Other than that, its basically Heineken, but a little better

Hard to find a non-skunkified one.  Either way, it's barely worth the search.  In the best of worlds, it's light and watery with slight flavor.  I the worst, it's a skunky mess.  With everything that that entails.
typical beer from Northern Germany. Light, no taste, no body, boring........
Typical german beer aftertaste. not my first choice but not my last either..
A good German beer that is good for drinking as an everyday beer.  Nothing special
another average german beer that they're trying to pawn on Americans.  Nothing spectacular.  Another iffy pilsener

Golden color with a light head.  Aroma of slightly stale noble hops.  Slightly stale start with some undertones of really nice malt.  The age/shipping faults distract to much from the good flavors.  Dry sharp finish. Mid-level pils at best.
Coors Light pale yellow with a faint hop(?) aroma. Alight hop bite with flavors of corn husk and skunk. Not a good way to end the weekend.

Not bad but not great... I used to drink this all of the time but have since moved on to better things. Green bottle doesn't help it's case much for its tendency to cause skunkiness (i say this in all of the reviews... oh well)but is definitely nice and hoppy with slight malt flavor typical of this type of brew. nice dry finish as the description says, yet not a very lingering or exciting finish. A regular beer that I find quite refreshing and better, yes better, than most I find in my grocery store... better than the dark I would say
A tall step above heineken.  A little bland, but not horrible.  If it was on sale, I'd buy some....AND DRINK IT!
there is nothing good to say about this..piss in a bottle??not good..nasty..
Malty, fruity, bit skunky aroma. Bitter, bit herbal, soapy flavor...........
This beer is not very interesting to me. It is easy drinkable and good against thirst, but no wonder!

This is a good beer.  I admit the odor can be a little overpowering (although I never mistook it for broken wind), but I really enjoyed the taste.  To me this beer is the quentessential example of a German Pilsner.
Good beer, slightly bitter and doesnt really quench thrist .................

Probably more of a Northern German Lager, it has great aroma and tastes of pale lager malts. Very refreshing. Do not be tempted to drink out of the bottle it is much better apreciated in a tall lager/pils glass.

5/09/02: I really don't even consider this a "pilsener."  It is very typical of the  North German lager style that is decidedly lighter-bodied than its Bohemian brethren.  Aroma reflects the hoppy bias, but is extremely light, and its midday-sun color confirms its light character. Moderate  carbonation accentuates mild hoppy bite...Finish is moderately hoppy-dry.  This is a very refreshing drink, but shouldn't be confused with nor derided for not being better-balanced.  It isn't supposed to be...Re-Rate 8/07/02: Having this at a weiner roast...Pale color is appealing, but head fizzled-out almost immediately...hops provide dry bite but not much flavor except in the finish...body is a tad watery, even for this buoyant style...I'll drink this occasionally on a warm day as a "starter" but it is hard to recommend at import prices...just not enough going on here.
The green bottle led to a skunked beer. It was straw pale and flat and skunked. I will need to rerate this with a fresh bottle.
I used to like this stuff...That's back when I was young and stupid.  Pilsners are the blind beggers of the beer world.  The ones that stink.
pils is pils.  a good drinking beer for long nights but otherwise unimpressive.
Skunky aroma, clear straw appearance,crisp stale finish.....................
Nothing special. Its taste is forgetable....................................
When my roomie opened this, I first thought that he farted. It was that bad. The taste wasn't terrible, but you could still do better.
Smell was overpowering, I didn't even have the cap off and I could already smell it. Went down surprisingly well though. Still, I wouldn't reccomend it.
man this beer is pricey but i liked it after i had it a few times it grows on you.  good beer
Bla.... I wish some restaurants would offer better beers. Or maybe I should switch to better restaurants.
There are better German pilsners than this and I should drink them instead.

Good flavor, the taste is exactly what youd expect from the color. Leaves a nice taste in your mouth when your done. The head is a bit weak, and it tastes much better if you can get it in draft form. Decent beer overall for the price.

I really liked this beer at first.  And then I kept drinking it, and I like it less and less each time.  Short finish, decent body and head, but the taste is nothing special.  Definitely better massed produced German beers out there.
Overall decent pilsener, but like all German pilsener, it smells pretty bad. Overripe hops or something. Perhaps it's the water of the Ruhr-area :-P
Overrated, overpriced, somewhat skunky Heineken alternative.................
becks is ok,somewhat crisp start,mine would have been better if it didnt smell like a skunk! cant drink more than a couple before i begin to despise this swill!
Slightly better than Heineken.  Only slightly...............................
So very similar to Heineken.  It lacks complexity.  Not worth the money.....

my friend from England suggested this one time and I hate heineken so i was hesitant, but it wasnt too bad. Cleaner than Heineken, with a more even taste.  Dosent have that cheap, fake, knock your socks of bite to Heineken. not terrible, but, then not great.
I find it ironic that one of the least interesting German beers is the most widely available in Australia.
hand me a becks beer i'll sing you a song...................................
Tastes a lot like Heineken, maybe not quite as good.  Not bad, but certainly nothing to get excited about.
Pale yellow. Bready, stickily sweet, bland. Some bitterness at the end, but that doesn't save it.

It has a little bit of Pilsener character, but beyond that, this was pretty boring, bland, watery, etc.  I thought the Purity Law meant something, but the last two beers I've rated sort of dispel that notion, as they were particularly bland.  At least I don't get an adjuncty rice/corn character in this.  Appearance-wise, it's the most watery I can remember.  Some skunking in this bottle.

At least I didn't land a terrible skunky bottle, which is more than I can say for most other lagers/pils that I've had lately.  My German friends certainly enjoyed this at a picnic tonight, but after sampling this, I went back to slightly better brews.
Not as skunky as I expect from a green bottle, but not very good.  Another boring German light beer.
its an ok brew. nothing id run to buy.......................................
One of the few Macrobrews from the Germans that I can deal with. I don't think it is as skunky or as bad as Heineken, but it somehow seems to get more of a rap then it does
A good pils, really...not too strong in any one dimension, but has the right kind of aroma, and decent tast and mouthfeel. Sure isn't too corny/chemically.
A mild adjunct-fest that's decent and drinkable, but not noteworthy.  Not much of a pils taste.
No taste. I will probably re-rate it........................................

Some hops, but mostly a sweet tangy adjunct aroma. Nice golden color. Foamy head that dissipates quickly with slight lacing. Medium-heavy fizz. Watery. Hoppy and sweet. Good flavor. Slight bitter after but overall a good everyday beer that's crisp and refreshing.

Not too bad for an imported macrobrew. Dry and crisp taste with a bit of hop bite on the backend. As with pilsners, its a lighter bodies and flavor beer. Decent alternative when nothing else is available.
Easy drinking, clean pilsener with a good amount of bitterness.  Its description of a dry, clean finish is right on.
Fresh hoppy bitter beer, but nice bitterness. Colour is a light yellow. It's nothing special just a refreshing normal Pilsner. "Unfortunately filled in green bottles" (Pivo :-))

Pale yellow (with a slight tinge of green) clear colour with a shortish lasting large bubbled head. Weird faint aromas including, silica, fish and sappy-hops. Small to medium body, short zingy bitter sweet palate and soft bitter pleasant clean finish. 
(Rated 24/5/02; Dolomite Alps; Italia)
Its an OK beer... but with all the selections of brew we have these days, it was pushed to the back a long time ago.
Nice and clean taste.  A bit thin, but don't let it fool you.  Very refreshing and smooth.  Not hopsy at all.

Becks is a mass-produced German beer, and you won't find me denying that fact.  However, it is excellent in cans.  I highly stress that everyone drink this beer from the can and not the bottle, it simply doesn't do it justice.  I get a case of pint cans in central jersey for $21... how can you beat that?  That's about as cheap as Bud for christ's sake.  Detractors can say what they want, but in the end, i'll be wasted off of this stuff laughing at you.  Great taste, not to high in calories, 4.8% abv.  What more could you ask for?

I love it. I could drink 100 of these, what a great german lager. Yes

As it happens, i drank about 20 or so of them for a banquet and got in pretty rough shape.

Very smooth, very enjoyable! I went in thinking that this was going to be similar to most major American beers, but was pleasantly surprised! It went down easy, and I found it to be highly drinkable. Bottoms up!
Bottle.  A distinctly dry and clean beer.  Contains some of the skunkiness typical of this style, but not as overpowering as some beers.
Pretty middle of the road.  A little carbonated for me, but it is better than St. Pauli Girl.

Mmm. I loved tha ftertaste and finish on this beer. Lot's of body, with a good aftertaste that is .... well different from most beers. A positive one, though, I must say. Much less "skunkiness" than Heineken, but, heck everybody knows the Germans didn't let all their brewing secrets get to the Netherlands. I would rate this beer just a bit below St. Pauli Girl as an import.
I am not a fan of pilsners to begin with, and this one reminds me why.  Its right up there with every other highschoolers beer.

I believe this beer deserves a bit more credit. It's a great everyday Pilsner, with a respectable clean crisp taste.

It's my staple beer (not my favorite) - sort of the "rich man's" Bud.

I might not be rich, but I usually have a sixer of this on hand.
Bleah -- why anyone would drink this is beyond me.  Sure it's marginally better than bud, but if that's your standard, you won't appreciate my criticism anyway.
nothing special. a little bit more than average.............................

Not that it's saying much, but this is one of the better Macro pilseners on the market. Better than the standard supermarket fair but not on par with good micro's. If it's this or Bud/Miller, etc...I will take Beck's every time. But then again, who wouldn't?
Nice  beer.  Choose Heneiken  if you can but pretty much the same stuff.  H is  a little more bitter but  pretty much  the same stuff.  I like it.  Good aroma  and clor.
I guess it's better than Bud...  But is it?.................................
A very ordinary beer.  Light on hops.  A good alternative to some other beers, if you need to bring cans.

A commercial but refreshing pilsener - nothing wrong, nothing special. Rerate: Had my first can today (bottles and draught previously). Extremely light coloured, possibly watered down version for Norway? (ABV 4,7%) The one I had on tap in Holland a month ago was very light coloured too. Am I right that the colour was slightly darker a few years ago?? Anyway, it's still a drinkable pils, but not an aroma or flavour that will linger in your memory.
Mild hop smell. Golden, with slim head. Quite bitter. Grassy after taste. Ordinary.
Probably my favorite beer to drink after a night of drinking. Nice bite.....
Average lager, with rather bitter skunky aftertaste. A little pricey........
Skunky and flat. Not enjoyable at all.......................................
Hoppy, bubbly, slightly skunky, a little bitter but not the good kind of bitter. Not worth paying import prices.
Ok for a macro, bad for a German Pilsner....................................
Not bad, not great.  Heneiken is better, but this is better than the Americans.  Still not very good for a German.  Go find yourself a Paulaner.  You'll be glad you did!!!!
Enjoyable But sour better beers can be had much cheaper.  This was typical for a pilsner, a strong flavor of hops with a slightly sour aftertaste.

I am doing something that I would not normally ever do. I am going to rate this beer based on my experiences with the sales and marketing staff that this company employs. So here it goes- THEY SUCK.
Ok, really not too bad a beer for a mass produced German lager. It would probably get a 2 or 2.2 if it weren;t for the idiots that work for the North American sales force.
WHEW- I feel better now.
Not a bad beer if you're looking for something with a lighter taste along the lines of Heineken.
Very German, but too hoppy for my likes.  Poors okay and I occassionally have problems with varience from bottle to bottle.  I prefer their dark beer.
Pretty much a disgrace to German Brewing. When I had it, it was a tad skunky and flat. Drink St. Pauli Girl, it's a little better.
This sucks just as bad as Heineken but more bitter.  Help!..................

I don't understand why this even cracks the 2.0 barrier.  It has to be one of the worst german pilseners.  Ice cold it's drinkable, but towards the end of a glass it becomes downright foul, almost resembles Bud Light.

Not a favourite beer of mine. Not a bad drink, but inferior to most German lagers and with a number of faults - overly gassy, too often skunky and slightly too bitter. Little character either. Awful if not served cold.
Crisp and smooth with a toasty flavor.  Not the greatest beer, but not bad either.

it tasted like a german pilsner aftertaste blended with a Budweiserish palate taste. I enjoyed it best with a nice cigar. Not the best tasting beer out there, but it was smooth, nice, plain-pilsnerish aroma. definitly a beer better from the bottle.
this is just a very average german beer. it is a lot like hansa pils, only more expensive. okay aroma and bitterness.

Light straw colour with strong nose of a clean garage, kind of metallic and oily. Like  someone's wearing  a cheap cologne lingering in the background and slightly in the taste and palate as well. Too bitter for me, lacking complexity and balance.

This beer has a balanced flavor and quality taste with a slightly dry and crisp finish. It is not bitter, like you’d expect some German Pilsener beers to be, and it is not over-poweringly strong (4.8% alcohol by volume).
No argument from me that Becks isn't the best German brew, but I enjoy it a great deal.  It goes down very easy.

After living in the area of Bremen for a couple of years, I realized that if the locals refer to Becks as "piss vasser", they might be on to something. Compared to other brews from the area this pils is not too impressive.

A bit off on first nose (though I still think "skunky" is the most overused - and abused - term in beerdom),
but a dry, hop-predominant flavor with much more character than the average Pilsner.  I feel sorry for Becks.  It is a very good (not awesome) German beer, but is one of the first "German" 
beers many people try, and after a long diet of American Dishwater, this beer would indeed taste "lousy".  But it's a better brew than that - it always brightens my smile to see it offered in a restaurant.
almost always skunked.  and even when it's not, it's a below average pilsner.

I do like this but it is nice to have something to nibble on with it.  As is the tradition of green bottles, this smells and tastes VERY skunky.  I like the skunkiness of Moosehead but this is quite a bit more harsh than Moosehead.  Not a bad beer and I would buy it again, but this would be one of the last beers I would want to drink 20 of.

Quality seems to vary, possibly due to combination of green glass and long shipping distance. When it's not off, it's a decent pilsner with noticeable hoppiness, very clean finish, but it's no Pilsner Urquell. It would rate a little higher if it were more consistent.
It tasted like nice export lager - cool, crisp, and tasty...................
The only decent stuff freely available over here.  Its just a pity its so bloodly expensive.
I used to like this beer, but its pretty much similiar to any other massed produced lager, perhaps a bit cleaner and crips or something.
The lightest flavoured German pilsener on the market with insipid bitterness and a slighty sweet aftertaste. Skunky on the nose.
A poor Heineken ripoff, especially considering Heineken isn't that great either.  This one's a loser.
Not too bad but I'll stick with American and English beers that have some taste and body.
Tastes of beer unlike other pub drinks claiming to be beer..................
A refreshing beer which I would have given more points to if the pleasant malty flavour and bitter aftertaste wasn't spoilt by a faint but none the less ever present skunky smell.

Bottle (BB 03/08). Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light to medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain, husks), lightly hoppy (herbs), with a note of DMS. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter, unclean/husky. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Poor.
Decent German Pilsner. Better in the bottle than on tap. If it comes down to Becks or Heineken, you better bet it's Becks.
German mass produced beer, its ok but with so many better choices out there, why buy it?

Had a bottle of this today.  This brew pours with a clear light yellow/golden bottle conditioned appearance.  The fine folks at Becks know how to put a head on a beer.  The huge white head is as near to creamy as I can imagine a frothy head to be.  It is mostly lasting with excellent lacing.  The hoppy/yeasty nose is light and clean with hints of perfume, spruce, soap and is also slightly metallic.  As one would expect in a pilsener, there is not an abundance of taste.  The initial flavor is moderately sweet with a lightly sweet to light bitter finish of short duration.  The brew has a light palate with a  watery texture and soft carbonation.  This would hit the spot BIG TIME on a hot day in the middle of August, but isn't doing much for me as I watch the snow flurries outside.  Overall an above average brew, and I would prefer this to any of the domestic American standards that dominate my nearest retailer's shelves.
Nice beer. Crisp on the palate and pleasant aftertaste......................
Bitter, but in a fairly good way. After a couple you will begin to like it even more.
I really like this beer. Clean, crisp and goes down easy what more do you want
Horseblanket aroma. Pale golden, white rocky head that diminishes fast, no lacing. Watery, no maltiness or sweetness, bit hoppy. Finishes more bitter.
Just not my cup of tea, or should I say, mug of Brew........................
It has that hoppy taste that many German brews have. When you love that taste so much you give yourself the moniker "hopshead", you know a beer like this will rank high.
kinda tastes darker than it really is... pleasant aftertaste................
i like this brew here alil weak for being a german brew but still not bad at all

Slightly skunky nose on my sample. Not very impressive
color. A grainy, malt taste, with a touch of hop
bitterness. Nothing special. Thin and refreshing.
Average German pils, I guess.
What can I say, its' German, but if you have ever had a real german pilsener, this can't compare.
A decent pils that is made almost entirely for non-German beer drinkers.  I won't turn down a free one.
Looks great and that's about it. Dull, insipid and uninspiring. Not to mention the price in the UK - £2.50 - £3 a bottle!! - No Way
Not watered down tasting, but not terribly flavorful either.  Slight bitter finish gave it enough kick to not be a bad beer, but I dont think Ill be seeking it out any time soon.
Another average beer, gets the job done and d tastes decent.I found it to be a little filling but still not to bad.

For lightweights only. Little flavor, kind of crisp brew. You could do much worse, and i am currently rewritng this after being a bit harsh the other night. Drop some on your tired Heineken friends, and maybe you can convince them to try something else.
Nothing goes better with a Yankees game.....................................
Not a top notch beer A little yeasty........................................
My dad used to drink this stuff,why Dad? ...................................
had this once.. and I think the one I tried was very old.  while it was skanky I still finished it.  so that must mean it would be a solid beer if fresh.
Nice grassy hop notes and a bittersweet maltyness leading to a dry finish. Reasonable north German Pils but not a patch on Jever.

This is my preferred beer for drinking...  This beer does not have the regular "skunky" taste found in several of the other Green bottled German Beers.  This is not the world best beer, but is very palatible.

This is the last of my "world's best beers when we were in high school" reviews, which were Heineken, St. Pauli Girl, Grolsch, and this.  It's a wonder I pursued the hobby when I thought the best that the world had to offer was skunky beer in green bottles!  Anyway, Beck's occupied a position about equal to the others, we didn't seem to buy it as much though.  I'm told that this is considered cheap crappy beer in Germany, and I have to believe it.
Very poor german pils.  It's drinkable when ice-cold, but toward the end of the glass it's damn near foul.
Skunk!  I usually like german beer so I expected to like this one too.  Not the case, though.
A trailer Park favorite around the world!...................................
I was quite surprised by this one. The "green bottle" and all. It had the usual Skunky smell for a green bottle but not trace of it in the taste!
a little sour on the palate but otherwise a pleasant beer...................
Another one of those wonderful "Green Bottled" beers from overseas, I might say. Smelled overly skunky for my liking.
Defines Skunky.  Sour rather than bitter.  Germans should be ashamed of this.
taste like watered down Heineken.  .........................................
Will not kill you but it's a bad beer, even by German standards. Just as bad as Heineken.
Basically Heineken without as much punch (if you cna say heineken has a big punch). I bought it 'cause it was in a trendy lil keg that fit in my fridge. I drank it while eating lucky charms.
I ahd way better pilsners than this one. very light taste. Finishes bitter but again one of these beers which you only enjoy when they are ICE cold.

This is what I would call a 'safe' beer. That means I would drink it if it was the only beer I knew in a cr*p bar. Can often be bitter, and varis a lot from one bottle to the next. Is much better out of the tap.
Gawd, not even Germans drnk this sh*t.  That's why it's exported to the US, known as the land of people who don't know a good beer.  Skunky, bitter, looks OK but aargh.
This beer always (at least on the few times I forced myself to try it again) tastes skunky to me. It is crisp, but fouly pungent and unbalancedly bitter to an extreme extent.

Quite often I get skunky becks beer which puts a damper on it. If I get a good one in the batch then it is usually great and enjoyable. I try to stay away from it due to the fact that I get so many skunk-like beers.
The aroma promises decidedly too much. Tart and unpleasant..................
I used to drink this in college, but after tasting it again I remember why I stopped.  It's just average in every way, nothing special, but not the worst beer around either.
Above avergae flavor. Crisp, a little tart but in a good way. Perfect carbonation. Only thing bad about this stuff is that you tend to run into skunkers. Fine product for what it is.
OK on tap, not a great pilsener though......................................
If it's going to be Becks, I'll take a Becks Dark please, this sh!t sucks...
Again, I am not a lager fan, but this is a really, really--did I mention REALLY? bad lager.  I drank one about 30 minutes ago and I still have that crappy feeling on the back of my tongue
This has to be one of the worst beers I've ever had. Smells like skunk and tastes like skunk. I thought I was drinking a skunk in a bottle? Save your money and try anything but this swill.
tastes as though they're catering to the general public with a fairly bland flavor...but not TOO bad
Not the best that Germans can do.  Although a pretty decent beer............
Attractive pint.  Skunky megaeuropils aroma (heineken, warsteiner, grolsch.) This said, decent hop aroma. Not particularly unpleasant, yet not particularly good either.

Pale-yellow, almost straw-like color, with good carbonation and a nice (although short-lived) foam. Good whiff of floral hops that is instantly appealing. It’s a little perfumey, a little herbal (grassy) with a subtle underlying maltiness. The palate is light with a sharp spritzy carbonation. There’s some hoppy bitterness and dryness running across the palate but overall it’s predominantly sweet and lemoy. Used to be a fine beer in my younger mind. One of those beers that I’m not sure if it changed or if I changed. Have to call it a stepping stone beer now rather than a good pilsener.
Certainly better than Heineken but nothing special..........................
Not much to say not bad but there is definite better........................
Fine by me, but avoid the canned version....................................

Quite ordinary German brew. Has snob appeal for those who don't know any better. Rather light body with some hops flavor. Not bad if there's nothing better available but I consider Beck's to be over-rated. It amazes me the number of bars and restaurants that brag that they carry Beck's. Big deal. The beer barely exceeds most American offerings.
*Yawn*.  Garden-variety German Beer.  You could swap the labels on this and St. Pauli or Bischoff's and I'd never know unless I compared them side-to-side.

Nice hoppy lager with good body. Not complex, but quite drinkable. In Germany, a very blue collar brand mass market brand. Doesn't pretend to be what it is not. For forty years this has been "ol' reliable."
OK if you can't find anything better........................................

Very hoppy nose, nice straw colour.

My first German beer in ages, always good to come back to.
Just another all right lager! I've grabbed this one with me a few times on my way to get drunk.  You don't want to pick this one for that nice beer over a good conversation or with a great meal.
A decent beer.  Better than American macrobrews.  Usually a little too skunky for my tastes.
A fantastic beer that is often criticised simply because of it mass market appeal. Not as good as Bitburger or Warsteiner
A bit too bitter with no real taste to compensate. .........................

Does not taste like an American product. Perhaps a good choice for someone who wants to say they've tried an "import", but hardly an exciting or profound choice. Among top-selling German beers, Warsteiner is cleaner, Paulaner products are far more tasty. This is merely average.
It smells like pot and goes down smooth. A great beer to hold in your hand at a party.
Rather Boring German Beer, not particulary weak, there are many better German Pilsners

this is the most incredibly pale beer. it's utterly transparent. in fact both appearance and flavour highlight that overlooked ingredient sanctioned by the reinheitsgebot, water. incredibly light bodied. a very slight malt sweetness and a metallic hop tingle at the end. dry. bears much more of a resemblance to a decent pils than heineken or many other "green bottle beers".
Nice hoppy nose.  Nice bitterness in flavour, but only slight, and it fades on you.
I like my weed skunky, but not my beer. Someone told me this green-bottled European crap is supposed to taste skunky. That's about the dumbest thing I ever heard.

Hmmm.  Another overrated, over-popular (in USA) foreign macro; I would say it is certainly better than Heineken -- nice appearance, nice crisp, tart flavor, but overall just not distinctive, and with little in the way of beginning (nose) or end (palate).  Like many better macros, it's all about tolerating it while drinking it fast, and for that purpose it will serve.
One of the best German pilsners. Better than the American pilsners, but worse than the Danish.
First imported beer i ever tasted. Not bad, but bland. Not much nose, but finishes nicely. Similar to Toohey's Blue.
I guess I would drink this before some of the domestic macros.  I didn't care for it.
One of the worst german beers i have ever had. All others put it to shame. I will never drink this foul tasting brew again.
Not a bad beer at all. Very drinkable, but with almost no foam to it which is a turn-off to me.
Your average German beer.  There are better choices.........................

Not bad, but there is so many better brands of beer out there, that this is not really worth the trouble unless you're into buying their big bottles.
Wouldn't kick it out of bed, but wouldn't invite it in either.

The green bottle has struck again...Yuck! Foul, decaying brocolli aroma is the worst thing about this beer, making it almost unbareable to drink (unless holding your nose...but how ridiculous is that!?). Taste not quite as offensive, but...ah, why even bother? SKUNKED. Normally I wouldn't rate a beer I know is tainted and not a true representation of the intended product, however imports in green bottles are different. Because I have roughly a 50/50 chance of buying a spoiled bottle, a rating is warranted.
Fairly clean, lightly hopped, fair balance. I've gotten a few that were slightly skunky though, probably 1 out of 3 bottles.
Not an interesting beer: not good, not bad..................................

Certainly clean and light.  It doesn't taste especially watered down or non-beer like.  I found it a bit on the weet side with a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste.  Quite drinkable but but there are many more of this style that I'd prefer.
Becks a great beer.  Aftertaste is a bit strong but overall a wonderful taste.
The first "classy" beer I ever had.  Not bad, not great.  I prefer the Dark.

Grassy hop nose.  Standard pilsner color, pale golden.  Head is largely dissipated.  A fusion of malt and hop flavors, slightly sweet and white bread malt, with some very faint, dry, lightly spicy Saaz-y hoppiness.  Finish is very quick.  Tastes a lot like Heineken.
Dry, hoppy, mildly sulphuric.  Sadly, its often the best beer you can get at a bar.
This was not a good beer not even close to Hi-ney...........................
This isnt a bad beer for the price, when im short on cash or when I have a couple bucks leftover of my beer money, i'll pick up a couple 24 ouncers...
Basically it is slightly better than Budweiser. But its in that class. It tastes like what I would call a "beer" which means it tastes something like a Budweiser... and that isn't a compliment.
a pretty good beer. i haven't had too many german beers, but i definately enjoyed this one.
There just isn't a whole lot there. If you are going to buy a German beer you can do much better than this.
OK as far as widely available German lagers you might run into in a restaraunt or bar,  but nothing special.
boring, little taste, goes bad often........................................
REAL skunky.  Among beers popular in North America, only Molson Export is even close to being so skunked.  Beck's is one of the more overrated beers I've ever had.
I am not real impressed, but I sure would take this over damn near ANY American macro
Fair.  Not great.  Not a particularly refreshign beer.  Kinda heavy for a lager.  Ahh, what the heck, go get a six!!
